story:
Our project in brief

Scroll down for French and German versions. La version française et allemande est en dessous. Für die Deutsche und Französische Version, sehen Sie unten.

Africa Foot Academy (AFA) was founded in 2012 with an objective to empower the youth in Cameroon and enhance their life skills through soccer. Currently, the non-profit soccer academy provides training for 158 children and youth, many of whom are homeless. AFA supports these underprivileged children and youth by seeking them host families and funding their primary and secondary schooling. AFA improves their performance at school eg. through the help of volunteers providing after-school remedial teaching for those in need.

AFA offers the most talented youth players a path to professional sport, including a post in the academy´s FC-AFA soccer team, which currently plays in the Cameroonian third league with great development potential.

All training is offered free of costs, hence also the poorest families can take part in the training programs of AFA. This is unique in the Cameroonian soccer scene. Additionally, AFA supports also girls’ soccer and even has a girls’ soccer team.

Currently, AFA is about to invest in a bus, in order to provide a safe transport to its young players to soccer tournaments taking place around Cameroon. Due to bad condition of roads, bad driving habits and old vehicles, the road safety in Cameroon is close to non-existent. A number of deathly road accidents occur weekly. This is most unfortunate taking into account that alternative ways to travel are not available in Cameroon.

A 30-seat bus (second hand) will ensure the necessary stability and safety for our kids en route. Here we need your help! Every small contribution will bring us closer to this goal.

 

What We Need is a Bus - but WHY?

The bus is needed for tournaments mostly taking place around the West of Cameroon, the Littoral Region with distances up to 600 km. Currently, AFA owns a minibus with 12 seats. This bus, however, is in a very bad condition and not sufficient for our teams travelling with ca. 30 persons (including players and staff). Travelling by public/ private busses in Cameroon is extremely expensive but also dangerous due to old vehicles and bad roads. Road accidents occur regularly also to busses carrying 50 passangers or more.

A team bus will provide the academy flexibility and - above all - ensure the safety of our kids en route.


What You Get & What We Do

With 49 000 USD we will be able to by a stable, high quality second hand 30-seat bus in Germany and ship it over to Cameroon. Unfortunately, as is the case in many African countries, also in Cameroon the quality busses in good shape simply are not available for this price. Additionally, the second hand busses in Cameroon do not have a guarantee unlike the ones bought in Germany. Hence, shipping the vehicle from Germany to Cameroon is more rentable. 

Every contribution, no matter how big or small, will help us! If we raise more than 49 000 USD, the rest of the funds will be invested in the formal schooling of our young players (school fees, text books, school uniforms), especially of those coming from the poorest families or who are living on the streets.

Again, if we do not succeed to raise enough funds this time, our purchase will only be postponed. We will continue our efforts until we have reached the goal. We see the positive impact of soccer and team sport on underprivileged children and youth every day. This makes us push further.

For every donation, we will send you a HUGE VIRTUAL HUG!! Once we have bought the bus, every donor will receive an e-mail from us with news and photos of the bus in use.  

Below you will find a list of perks that we will send you in return for your donation.  

USD 10 : Virtual High Five!

USD 25 : Special Thank You Card

USD 50 : Exclusive AFA T-shirt & Special Thank You Card

USD 55 : Beautiful AFA team poster with signatures of players 

USD 55 : 100 % organic ECF Coffee (250 g/ 0,55 lb)  & Special Thank You Card

USD 65 : 100 % organic ECF Coffee (500 g/ 1,1 lb) & Special Thank You Card

USD 75 : 100 % organic ECF Coffee (1 kg/ 2,2 lb) & Special Thank You Card

USD 150 : Exclusive AFA T-shirt & AFA team poster  

USD 200 : AFA jersey with your name on the back & AFA team poster

USD 300 : Official teamwear of AFA: complete training outfit (jersey, shorts, socks) & Special Thank You Card

USD 500 : Official teamwear of AFA: complete warm up suit (jacket, long pants) & Special Thank You Card

USD 2000 : Donor´s name on the bus seat & AFA team poster & 100 % organic ECF Coffee & Special Thank You Card

USD 4000 : Donor´s name on the side of the bus & AFA team poster & 100 % organic ECF Coffee & Special Thank You Card


100 % Organic ECF Coffee

ECF Group, a Cameroonian management company, is the main sponsor of Africa Foot Academy. ECF Group produces premium gourmet coffee (Arabica and Robusta) and exports it in small amounts around the globe. ECF ensures fair wages for farmers. ECF coffee comes from small-scale family farms, using 100 % organic cultivation methods. To ensure the best quality coffee, only the ripe cherries are harvested and selectively picked by hand. Green beans are roasted with German know-how and packed for shipping. The entire production chain from harvesting to roasting and packing is kept in Cameroon, in order to bring the industry closer to farmers. ECF coffee will be available in the fall 2015.


How to Contact Us

Should you have any questions about the activities of Africa Foot Academy, our pitches or the campaign in general, please do not hesitate to contact us at Info@africafootacademy.com / africafootacademy@gmail.com

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any help you can give us to spread the word about what we are doing. Here's how you can help:

  • Help us make some noise! Use the Indiegogo share tools to send this campaign to friends and family.
  • Like our facebook page and share your favorite posts.
  • Retweet @Africa_Foot tweets whenever possible.
  • Visit our website at http://africafootacademy.de/?language=en and tell your friends to visit it too.
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

 

 Notre projet en bref

Für die Deutsche Version, sehen Sie unten.

Africa Foot Academy (AFA) a été fondée en 2012 avec un objectif de responsabiliser les jeunes au Cameroun et améliorer leurs compétences de vie à travers le football. Actuellement, l’académie de football à but non lucratif offre une formation pour 158 enfants et jeunes, dont beaucoup sont des sans-abri. AFA soutient ces enfants et les jeunes défavorisés en les cherchant familles d'accueil et le financement de leur scolarité primaire et secondaire. AFA améliore leur performance à l'école. grâce à l'aide de bénévoles dispensant un enseignement de rattrapage après l'école pour ceux qui sont dans le besoin.

AFA offre aux jeunes joueurs les plus talentueux un chemin au sport professionnel, y compris un poste dans l'équipe de football du FC-AFA, qui joue actuellement dans la troisième ligue camerounaise avec un grand potentiel de développement.

Toute la formation est offert gratuitement, donc aussi les familles les plus pauvres peuvent participer aux programmes de formation de AFA. Ce qui est unique dans la scène du football camerounais. En outre, AFA soutient également de soccer des filles, et possede même une équipe de football feminine.

Actuellement, AFA est sur le point d'investir dans un bus, afin de fournir un transport sûr à ses jeunes joueurs de tournois de football qui se déroulent partout au Cameroun. En raison du mauvais état des routes, mauvaises habitudes de conduite et des vieux véhicules, la sécurité routière au Cameroun est proche, voire inexistante. Plus de 60 % des morts au Cameroun proviennent des accidents routières. Ce qui est très malheureux en tenant compte du fait que d'autres moyens de voyager ne sont pas disponibles au Cameroun.

Un bus de 30 places (de seconde main) assurera la stabilité et la sécurité nécessaire sur la route des nos enfants. Ici, nous avons besoin de votre aide! Chaque petite contribution nous rapproche de cet objectif.

 

  

Nous avons besoin d'un bus - mais pourquoi?

Le bus est nécessaire pour la participation aux tournois qui se déroulent dans la region  de l'Ouest du Cameroun, de la Région du Littoral avec des distances allant jusqu'à 600 km. Actuellement, AFA possède un minibus de 12 places. Ce bus, cependant, est dans un très mauvais état et ne suffit pas pour nos équipes voyageant avec ca. 30 personnes (y compris les joueurs et le personnel). Voyager en bus public / privé au Cameroun est extrêmement coûteux, mais aussi dangereux en raison de vieux véhicules et de mauvaises routes. Meme les bus de 50 places sont à l’origine des accidents mortels et regulièrement.  

Un bus de l'équipe offrira la souplesse de l'académie et - surtout - assurera la sécurité de nos enfants sur la voix routière.


Ce que vous obtenez & ce que nous faisons

Avec 49 000 USD, nous serons en mesure d’acheter un bus stable de 30 places de haute qualité de seconde main en Allemagne. Nous l'expédions plus tard au Cameroun. Malheureusement, comme c’est le cas dans de nombreux pays africains, également au Cameroun les bus de qualités en bon états ne sont pas disponibles pour ce prix, tout simplement. En outre, les bus de seconde mains au Cameroun n’ont pas une garantie fiable, contrairement à ceux achetés en Allemagne. Par conséquent, l'expédition du véhicule de l'Allemagne au Cameroun est plus rentable.

Chaque contribution peu importe, grand ou petit, nous aide! Si nous attenions plus de 49 000 USD, le reste des fonds sera investi dans l'éducation formelle de nos jeunes joueurs (les frais de scolarité, les manuels scolaires, les uniformes scolaires), en particulière de ceux provenant des familles les plus pauvres ou qui vivent dans la rue.

Au contraire, si nous ne parvenons pas à réunir suffisamment de fonds cette fois, notre achat sera reportée. Nous poursuivrons nos efforts jusqu'à ce que nous attenions nos objectif. Nous voyons l'impact positif du football et du sport d'équipe sur les enfants et les jeunes défavorisés tous les jours. Cela nous motive à aller plus loin avec nos efforts.

Pour chaque don, nous vous ferons parvenir un REMERCIEMENT VIRTUELLE énorme !! Quand nous aurions acheté le bus, chaque donateur recevra un e-mail de notre part avec des nouvelles et des photos du bus en cours d'utilisation.

Ci-dessous vous trouverez une liste des avantages que nous vous ferons parvenir en retour de votre don.

USD 10 : Virtual High Five!

USD 25 : Spécial carte de remerciement

USD 50 : Exclusive AFA T-shirt & Spécial carte de remerciement

USD 55 : Poster d’ équipe d’AFA avec les signatures des joueurs

USD 55 : 100 % organic ECF Coffee (250 g/ 0,55 lb)  & Spécial carte de remerciement

USD 65 : 100 % organic ECF Coffee (500 g/ 1,1 lb) & Spécial carte de remerciement

USD 75 : 100 % organic ECF Coffee (1 kg/ 2,2 lb) & Spécial carte de remerciement

USD 150 : Exclusive AFA T-shirt & Poster d’ équipe d’AFA avec les signatures des joueurs

USD 200 : AFA jersey avec votre nom sur le dos & Poster d’ équipe d’AFA avec les signatures des joueurs

USD 300 : Teamwear officiel d'AFA: Tenue complète de formation (jersey, shorts, chaussettes) & Spécial carte de remerciement

USD 500 : Teamwear officiel d’AFA: Costume d’échauffement complet (veste, pantalon) & Spécial carte de remerciement

USD 2000 : Nom du donateur sur le siège du bus & Poster d’ équipe d’AFA avec les signatures des joueurs & 100 % organic ECF Coffee & Spécial carte de remerciement

USD 4000 : Nom du donateur sur le côté du bus & Poster d’ équipe d’AFA avec les signatures des joueurs & 100 % organic ECF Coffee & Spécial carte de remerciement


100 % Organic ECF café

ECF Group, une société de gestion camerounaise, est le sponsor principal d’Africa Foot Academy. ECF Groupe produit du café gourmet (arabica et robusta) et l'exporte en petites quantités dans le monde entier. ECF assure des salaires équitables pour les agriculteurs. ECF café provient de fermes familiales de petite échelle, qui utilisent 100% des méthodes de culture organique. Pour assurer la meilleure qualité de café, seules les cerises mûres sont récoltées et cueillies sélectivement à la main. Les grains sont torréfiés avec le savoir-faire allemand et emballés pour expédition. L'ensemble de la chaîne de la récolte, la production, la torréfaction et l’emballage est fait au Cameroun, afin d'amener l'industrie plus proche de l’agriculteurs. ECF café sera disponible sur le marché à l'automne 2015.


Comment nous contacter

Si vous avez des questions sur les activités de Africa Foot Academy, des avantages que nous vous ferons parvenir en retour de votre don, ou la campagne en général, s’il vous plaît, n’ hésitez pas à nous contacter à Info@africafootacademy.com  / africafootacademy@gmail.com


Autres façons d'aider  

Nous apprécions toute aide que vous pouvez nous donner en parlant un mot sur ce que nous faisons.

Voici comment vous pouvez aider:

  • Aidez-nous à faire du bruit! Utilisez les outils de parts IndieGoGo pour envoyer cette campagne aux amis et aux familles.
  • Commentez sur notre page facebook et partagez vos messages préférés.
  • Retweet @Africa_Foot á la mesure de votre possibilité.
  • Visitez notre site Web à http://africafootacademy.com/?language=fr et invitez vos amis à visiter aussi.
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

 

 Unser Projekt in Kürze

Africa Foot Academy (AFA) wurde im Jahr 2012 mit dem Ziel, die Jugend in Kamerun zu stärken und zur Verbesserung ihrer Lebenskompetenzen durch Fußball gegründet. Derzeit bietet die gemeinnützige Fußball-Akademie Schulungen für 158 Kinder und Jugendliche, von denen viele obdachlos sind. AFA unterstützt diese benachteiligten Kinder und Jugendlichen von der Suche einer Gastfamilie, bis zur Finanzierung ihrer Grund- und Realschulbildung. Durch AFA werden ihre Leistungen in der Schule verbessert zum Beispiel durch die Hilfe von Freiwilligen, die sich dazu bereitstellen außerschulischen Förderunterricht anzubieten.

AFA bietet den talentiertesten Nachwuchsspielern einen Pfad zu dem Profisport, darunter einen Platz in der offiziellen Akademie Fußballmannschaft FC-AFA, die derzeit in der Kamerunischen dritten Liga spielt, mit großem Entwicklungspotenzial.

Alle Schulungen werden kostenfrei angeboten, damit auch die ärmsten Familien an den Ausbildungsprogrammen von AFA teilnehmen können. Dies ist in der Kamerunischen Fußballszene einzigartig. Zusätzlich unterstützt AFA auch Mädchenfußball und hat sogar eine Mädchenfußballmannschaft. 

Derzeit ist AFA dabei, in einem Bus zu investieren, um einen sicheren Transport für seine jungen Spieler zu Fußballturnieren zu sichern. Wegen dem schlechten Zustand der Straßen, schlechtem Fahrverhalten und alten Fahrzeugen ist die Straßenverkehrssicherheit in Kamerun nahezu nicht vorhanden. Wöchentlich stoßen eine Reihe von tödlichen Verkehrsunfällen auf. Dies ist sehr bedauerlich, da keine alternativen Reisemöglichkeiten in Kamerun verfügbar sind.

Ein Reisebus mit 30 sitzen (aus zweiter Hand) würde unterwegs für die nötige Stabilität und Sicherheit für unsere Kinder sorgen und genau hier brauchen wir Ihre Hilfe! Jeder noch so kleine Beitrag wird uns ein Stück näher zu diesem Ziel bringen.

 

 

Was wir brauchen ist ein Bus - aber warum?

Der Bus wird für den Transport zu Turnieren die meist im Westen von Kamerun und an den Küstenregion mit Entfernungen von bis zu 600 km stattfinden benötigt. Derzeit besitzt AFA einen Kleinbus mit 12 Sitzplätzen. Dieser Bus ist aber in einem sehr schlechten Zustand und nicht für unsere Teamreisen mit ca. 30 Personen ausreichend (einschließlich Spieler und das Personal). Anreise mit den öffentlichen / privaten Bussen in Kamerun ist nicht nur extrem teuer, sondern auch gefährlich wegen der alten Fahrzeuge und schlechten Straßen. Verkehrsunfälle treten regelmäßig auf, sogar bei Bussen mit 50 Passagiere oder mehr.

Ein Team-Bus würde der Akademie Flexibilität bieten und vor allem die Sicherheit unserer jungen Spieler unterwegs. 


Was Sie erhalten & was wir tun 

Mit 49 000 USD werden wir in der Lage sein einen stabilen,  hochwertigen 30-Mann Bus aus zweiter Hand in Deutschland zu erwerben und ihn nach Kamerun zu verschicken. Leider ist diese Art von Qualitäts-Bussen in guter Form in Kamerun, wie auch in vielen anderen Afrikanischen Ländern, zu diesem Preis nicht verfügbar. Darüber hinaus haben die gebrauchten Busse in Kamerun keine Garantie im Gegensatz zu den in Deutschland gekauften. Daher ist der Versand des Fahrzeugs aus Deutschland nach Kamerun vorteilhafter.

Jeder Beitrag, egal wie groß oder klein, wird uns dabei helfen! Empfangen wir mehr als 49 000 USD, wird der Rest in die formale Schulbildung unserer jungen Spieler investiert (Schulgebühren, Text Bücher, Schuluniformen), vor allem in die die aus den ärmsten Familien kommen oder die die auf den Straßen leben.

Auch wenn es uns nicht gelingt, genügend Geld zu sammeln wird das unseren Kauf nur verschieben. Wir werden unsere Bemühungen fortsetzen, bis wir das Ziel erreicht haben. Wir sehen die positiven Auswirkungen des Fußballs und Teamsports an benachteiligten Kindern und Jugendlichen tagtäglich, was uns nur antreibt,

Für jede Spende, werden wir Ihnen eine RIESIGE VIRTUELLE UMARMUNG als Dankeschön senden!! Nachdem wir den Bus gekauft haben, wird jeder Spender eine E-Mail von uns mit Nachrichten und Fotos von dem Bus im Einsatz zu erhalten.

Nachfolgend finden Sie eine Liste der Vergünstigungen, die wir Ihnen im Gegenzug für Ihre Spende zu senden.

USD 10: Virtueller High Five!

USD 25: Besondere Dankeschön Karte

USD 50: Exklusives AFA T-Shirt & Dankeschön Karte

USD 55: Schöne AFA-Team Poster mit Unterschriften der Spieler

USD 55: 100% Bio-ECF Kaffee (250 g / 0,55 lb) & Dankeschön Karte

USD 65: 100% Bio-ECF Kaffee (500 g / 1,1 lb) & Dankeschön Karte

USD 75: 100% Bio-ECF Kaffee (1 kg / 2,2 lb) & Dankeschön Karte

USD 150: Exklusives AFA T-Shirt & AFA-Team Poster

USD 200: AFA Trikot mit Ihrem Namen auf der Rückseite & AFA-Team Poster

USD 300: Offizielle Teambekleidungen von AFA: Trainingsausrüstung (Trikot, Hose, Socken) & Dankeschön Karte

USD 500: Offizielle Teambekleidungen von AFA: Aufwärmanzug (Jacke, lange Hose) & Dankeschön Karte

USD 2000: Name des Spenders auf dem Bus sitz & AFA-Team Poster, 100% Bio-ECF Kaffee & Dankeschön Karte

USD 4000: Name des Spenders auf der Seite des Busses und AFA-Team Poster,100% Bio-ECF Kaffee & Dankeschön Karte


100 % Bio ECF Kaffee

ECF-Group, eine Kameruner Verwaltungsgesellschaft, ist der Hauptsponsor der Africa Foot Academy. ECF-Group produziert Premium-Gourmet-Kaffee (Arabica und Robusta) und exportiert sie in kleinen Mengen in der ganzen Welt. ECF sorgt für faire Löhne für die Landwirte. ECF Kaffee kommt aus kleinen Familienbetrieben, mit 100% Bio-Anbaumethoden. Um die beste Qualität Kaffee zu gewährleisten, werden nur die reifen Bohnen geerntet und selektiv von Hand gepflückt. Bohnen werden mit deutschem Know-how geröstet und verpackt. Die gesamte Produktionskette von der Ernte bis zur Röstung und Verpackung wird in Kamerun gehalten, um die Branche näher an die Landwirte zu bringen. ECF Kaffee wird im Herbst 2015 verfügbar sein.


Wie Sie uns erreichen

Sollten Sie Fragen zu den Aktivitäten von Africa Foot Academy, unseren Vergünstigungen oder der Kampagne im Allgemeinen haben, zögern Sie bitte nicht uns auf Info@africafootacademy.com / africafootacademy@gmail.com zu kontaktieren.


Weitere Möglichkeiten wie Sie uns helfen können

Helfen sie uns unsere Fan Community zu erweitern! Teilen sie diese Kampagne mit Freunden und Familie! Sie können zum Beispiel:

  • Drücken Sie gefällt mir auf unserer Facebook-Seite und teilen Sie Ihre Lieblings-Beiträge.
  • Retweeten sie @Africa_Foot  Tweets wann immer möglich.
  • Besuchen Sie unsere Website http://africafootacademy.com/?language=de und erzählen Sie Ihren Freunden darüber.
story_txt:
Our project in brief 

Scroll down for French and
German versions. La version française et allemande est en dessous.
Für die Deutsche und Französische Version, sehen Sie
unten.
Africa Foot Academy (AFA) was founded in 2012 with an
objective to empower the youth in Cameroon and enhance their life skills through
soccer. Currently, the non-profit soccer academy provides training for 158 children and youth, many of whom are
homeless. AFA supports these underprivileged children and youth by seeking them
host families and funding their primary and secondary schooling. AFA improves their performance at school eg. through the help of volunteers providing after-school remedial teaching for those in need. 


AFA offers the most
talented youth players a path to professional sport, including a post in
the academy´s FC-AFA soccer team, which currently plays in the Cameroonian
third league with great development potential.
All training is offered free of
costs, hence also the poorest families can take part in the training programs of
AFA. This is unique in the Cameroonian soccer scene. Additionally, AFA supports also girls’ soccer and even has a girls’ soccer team. 


Currently,
AFA is about to invest in a bus, in order to provide a safe transport to its
young players to soccer tournaments taking place around Cameroon. Due to bad
condition of roads, bad driving habits and old vehicles, the road safety in
Cameroon is close to non-existent. A number of deathly road accidents occur
weekly. This is most unfortunate taking into account that alternative ways to travel are not available
in Cameroon. 
A 30-seat bus
(second hand) will ensure the necessary stability and safety for our kids en
route. Here we need your help! Every small contribution will bring us closer to
this goal.


 
What We Need is a Bus - but WHY?

The bus is
needed for tournaments mostly taking place around the West of Cameroon, the Littoral
Region with distances up to 600 km. Currently, AFA owns a minibus with 12 seats. This bus, however, is in a very bad condition and not sufficient for our teams travelling with
ca. 30 persons (including players and staff). Travelling by public/ private busses in
Cameroon is extremely expensive but also dangerous due to old vehicles and bad roads. Road accidents
occur regularly also to busses carrying 50 passangers or more.
A team bus
will provide the academy flexibility and - above all - ensure the safety of our
kids en route. 



What You Get & What We Do
 

With 49 000 USD we will be able to by a
stable, high quality second hand 30-seat bus in Germany and ship it over to Cameroon.
Unfortunately, as is the case in many African countries, also in Cameroon the
quality busses in good shape simply are not available for this price.
Additionally, the second hand busses in Cameroon do not have a guarantee unlike
the ones bought in Germany. Hence, shipping the vehicle from Germany to
Cameroon is more rentable. 


Every contribution, no matter how big or
small, will help us! If we raise more than 49 000 USD, the rest of the
funds will be invested in the formal schooling of our young players (school
fees, text books, school uniforms), especially of those coming from the poorest
families or who are living on the streets.
Again, if we do not succeed to raise enough
funds this time, our purchase will only be postponed. We will continue our efforts
until we have reached the goal. We see the positive impact of soccer and team
sport on underprivileged children and youth every day. This makes us push
further.
For every donation, we will send you a HUGE
VIRTUAL HUG!! Once we have bought the bus, every donor will receive an e-mail from us with
news and photos of the bus in use.  
Below you will find a list of perks that we
will send you in return for your donation.  
USD 10 : Virtual High Five!
USD 25 : Special Thank You
Card 
USD 50 : Exclusive AFA T-shirt & Special Thank You Card
USD 55 : Beautiful AFA team poster with signatures of
players  
USD 55 : 100 % organic ECF Coffee (250 g/ 0,55 lb)  & Special Thank You Card
USD 65 : 100 % organic ECF Coffee (500 g/ 1,1 lb) & Special Thank You Card
USD 75 : 100 % organic ECF Coffee (1 kg/ 2,2 lb) & Special Thank You Card
USD 150 : Exclusive AFA T-shirt & AFA team poster
 
USD 200 : AFA jersey with your name on the back & AFA
team poster 
USD 300 : Official teamwear of AFA: complete training
outfit (jersey, shorts, socks) & Special Thank You Card
USD 500 : Official teamwear of AFA: complete warm up suit (jacket,
long pants) & Special
Thank You Card
USD 2000 : Donor´s name on the bus seat & AFA team poster
& 100 % organic ECF Coffee & Special Thank You Card
USD 4000 : Donor´s name on the side of the bus & AFA
team poster & 100 % organic ECF Coffee & Special Thank You Card






100 % Organic ECF Coffee
ECF Group, a Cameroonian management company, is the main sponsor of Africa Foot Academy. ECF Group produces premium gourmet coffee (Arabica and Robusta) and exports it in small amounts around the globe. ECF ensures fair wages for farmers. ECF coffee comes from small-scale family farms, using 100 % organic cultivation methods. To ensure the best quality coffee, only the ripe cherries are harvested and selectively picked by hand. Green beans are roasted with German know-how and packed for shipping. The entire production chain from harvesting to roasting and packing is kept in Cameroon, in order to bring the industry closer to farmers. ECF coffee will be available in the fall 2015.


How to Contact UsShould you have any questions about the activities of Africa Foot Academy, our pitches or the campaign in general, please do not hesitate to contact us at Info@africafootacademy.com / africafootacademy@gmail.com

   
Other Ways You Can Help

 
We appreciate any help you can
give us to spread the word about what we are doing. Here's how you can help:

Help us make some
     noise! Use the Indiegogo share tools to send this campaign to friends
     and family.
Like our facebook page and share your favorite
     posts. 
Retweet @Africa_Foot tweets whenever possible.
Visit our website at http://africafootacademy.de/?language=en and tell your friends to visit
     it too.

des joueurs & 100 % organic ECF Coffee & Spécial carte de remerciement
USD 4000 : Nom du
donateur sur le côté du bus & Poster d’ équipe d’AFA avec les signatures des
joueurs & 100 % organic ECF Coffee & Spécial carte de remerciement





100 % Organic ECF café

ECF Group, une société de gestion camerounaise, est le sponsor principal d’Africa Foot Academy.
ECF Groupe produit du café gourmet (arabica et robusta) et l'exporte en petites
quantités dans le monde entier. ECF assure des salaires équitables pour les
agriculteurs. ECF café provient de fermes familiales de petite échelle, qui
utilisent 100% des méthodes de culture organique. Pour assurer la meilleure
qualité de café, seules les cerises mûres sont récoltées et cueillies
sélectivement à la main. Les grains sont torréfiés avec le savoir-faire
allemand et emballés pour expédition. L'ensemble de la chaîne de la récolte, la
production, la torréfaction et l’emballage est fait au Cameroun, afin d'amener
l'industrie plus proche de l’agriculteurs. ECF café sera disponible sur le
marché à l'automne 2015.
Comment nous contacter
Si
vous avez des questions sur les activités de Africa Foot Academy, des avantages
que nous vous ferons parvenir en retour de votre don, ou la campagne en général,
s’il vous plaît, n’ hésitez pas à nous contacter à Info@africafootacademy.com  / africafootacademy@gmail.com


Autres façons d'aider  

Nous apprécions toute aide que vous pouvez nous donner
en parlant un mot sur ce que nous faisons. 
Voici comment vous pouvez aider:



Aidez-nous à
faire du bruit! Utilisez les outils de parts IndieGoGo pour envoyer cette
campagne aux amis et aux familles.


Commentez sur
notre page facebook et partagez vos messages préférés.


Retweet @Africa_Foot á la mesure de votre possibilité.


Visitez notre
site Web à http://africafootacademy.com/?language=fr
et invitez vos amis à visiter aussi.







++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

 
 Unser Projekt in Kürze

Africa Foot Academy (AFA) wurde im Jahr 2012 mit dem Ziel, die Jugend in Kamerun zu stärken
und zur Verbesserung ihrer Lebenskompetenzen durch Fußball gegründet. Derzeit
bietet die gemeinnützige Fußball-Akademie Schulungen für 158 Kinder und Jugendliche,
von denen viele obdachlos sind. AFA unterstützt diese benachteiligten Kinder
und Jugendlichen von der Suche einer Gastfamilie, bis zur Finanzierung ihrer
Grund- und Realschulbildung. Durch AFA werden ihre Leistungen in der Schule verbessert
zum Beispiel durch die Hilfe von Freiwilligen, die sich dazu bereitstellen außerschulischen
Förderunterricht anzubieten.


AFA bietet
den talentiertesten Nachwuchsspielern einen Pfad zu dem Profisport, darunter
einen Platz in der offiziellen Akademie Fußballmannschaft FC-AFA, die derzeit
in der Kamerunischen dritten Liga spielt, mit großem Entwicklungspotenzial.
Alle
Schulungen werden kostenfrei angeboten, damit auch die ärmsten Familien an den
Ausbildungsprogrammen von AFA teilnehmen können. Dies ist in der Kamerunischen
Fußballszene einzigartig. Zusätzlich unterstützt AFA auch Mädchenfußball und
hat sogar eine Mädchenfußballmannschaft. 


Derzeit ist
AFA dabei, in einem Bus zu investieren, um einen sicheren Transport für seine
jungen Spieler zu Fußballturnieren zu sichern. Wegen dem schlechten Zustand der
Straßen, schlechtem Fahrverhalten und alten Fahrzeugen ist die Straßenverkehrssicherheit
in Kamerun nahezu nicht vorhanden. Wöchentlich stoßen eine Reihe von tödlichen
Verkehrsunfällen auf. Dies ist sehr bedauerlich, da keine alternativen Reisemöglichkeiten
in Kamerun verfügbar sind.
Ein Reisebus
mit 30 sitzen (aus zweiter Hand) würde unterwegs für die nötige Stabilität und
Sicherheit für unsere Kinder sorgen und genau
hier brauchen wir Ihre Hilfe! Jeder noch so kleine Beitrag wird uns ein
Stück näher zu diesem Ziel bringen.
 
 
Was wir brauchen ist ein Bus - aber warum?


Der Bus wird
für den Transport zu Turnieren die meist im Westen von Kamerun und an den
Küstenregion mit Entfernungen von bis zu 600 km stattfinden benötigt. Derzeit
besitzt AFA einen Kleinbus mit 12 Sitzplätzen. Dieser Bus ist aber in einem
sehr schlechten Zustand und nicht für unsere Teamreisen mit ca. 30 Personen ausreichend
(einschließlich Spieler und das Personal). Anreise mit den öffentlichen /
privaten Bussen in Kamerun ist nicht nur extrem teuer, sondern auch gefährlich
wegen der alten Fahrzeuge und schlechten Straßen. Verkehrsunfälle treten
regelmäßig auf, sogar bei Bussen mit 50 Passagiere oder mehr.
Ein Team-Bus
würde der Akademie Flexibilität bieten und vor allem die Sicherheit unserer jungen
Spieler unterwegs. 


Was Sie erhalten & was wir tun 



Mit 49 000
USD werden wir in der Lage sein einen stabilen, 
hochwertigen 30-Mann Bus aus zweiter Hand in Deutschland zu erwerben und
ihn nach Kamerun zu verschicken. Leider ist diese Art von Qualitäts-Bussen in
guter Form in Kamerun, wie auch in vielen anderen Afrikanischen Ländern, zu
diesem Preis nicht verfügbar. Darüber hinaus haben die gebrauchten Busse in
Kamerun keine Garantie im Gegensatz zu den in Deutschland gekauften. Daher ist der Versand des Fahrzeugs aus Deutschland nach Kamerun vorteilhafter.
Jeder Beitrag, egal wie groß oder klein, wird uns dabei helfen! Empfangen
wir mehr als 49 000 USD, wird der Rest in die formale Schulbildung unserer
jungen Spieler investiert (Schulgebühren,
Text Bücher, Schuluniformen), vor allem in die die aus den ärmsten Familien kommen
oder die die auf den Straßen leben.
Auch wenn es
uns nicht gelingt, genügend Geld zu sammeln wird das unseren Kauf nur
verschieben. Wir werden unsere Bemühungen fortsetzen, bis wir das Ziel erreicht
haben. Wir sehen die positiven Auswirkungen des Fußballs und Teamsports an benachteiligten
Kindern und Jugendlichen tagtäglich, was uns nur antreibt,
Für jede
Spende, werden wir Ihnen eine RIESIGE VIRTUELLE UMARMUNG als Dankeschön senden!!
Nachdem wir den Bus gekauft haben, wird jeder Spender eine E-Mail von uns mit
Nachrichten und Fotos von dem Bus im Einsatz zu erhalten.
Nachfolgend
finden Sie eine Liste der Vergünstigungen, die wir Ihnen im Gegenzug für Ihre
Spende zu senden.
USD 10: Virtueller High Five!
USD 25: Besondere Dankeschön Karte
USD 50: Exklusives AFA T-Shirt & Dankeschön
Karte 
USD 55: Schöne AFA-Team Poster mit
Unterschriften der Spieler
USD 55: 100% Bio-ECF Kaffee (250 g / 0,55
lb) & Dankeschön
Karte
USD 65: 100% Bio-ECF Kaffee (500 g / 1,1
lb) & Dankeschön Karte 
USD 75: 100% Bio-ECF Kaffee (1 kg / 2,2 lb)
& Dankeschön Karte 
USD 150: Exklusives AFA T-Shirt &
AFA-Team Poster
USD 200: AFA Trikot mit Ihrem Namen auf der
Rückseite & AFA-Team Poster
USD 300: Offizielle Teambekleidungen von
AFA: Trainingsausrüstung (Trikot, Hose, Socken) & Dankeschön Karte
USD 500: Offizielle Teambekleidungen von
AFA: Aufwärmanzug (Jacke, lange Hose) & Dankeschön Karte 
USD 2000: Name des Spenders auf dem Bus sitz
& AFA-Team Poster, 100% Bio-ECF Kaffee & Dankeschön Karte
USD 4000: Name des Spenders auf der Seite des
Busses und AFA-Team Poster,100% Bio-ECF Kaffee & Dankeschön Karte





100 % Bio ECF Kaffee

ECF-Group,
eine Kameruner Verwaltungsgesellschaft, ist der Hauptsponsor der Africa Foot
Academy. ECF-Group produziert Premium-Gourmet-Kaffee (Arabica und Robusta) und
exportiert sie in kleinen Mengen in der ganzen Welt. ECF sorgt für faire Löhne
für die Landwirte. ECF Kaffee kommt aus kleinen Familienbetrieben, mit 100%
Bio-Anbaumethoden. Um die beste Qualität Kaffee zu gewährleisten, werden nur
die reifen Bohnen geerntet und selektiv von Hand gepflückt. Bohnen werden mit
deutschem Know-how geröstet und verpackt. Die gesamte Produktionskette von der
Ernte bis zur Röstung und Verpackung wird in Kamerun gehalten, um die Branche näher
an die Landwirte zu bringen. ECF Kaffee wird im Herbst 2015 verfügbar sein.

Wie Sie uns erreichen


Sollten Sie Fragen zu den Aktivitäten von Africa Foot Academy, unseren Vergünstigungen
oder der Kampagne im Allgemeinen haben, zögern Sie bitte nicht uns auf Info@africafootacademy.com / africafootacademy@gmail.com zu kontaktieren.

Weitere Möglichkeiten wie Sie uns helfen können

Helfen sie uns unsere Fan Community zu erweitern! Teilen
sie diese Kampagne mit Freunden und Familie! Sie können zum Beispiel:



Drücken Sie gefällt mir auf unserer Facebook-Seite
und teilen Sie Ihre Lieblings-Beiträge.


Retweeten sie @Africa_Foot  Tweets
wann immer möglich.


Besuchen Sie unsere Website http://africafootacademy.com/?language=de
und erzählen Sie Ihren Freunden darüber.

story:
About Prosper America

We provide educational materials to create knowledgeable and empowered financial consumers. We believe all Americans should have access to financial tools that can help them create a basic personal financial plan. We believe education and planning can also create a prosperous steward. We believe an empowered steward can change the world. Prosper America is a 501(c)(3) charitable organization. 

Membership Benefits

Prosper Members will enjoy a host of benefits, including:
  • A learning center, covering eleven financial topics. Currently, we host several dozen financial calculators, designed to help our members help with common (and not so common) financial decisions. Later, we will release a full educational curriculum, along with a basic financial planning system for Premier Members.  Here is a SAMPLE REPORT from one of our current calculators.
  • A Membership Savings Program, delivering discounts and coupons for just about anything in your local area. These savings can easily exceed membership dues. VISIT THE SAVINGS SITE
  • Premium and Business members receive their own (PRIVATE AND SECURE) Personal Wealth Organizer, where they can see their financial picture in one place. LEARN MORE
  • Premium and Business members also receive annual reports from your401k.info. These reports provide unique scoring of their plan's fund choices, as well as custom model portfolios for their employer's retirement plan. SAMPLE REPORT
  • Business members can opt to be listed in our public business directory.
* A special note on privacy: Prosper America does not collect personal financial information. Some of our members may access third party tools for that purpose, each with their own tight protocols for security and privacy.  Information is NEVER shared, sold, or otherwise distributed. Our members' tools are for their personal educational and planning use. 

Outreach & Giving

In addition, we are working to empower others that are less fortunate. We will offer free educational seminars, and access to our Web based tools to the needy. We also work hand in hand with other charitable organizations who have similar goals of providing education and resources to the needy. Thereby we can increase our good work.

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $50,000 to help us further complete our vision:

  • Begin an improved financial education curriculum for our members and for our community outreach programs. This will include embedded web-based material for our members. 
  • Install single sign-on system for our members, so they can access all of their member benefits from their personal dashboard, without having to remember multiple usernames and passwords.

The Impact

A financially literate population can improve their overall quality of life and reduce the risks of financial crisis in the future.  A well versed individual is less likely to accumulate bad debt, less likely to need financial assistance later in life, and is more likely to increase their own income and prosperity. 

  • The average American is behind in their understanding of basic financial concepts. This is especially true of high school graduates and the bottom 80% of the general public.  This is too important to ignore. Large financial institutions and even the White House see this issue as a priority. 
  • Financial information is widely available, but what has been lacking is structured information without a sales pitch. Prosper America provides the information, the tools, AND the resources to help someone ACTUALLY see results! Prosper never needs any personal financial information, and has nothing to sell beyond the membership dues to pay the bills.
  • Our team and subcontractors have decades of professional financial experience, including Certified Financial Planners, Registered Investment Advisers, Attorneys, CPA's, Insurance Agents, and others. 
  • Beyond our financial literacy programs, Prosper America will support other charitable causes as a budget item. Our members can recommend charities right on our website!
  • Our organization has already invested tens of thousands of dollars to get to this point. We just need this campaign to give us (and America) a jump start towards financial literacy.

Risks & Challenges

Prosper America is new and needs to develop several thousand members this year. Our impact on society is directly related to how many people participate in our programs. We need our to be heard and used broadly. Although we have designed a very efficient organization, we need members (and lots of them) to really make the dream come alive.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share our campaign with the share tools from Indiegogo.
  • Like us and share our posts on Facebook and Twitter
  • email your friends
  • or anything else you can do to help us publicize our efforts.
  • consider a matching gift for this campaign (if you have the means).

And that's all there is to it. Thank you so much for your consideration!

story:
No Place Like Home Daycare is the brain child of Leah Swartz.   
This is to be an in-home daycare program where children are immersed in Ontario curriculum inspired education, healthy eating, art immersion, community development and above all a space which feels like home. 
Share feedback, make requests, and ask questions -  leah.swartz@gmail.com

**I am also looking for team members, if you fit the title please e-mail me
-> Speach Therapist
-> Occupational Therapist
-> Music Teacher

SHORT SUMMARY:
Leah Swartz is originally from Thornhill, Ontario, now living in Toronto, Ontario. After seven years experience working for two different school boards and five years working as an Autism Behaviour Therapist, Leah has now realized that what she wants most of all is to run an in-home daycare space that teaches and inspires creative growth in children  

WHAT IS NEEDED:
The funds raised will go towards purchasing items that will be needed within the space.   Furniture, toys, musical instruments, kitchen & cleaning supplies, art supplies, outdoor play equipment, etc.     If the funds raised exceed the goal that money will be used towards the future home for No Place Like Home Daycare.

IMPACT
Leah believes that children deserve respect, a healthy eating lifestyle and a safe, beautiful place to learn and expand their imaginations.    Teaching styles inspired by ABA (Autism Behaviour Analysis), and Montessori techniques will help develop a wonderful space for learning opportunities and play that will positively influence the children.
There is strict adherence to maintaining provincial standards that provide the health, safety and developmental needs of children that will make No Place Like Home Daycare successful.
The main focus at No Place Like Home Daycare is on nurturing quality care and learning in the best interests of your child, which means children will be provided age appropriate activities and learning materials to further their growth.
No Place Like Home Daycare will also strive to keep open lines of communication between parents to keep them regularly informed about their child’s activities and well-being.

EDUCATION:

With a background in Autism Behaviour Therapy and as an Educational Assistant with the York Region and Toronto District School Board's, Leah will offer a curriculum inspired approach to her daycare.   
With over 10 years of experience working with children under the Autism Spectrum, Leah can apply her knowledge of child development and behaviour management to all ages and circumstances.
She has a diploma in Developmental Service Work through Humber College and Undergrad in Disability Studies through Ryerson University

HEALTHY EATING PROGRAM:
With all the various eating lifestyles that exist today, No Place Like Home Daycare wants to respect the decisions parents make for their child's diet, not ignore them for the sake of convenience.  
The healthy eating program through No Place Like Home Daycare will offer vegetarian, vegan, paleo, kosher and any other eating lifestyle that is requested.
All produce & meat will be organic.

ARTS & THEATER PROGRAM:
No Place Like Home Daycare wants all children to thrive in not only education and healthy eating but also to have an arts education.   There will be arts & crafts done daily and once a week the children will have a special guest come in for one - two hours to do art and theater related activities.    We want all children to feel creative.

COMMUNITY:
No Place Like Home Daycare will be situated somewhere with a strong thriving community.   There will be weekly outings to places that will help teach, inspire growth and creativity within a child.  

 FUN:
Above all No Place Like Home Daycare wants to be a space where children have fun.   A space where children are safe, healthy, make friends, learn new skills, all while keeping a smile on their face.

TESTIMONIALS
"I have had the privilege of knowing Leah Swartz personally and professionally for several years. When I went back to work following a year at home with my newborn son I was apprehensive about leaving him in someone else's care, but Leah met and exceeded all my expectations of a caregiver. Leah has the unique ability not only to provide an outstanding capacity for the physical and educational needs of her charges, but also to form a personal relationship with children of diverse ages. My son Davan was so profoundly affected by his time with Leah that even a year after he entered a preschool environment he still immediately recognized and was thrilled to see her. Leah is an outstanding caregiver who takes a genuine interest and investment in the children under her care. Her wealth of experience makes her an excellent reinforcement to parents interested in both social and educational growth, but it is her character and her empathy that makes her truly special.  I cannot overstate how highly I would recommend her services to any parent looking for exceptional care for their children."   - Alex Krueger, father of Davan (2.5 yrs old)


"Leah is a fantastic babysitter. Since she started babysitting for us a year ago, the care and kindness she has shown our toddler son Sam has given us peace of mind on our nights out. We know that when we leave Sam with Leah that he is going to have a good night - in fact, sometimes, he is having so much fun, he barely notices we are leaving!
Not only is Leah wonderful with Sam but she had also proven herself to be very dependable and considerate of our home and our instructions in caring for Sam. Oftentimes we have come home, not only to a happily sleeping child, but to an apartment that is tidier than we left it!
We both trust Leah implicitly and feel very safe leaving our child in her care. She's great!"   - Jillian & Ben Stirling, mother and father of Sam (2 years old)


"We've had the privilege of having -- and watching -- Leah Swartz educate and provide care for our two children with special needs, and we can't recommend her highly enough! She's effective, focused, a dedicated caregiver who never loses control and makes sure kids are learning while they're having fun. She's exactly the sort of person who should be operating a day care, and we encourage everyone to help her make this ambition a reality!"  - Mr & Mrs SGM

Her wealth of experience makes her an excellent reinforcement to parents interested in both social and educational growth, but it is her character and her empathy that makes her truly special.  I cannot overstate how highly I would recommend her services to any parent looking for exceptional care for their children."   - Alex Krueger, father of Davan (2.5 yrs old)

We know that when we leave Sam with Leah that he is going to have a good night - in fact, sometimes, he is having so much fun, he barely notices we are leaving!Not only is Leah wonderful with Sam but she had also proven herself to be very dependable and considerate of our home and our instructions in caring for Sam. Oftentimes we have come home, not only to a happily sleeping child, but to an apartment that is tidier than we left it!We both trust Leah implicitly and feel very safe leaving our child in her care. She's great!"   - Jillian & Ben Stirling, mother and father of Sam (2 years old)

"We've had the privilege of having -- and watching -- Leah Swartz educate and provide care for our two children with special needs, and we can't recommend her highly enough! She's effective, focused, a dedicated caregiver who never loses control and makes sure kids are learning while they're having fun. She's exactly the sort of person who should be operating a day care, and we encourage everyone to help her make this ambition a reality!"  - Mr & Mrs SGM

story:
Short Summary

After 5 long years of hauling and selling cupcakes, our 1965 Scotty Camper (Food Truck) is in desperate need of repair. The needed work is now beyond the DIY skills of our handy-lady and co-owner, Jean Bates.   

What We Need & What You Get

Since our sweet scotty now leaks every time it rains, which is a lot these days, we are calling upon our loyal supporters to help us with some big projects, to fix the problems caused by the rain. Some of these problems include: damage to the roof and interior walls. 

The Impact

5 years ago, we decided to embark on a new adventure.... the Food Truck world! While looking for the perfect cupcake selling machine, we came across a vintage 1965 Serro Scotty camper. It was perfect... so we purchased it and never looked back. We fixed it up and converted it into a food truck, but after many years of food truck service, she is in ill need of repair. By helping us fund the Scotty makeover, you will be saving her life, making it possible to continue the food truck life, thus allowing us to bring gourmet cupcakes to public and private events. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can only contribute minimally that's ok!  We are all about the power of the people. Here comes the cheesy quote to pull on the heart strings.

“Never underestimate the power of a small group of committed people to change the world. In fact, it is the only thing that ever has.” ~ Margaret Mead


Ok, that may be a bit dramatic, but you get the point. :)
story_txt:
Short Summary After 5 long years of hauling and selling cupcakes, our 1965 Scotty Camper (Food Truck) is in desperate need of repair. The needed work is now beyond the DIY skills of our handy-lady and co-owner, Jean Bates.      What We Need & What You Get Since our sweet scotty now leaks every time it rains, which is a lot these days, we are calling upon our loyal supporters to help us with some big projects, to fix the problems caused by the rain. Some of these problems include: damage to the roof and interior walls. 
    The Impact 5 years ago, we decided to embark on a new adventure.... the Food Truck world! While looking for the perfect cupcake selling machine, we came across a vintage 1965 Serro Scotty camper. It was perfect... so we purchased it and never looked back. We fixed it up and converted it into a food truck, but after many years of food truck service, she is in ill need of repair. By helping us fund the Scotty makeover, you will be saving her life, making it possible to continue the food truck life, thus allowing us to bring gourmet cupcakes to public and private events. 

    Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can only contribute minimally that's ok!  We are all about the power of the people. Here comes the cheesy quote to pull on the heart strings.
“Never underestimate the power of a small group of committed people to change the world. In fact, it is the only thing that ever has.” ~ Margaret Mead

Ok, that may be a bit dramatic, but you get the point. :)

story:
"There can be no keener revelation of a society's soul than the way in which it treats its children."   — Nelson Mandela

Short Summary

The Power of One - Donate Just $1, change the life of a child! (But You Can Give as Much as You Want)

Our Mission:

It is the mission of VICM to bring children and families together in an interactive educational space where dynamic play inspires a love of learning.

Our story:

Originally we thought it would be better if we launched our campaign with a rainbow instead of a storm cloud. But as everyone can see, we have not even come close to reaching our goal. It makes our Nelson Mandela quote especially poignant.

We began this museum as a labor of love. We looked at how few fun, educational opportunities there were for VI children and their families and caregivers. We looked at the staggering statistics out there on the state of education in the Territory, and we decided we would build a place for the community to come together and cherish our most precious resource, our children. 

According to the VI Dept. of Education, 34% of VI children entering public kindergarten lack age-appropriate cognition skills and 50% lack age-appropriate word and comprehension skills. Proficiency rates in math, reading and science hover around 50% in grades 3-11 in public schools. Yes, 50%!

Children who do not participate in early childhood education are 70% more likely to commit a violent crime and be imprisoned, 25% more likely to drop out of school, and 40% more likely to become a teen parent.


So the data is there. It is obvious we need to do more.

And you can! For Just $1, you, too, can change the life of a child.

We have reached out to the community in this crowd funding campaign because we wanted this museum to be for every Virgin Islander, built by Virgin Islanders! Look at it like this, for Just $1 donation today, you will have a beautiful and wondrous museum to enjoy, for years and years to come. The Boston Children's Museum is over 100 years old and the Brooklyn Children's Museum is almost 120 years old.

On March 1, 2016, the first ever museum of it’s kind in the Territory, The Virgin Islands Children's Museum, will open its doors. But only if you donate now.

The power of one- Just $1, (But You Can Give as Much as You Want)

What We Need & What You Get

Help us build this museum! Our budget for the construction of the exhibits and the museum is $108,000.



We have an enticing array of thank you perks.  Show your museum support in an awesome T-Shirt, or beautify your car's bumper with a cool sticker. Want to have your child's artwork be postcards in the museum gift shop? Or have your child be our Ultimate Mad Scientist Science Guide- in all of our exhibit explanation videos in the museum? Make your contribution today.

So many choices- so many ways to make a difference in a child's life. And it starts with Just $1!


The Impact

Children who are able to participate in early learning programs are estimated to increase their future productivity and raise the income rate in their adult lives by an average of 25% to 33%.  Margaret Mead, the American Cultural Anthropologist said, “Children do not need to be taught what to think, they need to be taught how to think.” And that, in essence, is what a children’s museum strives to accomplish.

The Virgin Islands Children's Museum will be a safe and constructive environment where children, parents, teachers, and caregivers have hands-on, dynamic learning experiences igniting the fire of imagination and introducing visitors to the power of discovery.  This museum is going to help to build a positive future for the people of the Virgin Islands, and all those who visit this beautiful place we call home.

As part of a multicultural and multinational community, the museum will welcome and encourage visitors from across the Caribbean and throughout the world.

The VICM will be an all-inclusive education resource for children of all ages!

Risks & Challenges

For the past two years we have dedicated every extra moment to building this museum.  We have found that along the way some folks did not know what a children's museum is, some folks didn't think it is a viable project, and some folks did not believe that the education of our children is at risk.

But it is! Every year schools get their budgets cut, parents have to work more hours and often more than one job, and children have to bear the brunt of a society that is moving so fast it cannot slow down enough to give them a childhood based on age-appropriate activities. Children need to play. When they play, they learn. It is as simple as that.

Now that we are heading into our final two weeks of this crowd funding campaign and looking at how badly it is doing, we are saddened that the museum has not been championed by the community in the way we thought it would be. We have even been attacked on social media and called elitists when we published some of the amounts we are trying to raise.

And that right there is part of the problem. It takes a lot of money to build a museum.  In fact, the VICM has one of the smallest build-out budgets of any museum scheduled to open to in the US next year. A new children's museum recently opened in Mississippi, and their build-out cost was $28,000,000! The VI Children's Museum build-out cost IS ONLY $108,000- and we are only trying to raise $55,000 from direct public contribution. Admission will only be $8, and while we had been instructed to make it more by our financial advisors, we chose not to to ensure accessibility to as many families as possible.

It takes a lot of people with a lot of vision and passion to build a museum. We have given everything we are to this museum, have never gotten paid for any of this, work between 30 and 40 hours a week on top of our regular full time jobs, and have sacrificed so much in our lives to come this far and then be called names and watch our funding drive perform so dismally.

But we won't fail! Our children need this, our community needs this. Spending by visitors to children's museums generates $80.8 billion dollars of valuable revenue annually for their local communities! Everyone wins with this museum!

Other Things You Can Do

We understand times are hard economically. Trust us, we barely make rent ourselves! So, maybe you just can't give right now. Maybe you can only give a little and you want to do more.  Well, you can- there is so much more you can do to help!

Share this campaign on Facebook and email it to all of your friends. Ask them to send it along to others. Talk about it at work, at your kid's school, at PTA, Cost U Less, the coffee house, your play group, the grocery store, Home Depot - everywhere you go, talk it up!

Go to our website and the check out the Get Involved tab, sign up to be a Docent, teach wondrous things and astonish visitors with mind-blowing experiences! Or sign up to be a Volunteer and work in other areas of the museum.

It has just been us 2 Sarah's, and a small, dedicated handful of others. But we need more and more folks now. Join us as we create this amazing and special place for our children and our community.

To make a contribution with PayPal click here:
 http://www.vichildrensmuseum.org/#!donate/c1ghi

Thank you for your support of the Virgin Islands Children's Museum!

"Do not train a child to learn by force or harshness; but direct them to it by what amuses their minds, so that you may be better able to discover with accuracy the peculiar bent of the genius of each.” ― Plato

story:
Presentación

Cuando se participa en cooperación internacional, a veces nos damos cuenta que la realidad se puede cambiar parándonos a pensar solo un instante. Eso es lo que hicimos cuando percibimos que el turismo en un país como Marruecos, podía ser la salida de muchos jóvenes que actualmente se encuentran excluidos socialmente.

Nos pusimos manos a la obra y conseguimos que un colaborador construyera un complejo de turismo rural para que los jóvenes pudieran acceder a los diferentes puestos de trabajo (camarero, pinche de cocina, personal de limpieza, mantenimiento, guía turístico, etc.). Ahora solo queda formar a los jóvenes que están esperando para poder desarrollar su trabajo.

Durante seis meses vamos a formar a 15 jóvenes (chicos y chicas) en competencias propias del ámbito de la hostelería y la restauración. A través de este proyecto formativo y laboral, los jóvenes adquirirán progresivamente un empoderamiento para reconducir su vida y lo más importante, para poder decidir con igualdad de oportunidades.

Lo que necesitamos

Para poner en marcha la formación, necesitamos un presupuesto de 4.500 €, con el que pagaremos:

3 profesores: 300x3 = 900 €

Desayunos diarios antes de la formación: 300 €

Transporte jóvenes: 200 €

Material fungible: 100 €

Total: 1500 € mensuales x 3 meses = 4500 €

Los 3 meses restantes del programa de formación corresponde a las prácticas profesionales y no requiere de financiación, ya que estas se desarrollarán en establecimientos y empresas.

story:
PROJECT EEVA

My name is Eden St James and I am a former teacher, youth advocate, social researcher and a self-confessed jack of all trades.
The ideas behind the organisation that is EEVA were sparked during my time as a Leading Teacher at the DEECD. In this time I saw too many students with too much potential missing out on the education that they deserve. I saw too many of my colleagues stressed, overworked and stretched by onerous accountability measures and a strict corporate like approach to school management. 

EEVA is attempting to find ways in which to expand the pockets of educational innovation and directly address these challenges so that they may become broad, holistic changes across whole-school systems. Our services support teachers in implementing New Pedagogies for Deeper Learning within their

classrooms - a framework for education that involves strong learning partnerships between teachers, students, local business, community groups and families. EEVA is a response to the crisis of boredom and frustration among students and career disillusionment among teachers.


YOU CAN PLAY A ROLE IN CHANGE

Project EEVA is our call to action. We need to raise $25k to establish EEVA as a sector leader within education research, program delivery and social purpose development. 25k is a lot of coin - but not comparatively to Government spending on education. It equates to 2.3 students per year attending full-time schooling. With EEVA though, classroom teachers get individualised support and students are engaged in a process of learning. That's a return on your investment.
Donations to EEVA will support:

  • The accredited training of EEVA Education Project Officers 
  • The continuation of our Raw & Rugged Cultural Leaders Program
  • Curriculum development 
  • Stage 1 planning of our Education Summit at FCAC

PLUS! ALL DONATIONS MADE TO PROJECT EEVA WILL RECEIVE THE FIRST COPY OF OUR QUARTERLY RESEARCH PUBLICATION (A SUBSCRIBER BASE MAGAZINE) ABSOLUTELY FREE OF CHARGE. BECAUSE WE APPRECIATE YOUR PART IN HELPING EEVA HELP YOUNG PEOPLE.
Want to see what our publication will look like? You can get a sneak peek here.

THE RIPPLE EFFECT
Our actions have direct affect on the lives of other people. Their reactions in turn affect others. Each and everyone of us has the capacity to change the world in small ways, for better or worse. That's the Ripple Effect. 
Find out more about EEVA’s impact at:  www.facebook.com/eeva.org
Visit our website for more on EEVA pilot programs, our education summit and upcoming events plus if you click on the downloadable form - our teacher toolkit and curriculum development which is underway!


YOU CREATE ACTIVE CHANGE

Supporting EEVA directly increases the opportunities available to young people. 

We need $25,000 to expand EEVA’s reach. Get behind something you can actually believe in. Our organisation is providing opportunities for talented, inspirational youth from disadvantaged communities to become active leaders. We are giving the future a voice. Because education is for everybody.

We have sustainability built into the fabric of our organisation. Your donations, big or small will not go to waste. EEVA’s pilot programs are already in action. The amount you choose to donate will determine the number of young people we are able to provide our programs to. Your small change will create big change #forEEVA. 


BECOME A DEALER OF HOPE

1.   Like/share our facebook page - www.facebook.com/eeva.org

2.  Follow us on twitter - twitter.com/yourfriendeeva

3.  Sign up on our website to receive information on any of Eeva's current projects -        www.eeva.org.au/contact
