story:
DETAILED CAMPAIGN VIDEO & PERSONAL MESSAGE
CLICK HERE

(6 Minutes, 36 Seconds)

******************

ANIMATED CAMPAIGN VIDEO

CLICK HERE 
(1 Minute, 24 Seconds)

TARGET PRACTICE, Initiative...

  1. OUR MISSION IS TO POSITIVELY AFFECT THE GAME OF HOCKEY AT THE GRASS ROOTS LEVEL BY PROVIDING COACHES, AND EVERYONE ELSE WITHIN THE GAME, WITH INFORMATION THAT IS EASY TO UNDERSTAND, ACCESS AND USE, TO  FOSTER IMPROVED GOALTENDING INSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPMENT AT THE TEAM LEVEL.
  2. To create and develop FREE online (website) resources and print (book) material that provides the missing and needed information hockey coaches require to better accomplish their job of helping children play better and enjoy the game more, through developing a better understanding of the goaltending position and the mental, physical and Essential Core Goaltending Skills.
  3. To alleviate the biggest complaint of goalie parents & one of the biggest headaches for coaches, by eliminating  frustration and anger, replacing it with understanding and empathy for coaches who are able to develop and work with their goaltenders because of the newfound knowledge provided through our Initiative. 
  4.  To foster a proper and ongoing learning experience for young goaltenders that will result in enhanced love of the game, faster development, improved motivation and prolonged time in the game. 
  5. To provide all minor hockey coaches with much needed information and training so as positively change to the entire game at the minor hockey level and enhance team coaching, resulting in better goal scoring and goaltending. 
  6. To develop an online certification process that all minor hockey coaches can tap into, ultimately becoming certified in the Essential Core Goaltending Skills. We feel this should be a mandatory requirement to become a Head Coach.

THIS INITIATIVE WILL NOT ONLY BENEFIT COACHES AND GOALTENDERS. TEAMS WILL INCREASE SCORING WITH THE COACHES' IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF PROPERLY PACED PRACTICES, AND PLAYERS WILL BE FACING IMPROVED GOALTENDERS IN MORE REALISTIC, GAME-LIKE SITUATIONS.

WE BELIEVE ALL TEAMS WILL IMPROVE IF COACHES EMPLOY THE METHODS AND TECHNIQUES PROVIDED THROUGH THE TARGET PRACTICE INITIATIVE. 

Every coach should:

  • Have a copy of this book with them at the rink at all times, and reference it when planning practices or working with their goalie

  • Become a member (FREE) of Target Practice Initiative website, utilizing the video's and other information to better understand proper drills and discover root causes of goalie problems
  • Understand that goalie development will help the entire team to score more goals and help players to develop better scoring habits and ability


We know that coaches generally get involved to help their players improve their hockey and life skills, experience success and enjoy the game. 


Unfortunately there is a problem within minor hockey. Many coaches don't know what they don't know in order to help their goaltenders. So they choose to either make it up, BS their way through, or simply ignore the goalies entirely. 

Sure they may shoot pucks at them on occasion and they are part of team skills building drills, but they are really ignored in terms of Essential Core Goaltending Skills (ECGS) development. 

This infuriates parents, demotivates goalies and causes dissension within the team. Many young goalies quit the game they love for these reasons. I've seen this over and over for as long as I've been involved with hockey - most of my life!

I have coached goaltenders professionally for nearly 30 years and I am passionate about helping them improve. But I have now dedicated myself to helping coaches get the information they need to work with their most important player, the goalie. By focusing on the coaches and especially at the grassroots level, we will see a greater and more positive impact on the game as a whole. 

Contributors to our campaign will be helping to positively shape the face of hockey - and thousands of goaltenders for many years to come. The trickle-UP effect will change the global landscape for goalies and their future opportunities. 

What Those In The Game are Saying

  • Chris provides what is missing from coaching programs and this is why this book is so important. Much of the information that is out there is too technical and unless you play the position it’s difficult to understand, so misinformation is given to the kids by minor hockey coaches who try to tell the goalies how they think the position should be played.                        
    Rick Heinz, Former NHL Goaltender 
  • A lot of coaches aren't that eager to work with the goalie at all. They should be working to refine the goalies craft throughout the season.
    John Garrett, Former NHL Goaltender, Professional Commentator with Hockey Night In Canada 

  • Finally! Chris Dyson answered the questions no-one knew how to ask. After 25+ years involved in the industry, It’s great to see this grass roots level support and guidance for the most highly criticized, under- developed position in the game. Don Straus, Founder Armadilla Masks, World Renowned Artist 

  • I have never before seen information for coaches that is so useful, easily digestible, quick to read and easy to implement. Hockey coaches and parents everywhere will be thrilled with the content of this book!
    Colin Hopper, President Source For Sports London, Former President Sports Distributors Canada

  • Providing coaches with the skills to properly work with their goaltenders is awesome and perfect. I cannot imagine a single coach not jumping at the chance to take advantage of such an opportunity, especially at the grass roots level. Larry Feist Publisher, Hockey Now Magazine 

  • The game has dramatically changed, but one thing that hasn’t is the core fundamentals of goaltending. Coaches at every level must be able to understand and teach these. Jim Ralph, NHL Broadcaster & Media Personality

  • Getting the essential core goaltending skills into the hands of grass roots coaches is perfect, it needs to happen. It is a discipline unlike any other. 
    Mike Stubbs, Professional Broadcaster & Radio Personality

  • If the advice contained in Chris‘ book is made mandatory learning for minor hockey coaches, it will positively change the face of goaltending in North America. 
    Joni Hallikainen, Former Pro Goaltender, Professional Goaltending Consultant, Professional Mask Builder & Artist


Benefits For COACHES:

  • Access and Understand Information Easily
  • Avoid Technical Lingo or Hard To-Understand Descriptions
  • Find Solutions to Specific Problems 24/7
  • Accessible Information For All Learning Styles
  • Solutions to Specific Problems
  • Run Better, More Effective Practices
  • Easily Implement Goalie Development Strategies
  • Alleviate Dissension from Goalie Parents
  • Resolve Unfair Expectations Placed On Coaches
  • Understand Your Goalies & Their Needs 
  • Better Your Overall Team Play & Improve Goal Scoring
  • Improved Development of Goaltenders
  • Make Your Job Easier With The Addition of New Knowledge
  • WIN  MORE GAMES
Benefits For PARENTS:
  • See Your Child Develop Faster and More Effectively
  • Gain More Advancement Opportunities
  • Alleviate The Frustration of Watching Poorly Run Practices
  • Spend Less On Basic Instruction
  • Ease Tension with Coaches
  • Keep Children In the Game Longer
  • Less Need To Pay For External Coaching
  • Improve Confidence & Game Play
  • Receive the Coaching Your Registration Fees Pay For 
  • More Enjoyment From Watching Your Child 
  • Less Standing Around, More Coaching
Benefits For GOALIES:
  • Improved Motivation To Attend Practice
  • Stop Being Considered a Target 
  • More Shots Directed With The Intent Of Helping Develop You 
  • Define and Improve Upon Your Weaknesses With Proper Coaching
  • Eliminate Confusion and Frustration 
  • Develop Specific Skills, The Right Way
  • Improved Understanding & Empathy From Coaches
  • Develop To Your True Potential
  • Advance To Higher Levels
  • Love The Game! 
Benefits For TEAMS:
  • Improved Scoring Due to Properly Paced Drills and Situational Plays
  • Come Together as a Team 
  • Win more games
  • Players more engaged and excited due to better practice
  • Improve Attitudes and Earn Greater Respect for the Goaltenders
  • More challenging practice drills, translates into better game prep
  • Have More FUN!


Imagine...

There is now a way for YOU to help break the pattern. YOU can change the game itself - make such a positive change, in fact, that players will stay in the game longer, have more fun and drastically improve their skills…because you cared enough to help us. 

Target Practice, 8 Mistakes That Ruin A Love Of The Game, is a book written by Chris Dyson. President of Puckstoppers Goaltending Development, professional coach and goaltending consultant. This book was written in an easy to-digest and quick-to-read format that includes information that any coach can implement in seconds. Coaches and parents are easily able to grasp the concepts required to provide the fundamentals to their goaltenders through proper instruction.

But we don't want to stop there. Our plans include a worldwide initiative to help coaches and parents. Just about everyone in the game recognizes the problem, but there is little being done to solve it. So we are taking the Initiative! 

The book will serve to provide an understanding of the basic principals,  but phase two, Target Practice, Initiative will be a web-based learning tool that coaches can visit for easy-to-understand advice, drills, and information, not to mention the ability to ask true goalie coaches for input on more complex issues. 

The two year goal is to then create a worldwide Goaltender Trainer certification program that every minor hockey coach would be encouraged to take. Successful completion of this certification would ensure coaches had the tools to develop their goaltenders properly and the means to upgrade as desired. 

If you are a coach or hockey executive, board member or parent, you know everything I have stated is true and this is a much-needed educational process. 

You Can Change These Scenarios & Be Part Of Affecting Positive Change:

  • Young goalies crying on the ride home because their coach gave them contradictory advice that confused and frustrated them. 
  • Coaches becoming exasperated because they don't have the proper knowledge to help their goalies
  • Teams continually losing because the goaltender makes simple, yet uncorrected movements that lead to 'bad' goals. 
  • Whispering parents concerned that one of the goalies is always costing the team opportunities to win…and not getting any better. 
  • Young goalies quitting the great game they love out of frustration and anger, because they are confused and unhappy they aren't improving. 
  • Irate parents waiting in the lobby to ream out the coach because their son or daughter, the goalie, was left standing on the ice for 45 minutes of the practice with nothing to do – and now wonders whether he or she should bother coming to practice at all.


What We Need To Make This Happen & YOUR REWARDS for Helping Change The Game

You have the power to evoke change through our Initiative, but we need your help. 

  • We're raising $5987 to help pay the nearly $100 000 publishing costs and investment required for development of our new FREE website dedicated to helping coaches throughout the world. Already a sizeable personal investment has been made and we have secured corporate sponsorship from some big players within the game who see our plan and want to be a part of it...but we aren't there yet! 
  • Your investment will be used to pay for the publication and worldwide distribution of Target Practice, 8 Mistakes That Ruin A Love Of The Game, which will soon be available in both paperback and e-book formats and can obtained in select Source For Sports Stores across the country. The book will feature great information for coaches and parents on Essential Core Goaltending Skills and how to implement strategies for coaching and integrating drills for the goalie into team practices. 
  • Your contribution will be used to pay for development and marketing of the website Target Practice Hockey Initiative. The website will entice and invite participation from some of the worlds the best goalie coaches and offer one-to-two minute instructional drill clips, video demonstrations and print articles, providing coaches with easy-to-understand information. Every coach and parent already wants this information! The time is NOW to make it happen.  

  • Perks & REWARDS include: Advanced and signed copies of the book, advertising within to book for a very few qualified sponsors, advertising on our newTarget Practice Initiative website, T shirts, hats, apparel, goalie school enrolments, video coaching,  consulting session, coaching seminars and clinics with Chris Dyson, coaching certification enrolments and a whole lot of love & appreciation through our multiple social media channels.

    Additional Value Added Perks & Appreciation  
  • All PERKS with a value of $50 or more, we will include shipping costs (in Canada and the USA only) as well as a personal shout out and thank you on our Social Media channels. 
  • With all PERKS over $150 we will create a special THANK YOU wall on our website to recognize everyone and a hand written personalized thank you note will be sent by Chris Dyson. 
  • With all PERKS $999 and over, you will receive a personal  THANK YOU note and a phone call from Chris Dyson to personally let you know how much your commitment and support means. Chris will be happy to discuss hockey, goaltending or anything you like in this scheduled 10 minute call.
FInancial & Progress Report
  • Our financial goal, as stated, is to receive the seemingly random amount of $5987. This represents just a small portion of the total amount needed. We will be personally funding any shortfall. We want you to understand this project IS ALREADY HAPPENING and in full swing.

    The website is already designed and the developers have been contracted

    The Certification Program is already developed & awaiting production

    The Target Practice book is written and is in the editing stage 

    Chris has been contracted to write monthly articles for three major magazines, targeting coaches and parents of goalies

    Chris will be hosting a weekly radio show with a target audience of coaches and parents for goaltenders 

    Our publisher has created all marketing and promotional material for the book. A print date is set. If we fall short of our goal, we will find a way to make it happen, but your support will still help us immensely. If we exceed our goal, we will be able to develop and promote the website faster. This means we help more coaches and goalies, but we can do it more quickly! 

    PS  - The reason for the seemingly random monetary goal. It's the number of goalies and coaches we hope to positively affect in the first year after launch. We expect to reach 5987 minor hockey coaches and goalies, whose lives will be enriched through your support! 

Confidence In The Project Leader

  • Chris Dyson has been involved in many hockey success stories: 
  • Created and launched a $3 million retail online business with the most successful goalie equipment catalogue ever created.
  • Managed and was Head Buyer for a $10 million (annual) hockey retail operation
  • Created his own unique hockey league, now in its 25th season.
  • Successfully operated Puckstoppers Goaltending Development on three continents, serving students from 18 countries. Puckstoppers is now one of the longest-running goalie development programs in the world - since 1988 and now approaching 30 years. 
  • Operated a year-round Goalie Training Centre for nearly 20 years. 
  • Published by Gerry Robert & his team at Black Card Books, who provide world class, recognized, proven Publishing and Marketing experience. 

    We provide this information, to help you understand this is a sound investment in a proven leader in the hockey/goaltending world, and that, because of past experience and acquired knowledge, this Initiative will be a huge success. 

The Global Impact


Target Practice, Initiative has the potential to change the face of goaltending across the globe, but particularly in Canada and the USA, where grassroots coaches do not receive proper instruction on how to teach, motivate or instruct their goaltenders.

The children suffer because of this. They want to improve, they have the desire and the love of the game. Unfortunately they are often left on their own, standing around for much of the practice time or being fed inaccurate instructions and advice - then they are berated for poor play in games.  

This is unfair. It is completely unrealistic to expect a child to grow and progress without proper feedback and someone to help define the root cause of problems, so they can be properly worked on and improved.

The truth is that many young goalies work very hard to improve. Their parents spend a lot of money on summer camps and proper coaching for their children, yet when the season begins, so does the regression of skills and the loss of confidence. 

The reason for this is unfortunate. We are years behind many European countries in regard to proper goalie coaching. It has taken us 20 years to recognize we have fallen so far behind, and it is the young goalies who have unfairly suffered. 

Target Practice has the potential to change the way coaches develop goalies by implementing knowledge and the ability to define root cause problems. This will give these goaltenders the opportunity to progress and improve their overall game play through Essential Core Goaltending Skills training. This will also translate to better team play and improved scoring for players. 

The involvement and support for the entire hockey community will facilitate this change to our game and improve the experience for all goalies. 


Why 'Target Practice?'

When discussing potential names for the book and website, I decided to use a play on words - one that we felt would resonate with coaches, players, parents and goalies alike. 

Many coaches and players refer to goaltenders as 'Targets.' Which when you think about it, is completely incorrect. The object of the game is NOT to hit the goalie. So this in itself shows the complete lack of understanding for the position. 

Goalies aren't 'target's' and one of the biggest issues facing them is improper practice structure and correct coaching. Once again, a common term in hockey is to call practice, Target Practice, which IS the correct thinking if you are just teaching players how to score, but opposite of what we want for the goalies. 

In the end I felt 'Target Practice' was an apt title because it is in fact what a lot of practices become. As players aimlessly blast pucks at the net without any desire to build the goalies confidence or skill level. As well there are many coaches who do not having a solid grasp on the proper coaching methods, technical knowledge or root cause of many common issues goalies face. 

This all leads to goalies often feeling like they are in a shooting gallery and practices become more about survival for them than effective training and skills development time. 

'Target Practice' is therefor the perfect name for a book and project designed to educate the very people who control these situations and have the power to change  ice time time from, 'Target Practice' to an educational experience focused on developing the Essential Core Goaltending Skills for their goalies. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We get it, some people are simply not in a position to contribute.
That doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share the link for this page on your Social Media or email it those you now within the game of hockey. 
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

That is all there is to it, but these simple steps, that take mere seconds, will be greatly appreciated and can make a huge difference in someone's life.

THIS INITIATIVE WILL NOT ONLY BENEFIT COACHES AND GOALTENDERS. TEAMS WILL INCREASE SCORING WITH THE COACHES' IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF PROPERLY PACED PRACTICES, AND PLAYERS WILL BE FACING IMPROVED GOALTENDERS IN MORE REALISTIC, GAME-LIKE SITUATIONS.WE BELIEVE ALL TEAMS WILL IMPROVE IF COACHES EMPLOY THE METHODS AND TECHNIQUES PROVIDED THROUGH THE TARGET PRACTICE INITIATIVE. Every coach should:



Have a copy of this book with them at the rink at all times, and reference it when planning practices or working with their goalie

Become a member (FREE) of Target Practice Initiative website, utilizing the video's and other information to better understand proper drills and discover root causes of goalie problems
Understand that goalie development will help the entire team to score more goals and help players to develop better scoring habits and ability


We know that coaches generally get involved to help their players improve their hockey and life skills, experience success and enjoy the game. 
Unfortunately there is a problem within minor hockey. Many coaches don't know what they don't know in order to help their goaltenders. So they choose to either make it up, BS their way through, or simply ignore the goalies entirely. 
Sure they may shoot pucks at them on occasion and they are part of team skills building drills, but they are really ignored in terms of Essential Core Goaltending Skills (ECGS) development. 
This infuriates parents, demotivates goalies and causes dissension within the team. Many young goalies quit the game they love for these reasons. I've seen this over and over for as long as I've been involved with hockey - most of my life!I have coached goaltenders professionally for nearly 30 years and I am passionate about helping them improve. But I have now dedicated myself to helping coaches get the information they need to work with their most important player, the goalie. By focusing on the coaches and especially at the grassroots level, we will see a greater and more positive impact on the game as a whole. 
Contributors to our campaign will be helping to positively shape the face of hockey - and thousands of goaltenders for many years to come. The trickle-UP effect will change the global landscape for goalies and their future opportunities. 


  
What Those In The Game are Saying





Chris provides what is missing from coaching programs and this is why this book is so important. Much
of the information that is out there is too technical and unless you play the position it’s difficult to
understand, so misinformation is given to the kids by minor hockey coaches who try to tell the goalies how
they think the position should be played.                        Rick Heinz, Former NHL Goaltender 


A lot of coaches aren't that eager to work with the goalie at all. They should be
working to refine the goalies craft throughout the season.John Garrett, Former NHL Goaltender, Professional Commentator with Hockey Night In Canada 







Finally! Chris Dyson answered the questions no-one knew how to ask. After 25+ years involved in the
industry, It’s great to see this grass roots level support and guidance for the most highly criticized, under-
developed position in the game. Don Straus, Founder Armadilla Masks, World Renowned Artist 




I have never before seen information for coaches that is so useful, easily digestible, quick to read and
easy to implement. Hockey coaches and parents everywhere will be thrilled with the content of this book!Colin Hopper, President Source For Sports London, Former President Sports Distributors Canada






Providing coaches with the skills to properly work with their goaltenders is awesome and perfect. I cannot imagine a single coach not jumping at the chance to take advantage of such an opportunity, especially at the grass roots level. Larry Feist Publisher, Hockey Now Magazine 


The game has dramatically changed, but one thing that hasn’t is the core fundamentals of goaltending. Coaches at every level must be able to understand and teach these. Jim Ralph, NHL Broadcaster & Media Personality


Getting the essential core goaltending skills into the hands of grass roots coaches is perfect, it needs to happen. It is a discipline unlike any other. Mike Stubbs, Professional Broadcaster & Radio Personality







If the advice contained in Chris‘ book is made mandatory learning for minor hockey coaches, it will
positively change the face of goaltending in North America. Joni Hallikainen, Former Pro Goaltender, Professional Goaltending Consultant, Professional Mask Builder & Artist











Benefits For COACHES:


Access and Understand Information Easily

Avoid Technical Lingo or Hard To-Understand Descriptions
Find Solutions to Specific Problems 24/7
Accessible Information For All Learning Styles
Solutions to Specific Problems
Run Better, More Effective Practices
Easily Implement Goalie Development Strategies
Alleviate Dissension from Goalie Parents
Resolve Unfair Expectations Placed On Coaches

Understand Your Goalies & Their Needs 

Better Your Overall Team Play & Improve Goal Scoring
Improved Development of Goaltenders
Make Your Job Easier With The Addition of New Knowledge
WIN  MORE GAMES

Benefits For PARENTS:

See Your Child Develop Faster and More Effectively
Gain More Advancement Opportunities
Alleviate The Frustration of Watching Poorly Run Practices
Spend Less On Basic Instruction
Ease Tension with Coaches
Keep Children In the Game Longer
Less Need To Pay For External Coaching
Improve Confidence & Game Play
Receive the Coaching Your Registration Fees Pay For 
More Enjoyment From Watching Your Child 
Less Standing Around, More Coaching

Benefits For GOALIES:

Improved Motivation To Attend Practice
Stop Being Considered a Target 
More Shots Directed With The Intent Of Helping Develop You 
Define and Improve Upon Your Weaknesses With Proper Coaching
Eliminate Confusion and Frustration 
Develop Specific Skills, The Right Way
Improved Understanding & Empathy From Coaches
Develop To Your True Potential
Advance To Higher Levels
Love The Game! 

Benefits For TEAMS:

Improved Scoring Due to Properly Paced Drills and Situational Plays
Come Together as a Team 
Win more games
Players more engaged and excited due to better practice
Improve Attitudes and Earn Greater Respect for the Goaltenders
More challenging practice drills, translates into better game prep
Have More FUN!


Imagine...
There is now a way for YOU to help break the pattern. YOU can change the game itself - make such a positive change, in fact, that players will stay in the game longer, have more fun and drastically improve their skills…because you cared enough to help us. 
Target Practice, 8 Mistakes That Ruin A Love Of The Game, is a book written by Chris Dyson. President of Puckstoppers Goaltending Development, professional coach and goaltending consultant. This book was written in an easy to-digest and quick-to-read format that includes information that any coach can implement in seconds. Coaches and parents are easily able to grasp the concepts required to provide the fundamentals to their goaltenders through proper instruction.But we don't want to stop there. Our plans include a worldwide initiative to help coaches and parents. Just about everyone in the game recognizes the problem, but there is little being done to solve it. So we are taking the Initiative! The book will serve to provide an understanding of the basic principals,  but phase two, Target Practice, Initiative will be a web-based learning tool that coaches can visit for easy-to-understand advice, drills, and information, not to mention the ability to ask true goalie coaches for input on more complex issues. 
The two year goal is to then create a worldwide Goaltender Trainer certification program that every minor hockey coach would be encouraged to take. Successful completion of this certification would ensure coaches had the tools to develop their goaltenders properly and the means to upgrade as desired. 
If you are a coach or hockey executive, board member or parent, you know everything I have stated is true and this is a much-needed educational process. 
You Can Change These Scenarios & Be Part Of Affecting Positive Change: 
Young goalies crying on the ride home because their coach gave them contradictory advice that confused and frustrated them. 
Coaches becoming exasperated because they don't have the proper knowledge to help their goalies
Teams continually losing because the goaltender makes simple, yet uncorrected movements that lead to 'bad' goals. 

Whispering parents concerned that one of the goalies is always costing the team opportunities to win…and not getting any better. 

Young goalies quitting the great game they love out of frustration and anger, because they are confused and unhappy they aren't improving. 
Irate parents waiting in the lobby to ream out the coach because their son or daughter, the goalie, was left standing on the ice for 45 minutes of the practice with nothing to do – and now wonders whether he or she should bother coming to practice at all.
   What We Need To Make This Happen & YOUR REWARDS for Helping Change The Game You have the power to evoke change through our Initiative, but we need your help. 


We're raising $5987 to help pay the nearly $100 000 publishing costs and investment required for development of our new FREE website dedicated to helping coaches throughout the world. Already a sizeable personal investment has been made and we have secured corporate sponsorship from some big players within the game who see our plan and want to be a part of it...but we aren't there yet! 
Your investment will be used to pay for the publication and worldwide distribution of Target Practice, 8 Mistakes That Ruin A Love Of The Game, which will soon be available in both paperback and e-book formats and can obtained in select Source For Sports Stores across the country. The book will feature great information for coaches and parents on Essential Core Goaltending Skills and how to implement strategies for coaching and integrating drills for the goalie into team practices. 

Your contribution will be used to pay for development and marketing of the website Target Practice Hockey Initiative. The website will entice and invite participation from some of the worlds the best goalie coaches and offer one-to-two minute instructional drill clips, video demonstrations and print articles, providing coaches with easy-to-understand information. Every coach and parent already wants this information! The time is NOW to make it happen.  


Perks & REWARDS include: Advanced and signed copies of the book, advertising within to book for a very few qualified sponsors, advertising on our newTarget Practice Initiative website, T shirts, hats, apparel, goalie school enrolments, video coaching,  consulting session, coaching seminars and clinics with Chris Dyson, coaching certification enrolments and a whole lot of love & appreciation through our multiple social media channels.Additional Value Added Perks & Appreciation  



All PERKS with a value of $50 or more, we will include shipping costs (in Canada and the USA only) as well as a personal shout out and thank you on our Social Media channels. 
With all PERKS over $150 we will create a special THANK YOU wall on our website to recognize everyone and a hand written personalized thank you note will be sent by Chris Dyson. 

With all PERKS $999 and over, you will receive a personal  THANK YOU note and a phone call from Chris Dyson to personally let you know how much your commitment and support means. Chris will be happy to discuss hockey, goaltending or anything you like in this scheduled 10 minute call.


FInancial & Progress Report

Our financial goal, as stated, is to receive the seemingly random amount of $5987. This represents just a small portion of the total amount needed. We will be personally funding any shortfall. We want you to understand this project IS ALREADY HAPPENING and in full swing. The website is already designed and the developers have been contractedThe Certification Program is already developed & awaiting productionThe Target Practice book is written and is in the editing stage Chris has been contracted to write monthly articles for three major magazines, targeting coaches and parents of goaliesChris will be hosting a weekly radio show with a target audience of coaches and parents for goaltenders Our publisher has created all marketing and promotional material for the book. A print date is set. If we fall short of our goal, we will find a way to make it happen, but your support will still help us immensely. If we exceed our goal, we will be able to develop and promote the website faster. This means we help more coaches and goalies, but we can do it more quickly! PS  - The reason for the seemingly random monetary goal. It's the number of goalies and coaches we hope to positively affect in the first year after launch. We expect to reach 5987 minor hockey coaches and goalies, whose lives will be enriched through your support! 


Confidence In The Project Leader
 Chris Dyson has been involved in many hockey success stories: 
Created and launched a $3 million retail online business with the most successful goalie equipment catalogue ever created.
Managed and was Head Buyer for a $10 million (annual) hockey retail operation
Created his own unique hockey league, now in its 25th season.
Successfully operated Puckstoppers Goaltending Development on three continents, serving students from 18 countries. Puckstoppers is now one of the longest-running goalie development programs in the world - since 1988 and now approaching 30 years. 
Operated a year-round Goalie Training Centre for nearly 20 years. 

Published by Gerry Robert & his team at Black Card Books, who provide world class, recognized, proven Publishing and Marketing experience. We provide this information, to help you understand this is a sound investment in a proven leader in the hockey/goaltending world, and that, because of past experience and acquired knowledge, this Initiative will be a huge success. 



    

The Global Impact

Target Practice, Initiative has the potential to change the face of goaltending across the globe, but particularly in Canada and the USA, where grassroots coaches do not receive proper instruction on how to teach, motivate or instruct their goaltenders. The children suffer because of this. They want to improve, they have the desire and the love of the game. Unfortunately they are often left on their own, standing around for much of the practice time or being fed inaccurate instructions and advice - then they are berated for poor play in games.  
This is unfair. It is completely unrealistic to expect a child to grow and progress without proper feedback and someone to help define the root cause of problems, so they can be properly worked on and improved. The truth is that many young goalies work very hard to improve. Their parents spend a lot of money on summer camps and proper coaching for their children, yet when the season begins, so does the regression of skills and the loss of confidence. 
The reason for this is unfortunate. We are years behind many European countries in regard to proper goalie coaching. It has taken us 20 years to recognize we have fallen so far behind, and it is the young goalies who have unfairly suffered. 
Target Practice has the potential to change the way coaches develop goalies by implementing knowledge and the ability to define root cause problems. This will give these goaltenders the opportunity to progress and improve their overall game play through Essential Core Goaltending Skills training. This will also translate to better team play and improved scoring for players. The involvement and support for the entire hockey community will facilitate this change to our game and improve the experience for all goalies. 

Why 'Target Practice?'

When discussing potential names for the book and website, I decided to use a play on words - one that we felt would resonate with coaches, players, parents and goalies alike. Many coaches and players refer to goaltenders as 'Targets.' Which when you think about it, is completely incorrect. The object of the game is NOT to hit the goalie. So this in itself shows the complete lack of understanding for the position. 
Goalies aren't 'target's' and one of the biggest issues facing them is improper practice structure and correct coaching. Once again, a common term in hockey is to call practice, Target Practice, which IS the correct thinking if you are just teaching players how to score, but opposite of what we want for the goalies. In the end I felt 'Target Practice' was an apt title because it is in fact what a lot of practices become. As players aimlessly blast pucks at the net without any desire to build the goalies confidence or skill level. As well there are many coaches who do not having a solid grasp on the proper coaching methods, technical knowledge or root cause of many common issues goalies face. 
This all leads to goalies often feeling like they are in a shooting gallery and practices become more about survival for them than effective training and skills development time. 
'Target Practice' is therefor the perfect name for a book and project designed to educate the very people who control these situations and have the power to change  ice time time from, 'Target Practice' to an educational experience focused on developing the Essential Core Goaltending Skills for their goalies. 
Other Ways You Can Help 
We get it, some people are simply not in a position to contribute.That doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Share the link for this page on your Social Media or email it those you now within the game of hockey.  Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   That is all there is to it, but these simple steps, that take mere seconds, will be greatly appreciated and can make a huge difference in someone's life.

story:
The Vietnam Heritage Center (VHC) would like to thank you for your participation, attendance and contribution to our Second Annual Moon Festival Event!  Overall, about 300 people attended to enjoy the games, lantern making, balloon animals, moon cake samples, and folklore performance.  We were proud to share our culture and offer this event free to the public, and we enjoyed strengthening the Vietnamese community by celebrating our traditions. 

VHC hopes that if you haven't donated yet, you will do so for the first time... Even small donations will go a long way in helping us further reduce our expenses.  You can still donate until October 17.  We would like to thank all of our online contributors and tireless volunteers for making this event happen.  

Thank you also to the offline contributors:

Tuyen D. - $250

William P. - $20

Socorro V. - $10

Our estimated total cost for hosting this event is $3,000 which included production and programming costs like advertising, permits and fees, materials for children’s games, tables and chairs, and other logistical and event-related supplies.
Vietnam Heritage Center (“VHC”) is a New York 501 (c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to promoting the rich history and traditions of Vietnam. VHC seeks to provide support for the Vietnamese immigrant community, while at the same time educating the general public and local community on Vietnamese language and culture. We strive to be a resource for all to learn about and celebrate Vietnamese lifestyle and customs.  Below are additional VHC additional VHC activities:

Vietnamese Language class

The Highland Dance for Tet Holiday Events

Cultural Exhibitions

Thank you all for your support!

story:
We are the Los Gatos High School Robotics Team.


This year we are starting up a new team to compete in the First Robotics Competition, in which high school students compete in sports-like competition with custom-built, large robots.


In this competition, students work together to design, CAD, machine, program, wire and build a robot within a 6 week time frame.


In addition to competing, our robotics team does many things within our school and community:


  • Raises interest in STEM throughout our school and community through demonstrations.

  • Trains future engineers in programming, CAD, design, electrical engineering, and machining.

  • Teaches life skills such as cooperation, inclusiveness, teamwork  and professionalism.


Since we are a new team, however, we are looking for funds and adult mentors. We would love your support in any way, be it money, mentors, or any type of materials such as excess sheet metal, computers, and machine tools.


What’s in it for you?

  • Nonprofit: Donations may be tax deductible, depending on your situation.
  • Great publicity: Your logo can be on our Robot, T-shirts, and banners. This will be seen by thousands of people at the events we attend.
  • Perks: You can view our other perks on the sidebar.

Please visit ironclaw972.org or email info@ironclaw972.org for more info.

We want you on our team!

story: Zack est un petit garçon de 5 ans débordant d'énergie mais malheureusement il a une maladie génétique , acidurie glutarique type1 , cette maladie a grandement affecté Zack . Il souffre d'hypotrophie et d'hypertrophie , ce qui l'empêche de pouvoir marcher ou de s'asseoir par lui même . Cette année le tournoi sera une levée de fond pour permettre a Zack d'avoir son fauteuil électrique et une chaise d'aisance, les deux qui pourraient s'adapter avec sa croissance pour quand il est chez son papa. Zack a plusieurs appareils pour l'aider, malheureusement le transport a chaque semaine de tout ce matériel est complexe et nous voulons que Zack ait tous les outils disponible pour lui, peu importe où il est.

story:
Who are we?

We are three high school students who decided to make a difference in the world. Since the first day of class we decided that we were going to attempt to make a change in the world. Our original idea was to create a heirloom organic hydroponics system, we would use heirloom seeds (seeds that haven't been genetically modified), as well as not using pesticides and other harmful chemicals. This idea transformed into an aquaponics system which would be much more beneficial for Haitians.

Where are we from?

We are from the Perry High School Research and Development Class. The project we chose, is a self-sufficient aquaponics system that will help the prevalent hunger problem in Haiti. We chose the project because approximately 78% of Haitians live on less than $2 US dollars a day. Many Americans spend more than $2 for a cup of coffee. Our group decided that as human beings we should help other human beings who may not be as blessed as we are.

What is aquaponics?

Aquaponics is using fish waste to fertilize plants. In an aquaponics system a fish is kept in a container where the water and the waste they produce is used to fertilize the plants in containers (grow beds). The major downside for our group to create this system is that in Michigan a majority of the time that we attend school it is to cold for us to have our system outside as it would be in Haiti. This unfortunately means we have to buy extra items such as a heaters and grow lights. 

What progress have we made?

As of the 5th of October, 2015 we have been able to collect a few supplies to help us get started. We have collected one heater (still need 2-3 more). We have collected one grow bed, we still need at least one more to make our system fully self-sufficient. We have also found one pump to move the water from the containment system of the fish to the grow-bed, along with some PVC pipes to start the piping for the water between the container for the fish and the grow-beds. We also have gotten fish (Tilapia) which will be arriving around the end of October!

What do we still need?

We still have two major purchases to make, we need a container for the fish and grow lights. These two items are what makes up a majority of the cost, due to our current limited budget we can't afford these two things and they will have to come out of pocket if we aren't able to get the funding needed. Our fish have also shipped and will be here in late October/early November and we currently have no money to pay for them so that will also have to come out of pocket if we don't get any funding.

What happens with the Extra Funds? 

We will use the funds for a side project if possible. Our group has solely concentrated on our aquaponics system. After we get our aquaponics system up and running we will start brainstorming a side project and attempt to complete it! If there are still funds left over we will donate them to the other groups in our class!


Thank you-
Fish Veggie Group

story:
Meet Peyton...

When 12-year-old Peyton Robertson noticed a perennial problem in his hometown of Fort Lauderdale, Florida –flooding during the region’s nasty hurricane season he set to work building a better sandbag. 

Peyton’s sandbag contains an expandable polymer that’s lightweight and easy to transport when dry, but that becomes a dense solution to hold bags firmly in place when it’s wet. 

Like many young people, Peyton is changing lives. We want to support young social leaders like him, and tell the world their stories. 

Because today's young leaders are tomorrows global leaders, and all our futures rest in their hands.



Young Leaders is a not-for-profit initiative that hopes to inspire the next generation of young social leaders. 

Working alongside some of Europe's leading scholars, educators and experts - Young Leaders will bring  together 100 remarkable social leaders - aged 25 and under.

Based on a lengthy assessment of these leaders, the project will provide an online tool for aspiring young people to see which leaders they are similar too, and provide them with practical steps they can take to become leaders themselves.

With young people increasingly pessimistic about their future, we hope Young Leaders will help the next generation to think big and start small.

Proudly Supported by 

         



We need £10,000 to help fund develop our interactive resources and ensure they reach as many motivated young people as possible. 

In addition to the development of our resources funding will help build two programmes for aspiring young people
  • Development of the Young Leaders School Programme: a unique one hour lesson plan for aspiring young people in their last year of school. We have teamed up with The Duke of Edinburgh International award to deliver this internationally.
  • Building relationships with leading organisations for the Young Leaders Work Programme: Through this programme we will help mentor and tutor aspiring young people from diverse background and help them find amazing work opportunities. 


We are working along some of Europe's leading experts, academics and educations in leadership. These incredible folks include: 

Professor Angus Laing - Dean of Business and Economics, Loughborough University; Dr Inmaculada Adarves-Yorno - Leadership Lecturer, Exeter University; Professor Lorraine Dearden - Director, Institute for Fiscal Studies; Johannes Moeller - Co-Founder, Edventure ; Kanada Elizabeth Gorla - Founder, Shine Changing Times; Professor Jean-François Manzoni - Chaired Professor, INSEAD; Ketiwe Anjorin - Manager, Sutton Trust; Professor Juan Roure Alomar - Entrepreneurship department, IESE Business School; Dr Sandra McNally - London School of Economics; Professor Vibha Gaba - INSEAD; Dr Jennifer DeWitt - King's College London; Heath Monk - CEO, Future Leaders Trust; Father Richard Peers - Headmaster, Trinity Lewisham; Roger Highfield - Executive, Science Museum Group.

We have partnered with leading UK youth charities including:

Uprising and Ditch the Label and have the support of over 60 schools.

You can join the Young Leaders team by sporting a Young Leaders limited edition t-shirt. Any donation of £60 or over will get you one of these t-shirts.


Find out more @ www.theyoungleaders.co

If you would like to get in touch with us about anything, we would love to hear from you. Please email contact@theyoungleaders.co
story_txt:
Meet Peyton...When 12-year-old Peyton Robertson noticed a perennial problem in his hometown of Fort Lauderdale, Florida –flooding during the region’s nasty hurricane season he set to work building a better sandbag. Peyton’s sandbag contains an expandable polymer that’s lightweight and easy to transport when dry, but that becomes a dense solution to hold bags firmly in place when it’s wet. Like many young people, Peyton is changing lives. We want to support young social leaders like him, and tell the world their stories. Because today's young leaders are tomorrows global leaders, and all our futures rest in their hands.
Young Leaders is a not-for-profit initiative that hopes to inspire the next generation of young social leaders. Working alongside some of Europe's leading scholars, educators and experts - Young Leaders will bring  together 100 remarkable social leaders - aged 25 and under.Based on a lengthy assessment of these leaders, the project will provide an online tool for aspiring young people to see which leaders they are similar too, and provide them with practical steps they can take to become leaders themselves.With young people increasingly pessimistic about their future, we hope Young Leaders will help the next generation to think big and start small.Proudly Supported by          We need £10,000 to help fund develop our interactive resources and ensure they reach as many motivated young people as possible. 
In addition to the development of our resources funding will help build two programmes for aspiring young people

Development of the Young Leaders School Programme: a unique one hour lesson plan for aspiring young people in their last year of school. We have teamed up with The Duke of Edinburgh International award to deliver this internationally.

Building relationships with leading organisations for the Young Leaders Work Programme: Through this programme we will help mentor and tutor aspiring young people from diverse background and help them find amazing work opportunities. 



We are working along some of Europe's leading experts, academics and educations in leadership. These incredible folks include: 

Professor Angus Laing - Dean of Business and Economics, Loughborough University; Dr Inmaculada Adarves-Yorno - Leadership Lecturer, Exeter University; Professor Lorraine Dearden - Director, Institute for Fiscal Studies; Johannes Moeller - Co-Founder, Edventure ; Kanada Elizabeth Gorla - Founder, Shine Changing Times; Professor Jean-François Manzoni - Chaired Professor, INSEAD; Ketiwe Anjorin - Manager, Sutton Trust; Professor Juan Roure Alomar - Entrepreneurship department, IESE Business School; Dr Sandra McNally - London School of Economics; Professor Vibha Gaba - INSEAD; Dr Jennifer DeWitt - King's College London; Heath Monk - CEO, Future Leaders Trust; Father Richard Peers - Headmaster, Trinity Lewisham; Roger Highfield - Executive, Science Museum Group.

We have partnered with leading UK youth charities including:
Uprising and Ditch the Label and have the support of over 60 schools.



You can join the Young Leaders team by sporting a Young Leaders limited edition t-shirt. Any donation of £60 or over will get you one of these t-shirts.






Find out more @ www.theyoungleaders.co

If you would like to get in touch with us about anything, we would love to hear from you. Please email contact@theyoungleaders.co

story:
Hello all!


My objective is to create a lifelong learning center as an adjunct to my already established teepee camp.  It will focus on telling the story of the Native Americans from their point of view and not from the point of view of the occupying Europeans.

  • The foundation for the presentations will be based on  National Geographic's Genographic Project.  I'll share my own results to prove to visitors that we're all related and we should treat each other with respect.

  • I will provide a collection of books.  I plan to buy used books when available to conserve resources.  As you can see, there is much from which to choose.

  • Access to high speed internet  and necessary hardware for patrons' use is another goal.  

Background:

This started as a joke. In 2013 I sold all but 5 acres of my farmland in NW Iowa.  I'm an escapee from the corporate world.  Beginning in the early 80's I wrote software for an employee benefits administration firm I co-founded in downtown Denver, Colorado.  Since 2006 I have been an artisan who makes wooden kaleidoscopes in  a shop I own in a town near the farm.  The farm has been in the family since 1885 and I sold out to my second cousin who had been renting the ground for several years. I am very proud to have helped it continue as a family farm, which is becoming a rarity.   I kept the acreage, groves and some reconstructed prairie. The "old bulls" who hang out at the coffee shops lectured me, "you should bulldoze that place and plant it to corn like God intended!"   I told them, "No, I'm going to start a teepee timeshare."  

When I discovered what people were willing to pay to sleep in a teepee, I realized it wasn't a joke after all.

I found a teepee maker and had him sew the fabric, peel the poles and erect an 18 foot teepee.  I attracted some paying customers in 2014 and discovered the best part of the place was the seclusion.  I now market it as a "campground for introverts".  One customer remarked, "If you want screaming kids and barking dogs, you have to bring your own." Only one person, group, or family is allowed to camp there at any one time.


I discovered another need people have.  Life changes and sometimes we need help dealing with it.  I often tell my kaleidoscope customers the following:

 

"I've found that kaleidoscopes provide a valuable metaphor on life.  Just when you think you've encountered the most beautiful image possible in a kaleidoscope, a slight shift will change everything.  At first, you may feel very disappointed as theoretically, that image will never ever again appear.  However, while different, the new image is also beautiful and you discover that more changes will produce still more beautiful images.  Soon you learn to let yourself go and just look forward to what will happen next."

It is sad, but the lifestyle of pre-contact Native Americans was changed forever when Europeans showed up.  By the same token, the idyllic lifestyle I had growing up on a small family farm is now also gone.  Whether we like it or not, change continues.  My main focus for this fundraiser will be providing books and other learning materials to tell the story from the Native American point of view, not the European point of view.  A secondary goal is prairie education. A tertiary goal is sustainable agriculture education.

My overall goal is to give the world a little taste of what things were like before the kaleidoscope turned and we started spending our entire existence in the fast lane.  Visitors to my teepee camp will have plenty of room to walk on a reconstructed prairie; or just sit and ponder;  or read the books I'll provide;  or watch birds; or look at stars.

Your Contributions will go for:

  • Materials for the learning center including books on Native American culture, prints and exhibits.
  • If the entire goal is not reached or if the goal is highly exceeded;  Amazon has thousands of books available under the search term "Native American."  First choice will be used books so I can stretch the money as far as possible.
For your contribution, you will receive:
  • Access to high demand weekends at the teepee or
  • Unique hand made gifts or



  • Your name on a plaque recognizing various donor levels and in all cases,
  • My appreciation.
 .

Why Contribute Now?

  • You'll expedite my ongoing development of this place.
  • You'll have first access to popular times at the teepee camp which will otherwise sell for much more money later.
  • You'll be recognized at the learning center as one of those who helped early on.

Risks & Challenges

  • I've made this as risk free as possible.  Even without the money, the project continues.
  • The physical products are limited.  The last thing I want to have happen is for this to overwhelm me with production requirements.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Send your friends to my website (www.teepeecamp.com)
  • Use the Indiegogo sharing tools above

story:
Background: 

Educators are an extremely important facet of any society for a multitude of reasons.

Background: 

Educators are an extremely important facet of any society for a multitude of reasons.

Teachers educate the youth of society who in turn become the leaders of the next generation of people by imparting knowledge upon them in their most impressionable years. What these kids learn from their instructors at a young age will stay with them for the rest of their lives. Teachers also bare the responsibility of being familiar with the signs of domestic abuse, and are required to report any such suspicions to the appropriate state agencies.

Educators certainly have a significant mark on the development of young children and teens.  They guide and help develop their students knowledge so that they can go on in life and be responsible and productive members of society

Problem:

Since the financial crisis of 2007-08, funding of education has been the target of cuts in order to pay for the irresponsibility of state government debt. 

Unfortunately any new proposed funding for education from state or federal programs do not always translate toward the classroom, or teacher salaries, and often get lost in administrative or bureaucratic waste. (as seen from No Child Left Behind, Race to the Top, and Common Core)

Many senior educators have not seen a pay raise in the last 6+ years despite inflation and hardships as a result of the economy.  Many are in fact on the verge of losing their homes, retirement, or on the brink of bankruptcy.

Prior to the pay freeze, educators were paid at a minimum of 2 to 3% a year or an average of $1,500 to meet cost of living adjustments (COLA's) a year. Teachers have lost an average of$9,000 in the last 6 years that will never be made up.

The National Median income for High School Teachers is $45,000
The Arizona Median income for High School Teachers is only $39,000

Our Goal:

The purpose of this fund is the following:

  • Identify senior educators who have been in this profession for 10+ years.
  • Who are highly motivated, passionate, and go above and beyond the district lesson plan to ensure the success of his/her students.  
  • Who are in financial hard times as a result of the economy, at no fault of their own.

( if you know someone who fits this description, I want to hear about them... email me at rwtv1989@gmail.com )

Once Identified the Ricksist Foundation will write a check to assist paying down their mortgage, car, or any existing medical bills. 

We will not be able to compensate all the money they were entitled to, but this assistance will take off stress many educators are currently feeling. This fund will serve as a reminder that the community truly cares about them and give them a bit of peace of mind.

Aftermath:
Once fully funded, we will start up a blog to show our success story and the lives you'll have changed forever.

Please donate or share with your friends!

story:
Firgrove Learning and Innovation Community Centre (FLICC) is located in the Jane-Finch area in North York, Toronto. There is currently an after school program offered by FLICC that runs from Monday to Friday for children in the community. The ages of children attending range from those in Kindergarten to Grade 5. 

Why is literacy important?
For young students, primarily those in the Jane-Finch neighborhood, who are in a disadvantaged positions, literacy is literally, a make it or break it for their future. Having resources and systems of support in place to fill the learning gaps experienced by these children are critical in securing a solid foundation for their future. Although creating a solid foundation is important to building their confidence in a growingly competitive educational system, more important is broadening their horizons.

Does Jane-Finch really live up to its stereotype?
The first image that may come to one's mind when they hear about the Jane-Finch community, are often negative ones. This is due to it's notorious reputation which is the result of media's spotlight of negative events in this neighborhood which maintains and reproduces all of the disempowering images and ideas held about the community. The sum of these events, create a form of tunnel vision experienced by both insiders and outsiders of the community.

The power in being able to define and give meaning to one's own self, is fundamental to creating a healthy, balanced and meaningful life. The children in the Jane-Finch community are robbed at defining themselves and their possibilities at a extremely young age. Each time labels are repeated and echoed throughout the community, the hopes and dreams of children are at risk of eroding.

What is our goal?

Our goal is to raise funds to take 30 children to Ottawa for an overnight field trip during the first week of July. The trip will be beneficial to all of the children education wise as they will be visiting Parliament Hill and the Supreme Court of Canada to learn more about Canada. Many of these children are not given opportunities to explore places outside of their neighborhood therefore we would like to give them a chance to view other parts of the province. It would be a wonderful experience for the children to visit Ottawa.
