story:
Suicide Survivors' Club - a family's journey through the death of their loved one

When we were dealing with this tragic event there were no books out there that spoke to us as a family. I found artist Laurie Phillips' whimsical imagery and style for our books to be revolutionary, making it easier for my children and me to open up and talk about the deeply painful, traumatic event that happened to us. I continue to be grateful for the gift I received collaborating with Laurie and getting to witness and support my children's healing process.
                        ~ Rebecca Anderson, Parenting the Suicide Survivors' Club

About The Books

A family's personal journey through the suicide of husband and father Don, as told by wife and mother Becky and their three children, Pattie, Aidan, and Will. Each surviving family member's unique experience is documented in their own words within individual books that, together, compose an artful four-book set.  Created by visionary and compassionate artist Laurie Phillips, the books tell the stories with moving words,  short sentences,  and poignant art graphed onto the pages – revealing the family's emotional ups and downs during the healing process.  A fifth book, Parenting the Suicide Survivors' Club, written by Rebecca "Becky" Anderson, offers her perspective as a mother, wife, and medical professional determined to put her broken family back together again. The memoir can stand on its own or serve as a companion piece to the four-book set.  You may see images from the books by clicking the "Gallery" tab above the video.

The original art books shown above are hand-made prototypes financed and created by Laurie Phillips and Rebecca Anderson. They were not intended to go beyond  family members and a few friends. Because the response to the books has been so overwhelmingly positive and healing, we have committed to making them available to anyone who would like to purchase them, but we need your help to do that. 
Phillips’ imaginative watercolors, shifting perspectives and whimsical cartoons set just the right tone, conveying the tragedy’s pain and resolution without sentimental pathos. ~ Mary Abbe, art critic Minneapolis Star Tribune. 

Suicide - the 10th leading cause of death in the U.S. 

As a nation we have a mental health crisis. The increasing number of deaths by suicide is evidence of that and underscores the importance of our books getting published and out into the world to those who can benefit from them. 

Suicide Survivors' Club is not looking for new members. It is important for us to include the startling statistics listed below to reinforce the need for access to more resources for those at risk for suicide, and those suffering the death of a loved one by suicide.

In 2013 the Centers for Disease Control & Prevention (CDC) reported that: 

  • someone in the U.S. died by suicide every 12.8 minutes, making suicide the 10th leading cause of death for Americans 
  • white males accounted for 70% of all suicides
  • the highest suicide rate (19.1 per 100,000 people) was among people 45 to 64 years - Don was age 52. 
  • men had a suicide rate of 20.2 and women had a rate of 5.5.
  • adolescents and young adults aged 15 to 24 had a suicide rate of 10.9
I'm a living, breathing person, not a fictional character.  I remember a lot of shock, confusion and disbelief, but I also remember my mom being there for us.  As much as I wish it had never happened, we've grown so much together and as individuals because of it.  ~ Aidan Anderson, age 20       

SSC books set the table for a conversation

To reverse the trend of suicide increasing, we need to remove the shame that surrounds it and talk openly and honestly about this serious health issue. We believe our books can help families and friends open up the dialogue about suicide and start a conversation. 

Parenting the Suicide Survivor’s Club is a labor of love and a heartfelt gift to suicide survivors everywhere.  Author Rebecca Anderson shares this most intimate and private journey for the common good of all of us who have shared a death of a loved one by suicide. She provides another option for the healing journey and shows us the way step by step. I am humbled and grateful for Rebecca's generosity of heart and compassion for all of us who grieve as suicide survivors.  ~ Janet Benz, DNP, RN, founder of The Christopher Benz Foundation – lost her son Christopher to suicide at age 17 in 2007.                                                                                                                                                                                  

The Team

Laurie Phillips - Visionary, artist, healer, MFA (abt), CPCC, lost her first husband and cousin to suicide. She's had a successful career as a public artist since 1992, winning many grants and commissions. Art and healing are synonymous for Phillips.  She pioneered a method in 2004 for indoor spaces called Story Graph Portraits, combining photographic images with written narrative fragments excerpted from the subjects' interviews. Pieces of the story are arranged to graph the subject’s shifting emotions, from high/ecstatic to low/desperate. She adds redrawn graphic icons to underline and universalize these emotions. This method was the inspiration for the SSC book project. In addition to her work as an artist, she serves as a stress relief coach in hospitals and other medical facilities, using EFT Meridian Tapping, and also runs a dynamic interactive experiential workshop in art museums titled Art-o-mancy.  Laurie has presented on art and storytelling to help post-traumatic patients at the Mayo Clinic, Saint Catherine University, the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention, The Marsh, and other venues. 

Rebecca "Becky" Anderson - Author, mother, medical professional, BS in Public Health/Sociology, LPN, LCSW, lost her husband, Don, an artist, to suicide in 2002. In memory of Don, and as part of her healing process, she produced an art book entitled Intimate Immensities (2008) highlighting his sculptural works, and was interviewed on Minneapolis Public Radio (MPR) about the book and Don's work. She’s served as a nurse in maternal/child health at Children’s Hospital, Minneapolis, and as a social worker at Saint John’s Hospital, Maplewood, MN. Her primary job and focus after her husband's death was healing her family – seeking out practitioners and therapy methods for herself and her three children, including Filial Therapy, which proved to be very beneficial. She has presented to various audiences on the subject of using art and storytelling to help post-traumatic patients; that include survivors, nursing students, and medical professionals at the Mayo Clinic, St. Catherine University, the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention, The Marsh, and other venues. 

Rebecca’s memoir, Parenting the Suicide Survivors’ Club, expands on her story as told in the book titled "Becky" in the SSC four-book set. It compliments the set well. Her memoir fleshes out her experience of surviving and parenting after the suicide of her husband.  Laurie Phillips created the refreshing art that supports the words. Rebecca is currently exploring her next project as storyteller and author.

The Collaboration

Two years before her husband’s suicide, Rebecca met Laurie and hired her as a coach to support her personal development and long-time passion for writing. Laurie later became part of Rebecca's support network as she started healing. A taste for exploration combined with a deep love for art, storytelling, and healing proved to be the common threads that united the two women. They feel it was no coincidence that they found each other and together embarked on the healing and collaborative journey of the Suicide Survivors' Club books. Rebecca's willingness to allow Laurie into the inner sanctum of her family's grief was based on her trust in Laurie and belief in her artistry.  Becky looked at their project as another healing experience for herself and her children – and it was.


Rebecca and Laurie speak/present as a team, and also individually, about the effectiveness of using art and narrative to heal from trauma and grief.


Our Goal: 

To raise $18,000 to cover our costs to print and market our first installment of books.

The Suicide Survivors' Club books are a "labor of love," and now it's time to get them printed and delivered into the world ~ Do you want to be one of our midwives?

If you want to join our campaign to get the Suicide Survivors' Club books commercially printed and distributed into communities through schools, libraries, churches, synagogues, suicide prevention organizations, mental health organizations, therapists offices, and grief groups nationwide, it will take financial resources to print and market them. 

You can serve as a midwife in the delivery of our 'labor of love' by donating at the dollar amounts listed to the right. 

We invite you to make a contribution that feels comfortable for you. No donation is too small. To show our gratitude, we have included gifts (perks) for each donation level. Please allow 8-10 weeks after the end of our campaign to deliver perks. We also need your help to spread the word through your network - clubs, social media and good old fashioned e-mail :-)

Here's Our Plan

We've come a long way in creating our prototype art books, and have now aligned ourselves with experts in the book business for guidance moving forward. We have researched the options for best quality and best price for the printing of our books and plan to produce 80% in paperback and 20% in hard cover. The reason for this breakdown is cost to people purchasing the books. We want to make them affordable. The hardcover books will have the feel of the original art books and cost almost twice as much as the paperback version. We're still figuring out the price points.
The funds raised from our Indiegogo campaign will finance the first print run of the  books and marketing. At this time we would like to print: 
  • 400 four-book sets - Suicide Survivors' Club  (paperback)
  • 400 memoir -  Parenting the Suicide Survivors' Club  (paperback)
  • 100 four-book sets - Suicide Survivors' Club  (hardcover)
  • 100 memoir Parenting the Suicide Survivors' Club  (hardcover)
If we don't reach our intended goal of $18,000, we will still print as many books as we are able with the amount raised. We can accomplish our goal with your help.

Thank You for your support ~


Laurie and Becky after presenting at Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota, for their Arts in Healthcare Symposium, November 2014.


Please connect with us on Facebook!
story_txt:
Suicide Survivors' Club - a family's journey through the death of their loved one


When we were dealing with this tragic event there were no books out there that spoke to us as a family. I found artist Laurie Phillips' whimsical imagery and style for our books to be revolutionary, making it easier for my children and me to open up and talk about the deeply painful, traumatic event that happened to us. I continue to be grateful for the gift I received collaborating with Laurie and getting to witness and support my children's healing process.                        ~ Rebecca Anderson, Parenting the Suicide Survivors' Club


About The Books

A family's personal journey through the suicide of husband and father Don, as told by wife and mother Becky and their three children, Pattie, Aidan, and Will. Each surviving family member's unique experience is documented in their own words within individual books that, together, compose an artful four-book set.  Created by visionary and compassionate artist Laurie Phillips, the books tell the stories with moving words,  short sentences,  and poignant art graphed onto the pages – revealing the family's emotional ups and downs during the healing process.  A fifth book, Parenting the Suicide Survivors' Club, written by Rebecca "Becky" Anderson, offers her perspective as a mother, wife, and medical professional determined to put her broken family back together again. The memoir can stand on its own or serve as a companion piece to the four-book set.  You may see images from the books by clicking the "Gallery" tab above the video.
The original art books shown above are hand-made prototypes financed and created by Laurie Phillips and Rebecca Anderson. They were not intended to go beyond  family members and a few friends. Because the response to the books has been so overwhelmingly positive and healing, we have committed to making them available to anyone who would like to purchase them, but we need your help to do that. Phillips’ imaginative
watercolors, shifting perspectives and whimsical cartoons set just the right
tone, conveying the tragedy’s pain and resolution without sentimental pathos. ~
Mary Abbe, art critic Minneapolis Star Tribune. 


Suicide - the 10th leading cause of death in the U.S. 

As a nation we have a mental health crisis. The increasing number of deaths by suicide is evidence of that and underscores the importance of our books getting published and out into the world to those who can benefit from them. 
Suicide Survivors' Club is not looking for new members. It is important for us to include the startling statistics listed below to reinforce the need for access to more resources for those at risk for suicide, and those suffering the death of a loved one by suicide.
In 2013 the Centers for Disease Control & Prevention (CDC) reported that: 


someone in the U.S. died by suicide every 12.8 minutes, making suicide the 10th leading cause of death for Americans 

white males accounted for 70% of all suicides

the highest suicide rate (19.1 per 100,000 people) was among people 45 to 64 years - Don was age 52. 

men had a suicide rate of 20.2 and women had a rate of 5.5.
adolescents and young adults aged 15 to 24 had a suicide rate of 10.9

I'm a living, breathing person, not a fictional character.  I remember a lot of shock, confusion and disbelief, but I also remember my mom being there for us.  As much as I wish it had never happened, we've grown so much together and as individuals because of it.  ~ Aidan Anderson, age 20       

SSC books set the table for a conversation
To reverse the trend of suicide increasing, we need to remove the shame that surrounds it and talk openly and honestly about this serious health issue. We believe our books can help families and friends open up the dialogue about suicide and start a conversation. 



Parenting the
Suicide Survivor’s Club is a labor of love and a heartfelt gift to suicide survivors everywhere.  Author Rebecca Anderson shares this most intimate and
private journey for the common good of all of us who have shared a death of a loved one by suicide. She provides another option for the healing
journey and shows us the way step by step. I am humbled and grateful for Rebecca's generosity of heart and compassion for all of us who grieve as suicide survivors.  ~ Janet Benz, DNP, RN, founder of The Christopher Benz Foundation – lost her son Christopher to suicide at age 17 in 2007.                                                                                                                                                                                  
The Team
Laurie Phillips - Visionary, artist, healer, MFA (abt), CPCC, lost her first husband and cousin to suicide. She's had a successful career as a public artist since 1992, winning many grants and commissions. Art and healing are synonymous for Phillips.  She pioneered a method in 2004 for indoor spaces called Story Graph Portraits, combining photographic images with written narrative fragments excerpted from the subjects' interviews. Pieces of the story are arranged to graph the subject’s shifting emotions, from high/ecstatic to low/desperate. She adds redrawn graphic icons to underline and universalize these emotions. This method was the inspiration for the SSC book project. In addition to her work as an artist, she serves as a stress relief coach in hospitals and other medical facilities, using EFT Meridian Tapping, and also runs a dynamic interactive experiential workshop in art museums titled Art-o-mancy.  Laurie has presented on art and storytelling to help post-traumatic patients at the Mayo Clinic, Saint Catherine University, the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention, The Marsh, and other venues. 
Rebecca "Becky" Anderson - Author, mother, medical professional, BS in Public Health/Sociology, LPN, LCSW, lost her husband, Don, an artist, to suicide in 2002. In memory of Don, and as part of her healing process, she produced an art book entitled Intimate Immensities (2008) highlighting his sculptural works, and was interviewed on Minneapolis Public Radio (MPR) about the book and Don's work. She’s served as a nurse in maternal/child health at Children’s Hospital, Minneapolis, and as a social worker at Saint John’s Hospital, Maplewood, MN. Her primary job and focus after her husband's death was healing her family – seeking out practitioners and therapy methods for herself and her three children, including Filial Therapy, which proved to be very beneficial. She has presented to various audiences on the subject of using art and storytelling to help post-traumatic patients; that include survivors, nursing students, and medical professionals at the Mayo Clinic, St. Catherine University, the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention, The Marsh, and other venues. 
Rebecca’s memoir, Parenting the Suicide Survivors’ Club, expands on her story as told in the book titled "Becky" in the SSC four-book set. It compliments the set well. Her memoir fleshes out her experience of surviving and parenting after the suicide of her husband.  Laurie Phillips created the refreshing art that supports the words. Rebecca is currently exploring her next project as storyteller and author.



The Collaboration

Two years before her husband’s suicide, Rebecca met Laurie and hired her as a coach to support her personal development and long-time passion for writing. Laurie later became part of Rebecca's support network as she started healing. A taste for exploration combined with a deep love for art, storytelling, and healing proved to be the common threads that united the two women. They feel it was no coincidence that they found each other and together embarked on the healing and collaborative journey of the Suicide Survivors' Club books. Rebecca's willingness to allow Laurie into the inner sanctum of her family's grief was based on her trust in Laurie and belief in her artistry.  Becky looked at their project as another healing experience for herself and her children – and it was.
Rebecca and Laurie speak/present as a team, and also individually, about the effectiveness of using art and narrative to heal from trauma and grief.


Our Goal: 
To raise $18,000 to cover our costs to print and market our first installment of books.

The Suicide Survivors' Club books are a "labor of love," and now it's time to get them printed and delivered into the world ~ Do you want to be one of our midwives?



If you want to join our campaign to get the Suicide Survivors' Club books commercially printed and distributed into communities through
schools, libraries, churches, synagogues, suicide prevention organizations,
mental health organizations, therapists offices, and grief groups nationwide, it will take financial resources to print and market them. 
You can
serve as a midwife in the delivery of our 'labor of love' by donating at the dollar
amounts listed to the right. 
We invite you to make a contribution that feels
comfortable for you. No donation is too small. To show our gratitude, we have included gifts (perks) for each donation level. Please allow 8-10 weeks after the end of our campaign to deliver perks. We also need your help to spread the word through your network - clubs, social media and good old fashioned e-mail :-)

Here's Our Plan


We've come a long way in creating our prototype art books, and have now aligned ourselves with experts in the book business for guidance moving forward. We have researched the options for best quality and best price for the printing of our books and plan to produce 80% in paperback and 20% in hard cover. The reason for this breakdown is cost to people purchasing the books. We want to make them affordable. The hardcover books will have the feel of the original art books and cost almost twice as much as the paperback version. We're still figuring out the price points.

The funds raised from our Indiegogo campaign will finance the first print run of the  books and marketing. At this time we would like to print: 


400 four-book sets - Suicide Survivors' Club  (paperback)

400 memoir -  Parenting the Suicide Survivors' Club  (paperback)
100 four-book sets - Suicide Survivors' Club  (hardcover)
100 memoir Parenting the Suicide Survivors' Club  (hardcover)

If we don't reach our intended goal of $18,000, we will still print as many books as we are able with the amount raised. We can accomplish our goal with your help.

   
Thank You for your support ~







Laurie and Becky after presenting at Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota, for their Arts in Healthcare Symposium, November 2014.



Please connect with us on Facebook!

story:
How it all started

In the early hours of September 19th 2014, Lord Ashcroft polled more than 2000 people who had voted in the Scottish Independence Referendum. The results suggested that as voters age increased, so did their likelihood to have voted no. 71% of 16 and 17 year olds voted Yes. This is in stark contrast to the 73% of over 65's who voted no. These statistics show that excluding the over 65 age group (appx 17% of Scotlands population incidentally), the result of the referendum would have been a very different story, culminating in a victory for the Yes campaign, even after taking into consideration the 55 - 64 age group who voted 57/43 in favour of no.
So what conclusions can we draw from this? Whilst it would be wholly wrong to apportion blame on the over 65's, the figure of 73% cannot be trivialised or somehow attributed to weighting or fluctuations in opinions and attitudes.
It is worth noting at this point that 27% of the over 65's did have the vision,faith and belief in their people and their country and demonstrated the ability to open their eyes to see the fairer,prosperous and forward thinking country that we know Scotland can and will be.


What We Need to do

It is with the above information that our initiative begins. Our aim is to reach out to that 73% and provide them with the information they need to allow them to reach a balanced and unbiased viewpoint from where they will be able to make an informed, educated opinion on Scotlands future, and not the heavily biased propoganda that is spun by the mainstream media in favour of the Westminster establishment.
So how do we achieve this? A hugely considerable proportion of blame can be attributed to the over 65's lack of access to the internet and to lack of access to other sources that do not fall under Westminster control. However, deep within the darkness of the mainstream media, shines a bright light, a voice of reasoning which presents itself in the form of The Sunday Herald, and its sister publication The National. Our goal is to get a copy of The Sunday Herald into the hands of as many of our senior citizens as possible through sponsorship and crowd funding etc.
It is with great pleasure that we bring you this initiative, and we truly hope that you will get involved as we all strive towards our common goal.
Thank You.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Join our Facebook group at https://www.facebook.com/groups/749582868440440

story:
Intro

My name is Christopher Alexander and I am the founder of the NW Saturday Academy. Along with my beautiful wife Jennell, I have two children enrolled in DC Public Schools. I am a graduate of the University of Virginia and a former captain of UVa’s Men’s Basketball team. I currently work in the Information Technology field as a database developer and Business Intelligence analyst.

Our team also includes parents, community members and PTA leaders Angela Christophe, Aeva Doomes, Carla Ferris and Joshua Hertzberg.

We are excited about the birth of this new Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) learning community right here in our Ward 4 DC neighborhood. We have designed a terrific program which will give our young people a tremendous academic boost as they begin preparing for the important and difficult middle school years. Students will be introduced to computer science, advanced mathematics and robotics in a fun, yet challenging environment that encourages them to use their creativity and meet new friends. 

What We Need

We are passionate about giving young people the tools they need to succeed and I know that you share that conviction. One of our goals is to ensure that this type of engaging enrichment activity is available to any student, regardless of their family's ability to pay.  That is why we created Generation Tech, which will fund $350 scholarships for ten highly motivated students from families with financial need.  Your contribution could be the key to unlocking a limitless future for the next great architect, engineer or sportswear designer. We will be able to serve as many students as we can fund, so every dollar contributed will be put to good use.

What You Get

In exchange for your generous sponsoring of a whole or partial scholarship, we offer several levels public acknowledgement.  If you run a business, the Goodwill you generate by associating with a media-friendly activity such as this could outweigh the benefits of a typical promotion.  Check out our perks section for more details.

The Impact

The NW Saturday Academy and the Generation Tech Fund will provide students and our community with many benefits. Here are three of our main goals:

  1. Provide extracurricular activities to Ward 4 youth that are on par with the offerings available in other parts of the city and in the suburbs. A December 29, 2014 Washington Post article examined the disparity. I responded to a reporter's inquiry: 

    Whether a child attends Shepherd Elementary School, West Education Campus, E.L. Haynes Public Charter School, Powell Elementary School or Bruce-Monroe, she should have every opportunity to find an activity she can become inspired by and invested in. NW Saturday Academy is a great, new option for many of our brightest students.
  2. Encourage girls and underrepresented minority youth to consider STEM as a career. The above chart is UGLY and it, quite frankly, tells a depressing story: too many of our students are bailing out of computer science and other hard sciences before fully exploring their potential. Tech pioneers Bill Gates and Mark Zuckerburg are brilliant, but what separated them from others who were just as intelligent is that they had early access to the experience of coding. By learning programming fundamentals at an early age, students will have many doors of opportunity open as they advance through their academic careers.
  3. Prepare students for Algebra. American students' love/hate relationship with math is well documented. The U.S. usually places around 17th in rankings of industrialized nations on student math achievement, while D.C. trails even that humble average, placing between Italy and Armenia on scales of Global Competitiveness.
  
We need to do better if we want our kids to be in position to control their future. Our program provides students with quality math instruction from a state certified teacher and extra practice with a special online learning component.
The impact of this program is real, but it cannot happen without your support.

Risks & Challenges

This is a big undertaking. There are a lot of moving pieces and, by partnering with DC Public Schools, there are some dependencies that we do not have complete control over.  However, we have a great management team and  a solid plan in place. Our promise to our community of students, parents, donors and neighbors is to faithfully administer this program to provide a top-notch mathematics and computer science learning experience for our children. Our team will utilize our years of experience in the technology, finance, education and government arenas to guide the program to the best result.  For example, "back office", administrative management is often one of hidden mines that sink well-meaning but under-prepared non-profit organizations.  To mitigate this risk, we have designed a customized student information system that we will use to track vital data such as student progress, attendance, etc. We are able to generate reports to fulfill future grant requirements and ensure that every child gets the most out of each weekly activity.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to make a financial contribution at this time, you can still help by getting the word out and bringing attention to this important cause.  Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools, or simply post our link to your Facebook or Twitter feed.

Thank you for your consideration!

story:
Don't Let Them Die!

Alcohol, drug, food and cognition addictions destroy individuals and family members long before they actually die. Whole family addictions can be intervened with, arrested and even 'cured' with the help of this virtual online education and recovery program! Too many hopeless families will not enjoy our Saint Patrick's Day Launch date today or quite possibly any day this year if they do not receive help. 

  • I am Dr. Dan - I was blessed to have devoted my life to saving individuals and families from affective disorders and addictions. These illnesses were well entrenched for generations in my own family and even some of my best friend's families. Like most affected families we suffered alone and in silence. We need your help in bringing our low cost, highly confidential and easiest accessed virtual rehab program for addictions free to all identified patients and affected family members worldwide if we reach our goal on Indiegogo. We believe that affected family and friends of addicts are hurting as much or more than the identified patient and deserve equal access to help and recovery. We believe our Online Rehab Program and even our simple and humble rehab and recovery products may help reduce depression, addictions, suicide and yes even the desperate homicidal despair of some family members in unconscionable pain. It is of course intended for the use of our military, veterans  and their families. I had waiting lists over 2 months long when I helped set up and coordinated Hines VA Addiction Services in Chicago decades ago. ORC insures an end to our heroes being denied help or at best being placed on too common, horrific and death inducing phantom 'waiting' lists.  
  • This campaign will introduce, enhance and make our Online Rehab Clinic (ORC) free immediately to all families worldwide if our goal is reached.
  • Trending social conflicts can be helped with this site. For example, recently 19 year old unarmed and allegedly impaired Tony Robinson was shot to death by a local Madison Wisconsin Police Officer. Our heroes need to learn how to truly understand and help our youth. An ORC type program can help our true heroes and be intra fed, with minimal corporate funding, into every holding, isolation jail and prison cell on this planet. A little over a year ago a substance impaired former high school classmate of my daughter's - Pauli Heenan - was shot dead by a severely impaired Madison Police Officer as well.   

I have tapped my personal and retirement funds to get to this point - we need your monetary help now to open the doors to high quality, easy access, confidential, wait list ending, low cost alternatives where appropriate to traditional and luxury rehab programs. 

What We Need & What You Get

Your support dollars will allow us to permanently make an existing, evidence based, and waiting list proof Online Rehab Clinic free immediately to all families and identified patients across the Globe if we reach our goal. It remains the only virtual rehab program that all family members can attend and use at the same time for a year if desired! We will improve the free program by continued content production and partnering with top specialists, Hospitals, third party providers, Churches, Colleges and Universities,fortune 500 companies, multi-State and multi-Country participation and advocacy etc. 

Over 60 million Affected Family Members are feeling alone, abandoned and ashamed by the addiction of a loved one in the USA alone.

  • By contributing now you will receive all our rehab songs and Albums free as well as free rehab training and mentoring where appropriate with Dr. Dan if we reach our goal.
  • Funds will be applied to new content and spreading the availability of ORC.
  • You and your family can receive free treatment, education or complete our Professional in Residency Certificated Programs for free with your donated monies or perk options.

The Impact

Denial is the biggest Medical Problem. All of us have some kind of character defect or possibly live with an alcohol, drug, food or drug addicted loved one. You could be the influencing factor in helping to save a life or family right now - perhaps your own. We have completed TV shows on denial in our Online Rehab Clinic and will some day will have a Theater Movie produced to eventually reach out to the suffering millions worldwide. 

  • As a contributor you may find yourself helping to save lives and families on possibly a daily basis.
  • Our history of success in developing traditional and luxury rehab programs and products for over three decades are easily discovered in the 'About' section in Online Rehab Clinic (ORC). 
  • Thank you for your time in reading about us and hopefully visiting OnlineRehabClinic.com or purchasing a quality recovery product in our SHOP.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you can't contribute monies – what we call “Buck Bucks”, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please make some noise about our campaign even if you can't contribute money. See our links on the home page at OnlineRehabClinic.com We really value "Buddy Buck" and "Soul Bucks" banked by helping others. In ORC you will learn more about our three currencies or economies. 
  • Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Happy Saint Patrick's Day!
  • God Bless and know that by truly serving others you serve yourself and family ten fold!

programs. 
What
We Need & What You Get
Your support dollars will allow us to
permanently make an existing, evidence based, and waiting list proof Online Rehab Clinic free immediately to all families and identified patients across the Globe if we reach our goal. It remains the only virtual rehab program that all family members can attend and use at the same time for a year if desired! We
will improve the free program by continued content production and partnering with top specialists, Hospitals, third party providers, Churches, Colleges and Universities,fortune 500 companies, multi-State and multi-Country participation and advocacy etc. 
Over 60 million Affected Family Members are feeling alone,
abandoned and ashamed by the addiction of a loved one in the USA alone.

By
     contributing now you will receive all our rehab songs and Albums free as well as free
     rehab training and mentoring where appropriate with Dr. Dan if we reach our goal. 
Funds will be
     applied to new content and spreading the availability of ORC.
You and your family can receive free treatment, education or complete our Professional in Residency Certificated Programs for free with your donated monies or perk options.


The
Impact
Denial
is the biggest Medical Problem. All of us have some kind of character defect or
possibly live with an alcohol, drug, food or drug addicted loved one. You could be the influencing factor in helping to save a life or family right now - perhaps your own. We
have completed TV shows on denial in our Online Rehab Clinic and will some day will have a Theater Movie produced to eventually reach out to the suffering millions
worldwide. 

As a
     contributor you may find yourself helping to save lives and families on
     possibly a daily basis.
Our
     history of success in developing traditional and luxury rehab programs and products for over three decades are easily discovered in the 'About' section in Online Rehab
     Clinic (ORC). 
Thank
     you for your time in reading about us and hopefully visiting
     OnlineRehabClinic.com or purchasing a quality recovery product in our SHOP.

Other
Ways You Can Help
Some
of you can't contribute monies – what we call “Buck Bucks”, but that doesn't mean you can't
help:

Please
     make some noise about our campaign even if you can't contribute money. See
     our links on the home page at OnlineRehabClinic.com We really value
     "Buddy Buck" and "Soul Bucks" banked by helping others. In ORC you will learn more about our three currencies or economies. 
Please
     remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Happy Saint Patrick's Day!
God
     Bless and know that by truly serving others you serve yourself and family
     ten fold!

story:
Short Summary

I have been a qualified teacher for 8 years now, and have been working as a Supply Teacher in various Comprehensive Schools in England and Wales for a number of years now. Every day I work in a different school with different ways of working, and every day I meet new children. 

I looked at various teacher planners on the market and found that they were mainly geared towards regular teachers who teach the same groups every week, they don't allow for much movement in a teachers 'timetable'. For that reason I set about designing, publishing and distributing the 'Cover Teacher's Planner' in 2014/15. This was a great success, and planners were sold to supply teachers and agencies throughout England and Wales. The planner was A4, coil bound, and included some important dates.

Due to the fact that supply teachers run to quite tight budgets (they don't receive holiday pay or pensions), I had to really sell the planner at a cost price, for the whole project in 2014 I made a total profit of just over £30. 

What Has Been Done Differently This Year?

The feedback from the planner last year was fantastic, teachers really valued it and loved it's design and layout, and so the basic principles of this have been kept for the next one. However some suggestions were made and all of them have been actioned:

  • The planner needs to be smaller and lighter - done - the planner is now A5 size instead of A4 and so will be half the size and half the weight
  • Useful telephone numbers and websites for supply teachers - done - some research was carried out to find out what information supply teachers needed the most, and these telephone numbers and websites have been incorporated
  • Create an 'undated' planner - done - As a result of this suggestion I have been able to create an undated planner which has fewer pages and therefore costs less
  • Include 'Safeguarding' information - done - A whole page has been dedicated to Safeguarding information. 

Risks & Challenges

This project is not about making profit, its about getting a product out there which supply teachers can use in their every day work, as a result of that, the price of the planner has to be fairly low to enable teachers to be able to afford it. This indiegogo is a way of getting the initial investment to get the planner printed so that it can be provided to the end user at the lowest possible price. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to buy a planner, encourage schools and agencies to buy them for their teachers. Also, please feel free to get in touch with any suggestions for next years planner.

story:
It’s a fact that more than half of First Nations children in Canada live in poverty. We’ve all heard the stories of inadequate housing, poor nutrition, family break-down and suicide. These are real problems that need real solutions.

Many Canadians have told us they want to help, but aren’t sure how. We are launching this crowdfunding campaign to give you the opportunity to help make a difference in the lives of First Nation kids. The campaign is all about giving our kids a "Passport to Fun" this March Break.

Each March break, our community has held a children’s party. Kids play games, laugh, get silly and hang out with friends. In the past, various programs and services have helped cover the costs of organizing the event, purchasing supplies and arranging healthy snacks. But this year, thanks to cut backs, there are fewer dollars available. With your help, we hope to raise $2,000 to not only throw a party like no other, but also give our kids a real thrill, by renting a bouncy castle and slide!

If you donate more than $25, we'll send you a  'peace' bracelet, handcrafted by the children of our community!

Donate more than $50, and we'll give you a free day pass to our 43rd Annual Delaware Nation Pow Wow , held in our community on Labour Day weekend., September 5 & 6, 2015.

For those who really want to make a difference, donate $100 and we'll arrange for a special walk along our new Weelatéexung Nature Trail with one of our most experienced eco-environmental knowledge keepers!  

All your donations will help our kids have some fun, get out of the house, away from the tv and 'escape from the everyday'  during March Break.

If we are unsuccessful in reaching our $2,000 goal, all donated funds will still go towards our March Break week of activities. We just might not have enough to rent a 'bouncy castle'. :(

All funds will be collected by the Delaware Nation Children's Fund and given to the children's "Passport to Fun" March Break event.

Our crowdfunding project is an opportunity for our different communities to make a connection; to find creative ways to make a difference in the lives of our children. Our children's bracelets, our pow wow invite and trail walk are all about connecting with people from all walks of life.  It's more than just a week of fun, and bouncy castles. It's a chance for our kids to know that there are people 'out there' who care about them, and want to do what they can to help them lead happy, productive and healthy lives. 

Sharing is caring! We challenge you to share our crowdfunding campaign with your social networks and friends! Let them know about our attempt to raise $2,000 so that kids in one First Nation in southwestern Ontario can have some fun during March Break. It truly is their "Passport to Fun"...without having to leave home!

story:
Meditation in every neighbourhood in the world

Just imagine.....

A network of meditation classes in neighbourhoods all around the world, meditating on the same meditation every week. 

How powerful would that be?

I may be a bit over passionate, but I believe that if we could get a critical mass of the world's population meditating (even for just for 10 minutes a day) we would see a huge reduction in violence and ill-will on this planet.

So what makes me think this? 

Because I have seen it with my own eyes.

About me

See Peters bio here.

You see, people who meditate, become calm in themselves, influence the people around them to be calmer and are more likely to take affirmative action to make the world a better place. 

So here is my project.

Create an easy simple set of "How to meditate" instructions available on-line, AND to support meditation leaders to start their own neighbourhood classes all over the world. 

Meditations would be given to classes each week from all philosophies, religions and scientific disciplines. Leaders would be given 2 meditations each week to use in a one hour class, plus all the support they need to run the class.

About Skillful MIND

Our company Skillful MIND has been running retreats successfully for over 5 years covering meditation, yoga and personal empowerment. To find out more about our current retreats visit us at www.skillfulmind.com.au.

Lets get Started!

To get the ball rolling I am looking for just $7,000 to create the web pages, and video the teachings. 

You can donate anything from $10 up. And to show our appreciation we have some great perks. 

These funds will help us create the web resources, film the videos, create the back end support system and do the marketing to reach people around the globe.

All I need are:

  • Investors - to help fund the basics
  • Supporters - to spread the word
  • AND Leaders to make the vision a reality.


Are you our next leader?


Skillful Mind have the philosophy that all meditation is good for the planet, and the more people practising the better. For that, however, we need Leaders. 

That is why Skillful MIND is now offering a Meditation Leaders program for you to become a meditation leader in your own community - fully supported by Skillful Mind.

Perhaps you already work in a role where teaching meditation to others would be of enormous benefit. You can of course just read out guided meditations from a book - nothing wrong with that! But if you would like to empower yourself with a deeper understanding of meditation, so that you can teach more powerfully and at a deeper level, then joining the Skillful Mind team may be for you!

Our Vision

  • To have weekly "Refresh" meditation sessions around the world.
  • To provide access to teachings, trainings, retreats, events and ongoing support from Peter Radcliffe and the Skillful Mind Team
  • To spread the benefits of meditation to communities everywhere, and enhance people's lives
Benefits to you
  • Support your community with a truly beneficial service
  • Improve your own meditation practice
  • Meet new friends 
  • Join a close knit group of supportive fellow leaders
  • Use this opportunity to promote your existing business
  • Assistance from other leaders for sickness and holidays (receive and give)
  • Support from Skillful Mind team with admin, marketing and customer service
  • Extra weekly income

Parts of the project

Part 1: Provide clear simple instructions on line as to how to meditate. These will include beginner (experience meditation), intermediate (learn how to meditate on your own with skill) and experienced, (understanding mediation at a deeper level).

Part 2: Co-ordinate teachers in every city around the world to teach weekly meditation classes. Each teacher will be given 2 meditations per week to use in each class meaning that everyone across the planet will be doing the same meditations each week to increase the power of effect it has on the world.  

Your Team

Your Skillful MIND team leaders are:

  • Peter Radcliffe - Founder and teacher
  • Marian McLucus - Organisation Manager
  • Mardi Rogers - Happiness Manager


Other Ways You Can Help

The most important part of this project is going to be good old fashioned word of mouth. So one thing you can do to help is just to share, email or talk about our vision to your friends. We appreciate the shout out!

1) Visit and share our face book event link:  https://www.facebook.com/events/439851492892785/

2) Send out the following tweet:

  "Lets help get meditation classes to our city: http://igg.me/at/meditatetogether"

3) Email us directly to give us your feedback at   peter@skillfulmind.com.au

story:
Short Summary

Hi! Our names are Kelly, Eva, Thomas, and Theo, and we're students at Westside Middle School. We're working on a project with our mentor that will turn a virtually unused room in our school into a MakerSpace, or a place where students can get together and bring their creative ideas to life. This may include inventions, designs, art projects, or computer programs. In this room, there will be supplies of all kinds, from construction supplies to art supplies. There will also be interactive and consumable technologies- like a 3D printer and programmable textiles. We need your help to bring our design for this room to life!

What We Need & What You Get

We need approximately $10,000 USD to purchase the supplies and machinery for the room as well as the furniture that students will need to create their projects on. One of the most exciting aspects of our project is that it's entirely created, run, and driven by students. Any student will be able to provide feedback on the room. 

The room will help to enhance student understanding, confidence, and excitement in the science, math, technology, and engineering fields. They will be able to explore the design and invention process first hand as well as learn new tricks- they'll be taught how to use a 3D printer and how to program a computer. This is something that most students would never get to experience in the classroom.

What we're looking to purchase-

 -A desktop computer for creating programs and designing 3D printer projects

-3D printer filaments and accessories

-Makey Makeys, LilyPads, and other consumable technologies

-Art supplies, such as paints, and construction supplies

-A drawing table for designing projects

-Cabinets and shelves for storing supplies

-A lego wall for designing projects

-A bar and barstools to create a 'maker bar' 

-Tools and hardware for bringing the room to life and mounting different structures and for students to use while creating their projects

-Safety gear

-Tools for creating a documenary

                                                                               

All of the money contributed will go to this space- even if we don't get entirely funded, we will be able to change and compromise our designs to make it work. 

If you contribute, you can choose to have your name added to the documentary we are making about the creation of this space. This documentary will be shown at the NETA, or the largest teacher conference in Nebraska. Of course, we can always make your name anonymous.

The Impact

Your contribution will help with the construction of the space, which will enhance the education of students at Westside Middle School for generations to come. The space will allow students to not only use creativity to create new things, but will teach them many skills they will need in the workforce, such as being able to communicate their ideas with peers, as well as get them interested in careers involving engineering and technology, which is of growing importance in this day and age. 

By contributing, you will allow us to purchase more supplies and technologies which will widen the number of things students will be able to create. 

You will enrich the futures of students by giving them an opportunity to explore parts of themselves they may have never been able to find in the classroom. They will be able to learn how to use machines relevant to today. They will be able to create things the world has never seen before. They will have confidence within the science, technology, engineering, and math fields that they can carry with them for life.

Challenges

Since the room is pretty small, it will be hard to accommodate a lot of big machines. It will also be hard to fit more than 10-12 students at a time. There are approximately 948 students in our school. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, the share button on this page is so helpful, and we would be beyond thankful if you were to share this page with a friend or family member. Like our page on Facebook, and follow us on Instagram, @WMSmakerspace.

story:
Our Vision:

Dear Friends and Family,

Dr. Rickie Byars Beckwith, founder of Kuumba School, asked me to create a Public Service Announcement (non-profit commercial) to raise money for children's scholarships. 

During the filming of the PSA, we discovered  an important message about education that was visionary and inspiring.

We are seeking your help and support to shoot additional days, complete the post production and get these videos out to the public.

Our goal is to use the PSA to raise funds for scholarships for children. We plan to use the Short Film to get the word out about the school, which includes submitting to film festivals in the Short Film Documentary category. 

We are grateful for any of your support.

Yours,

Rami Rivera Frankl

Writer/Director 

PS. We are 503 (c) non-profit. Any donations made to the Kuumba School are tax deductible.  :)



Kuumba In Motion ♪♪♪

"Kuumba In Motion is an innovative learning academy that nurtures the creative genius within children, by inviting them to participate in an education that is centered around their own way of learning. 

Our priority is to serve the children of the inner city and beyond who also deserve access to alternative, experiential models.

While academic excellence is a high priority, of equal importance is that a child will be a kind and respectful individual, in tune with their gifts, and inspired to bring their voice and talents to the world to make it a better place." 

- Dr. Rickie Byars Beckwith.



Impact!

We are 503 (c) non-profit. Any donations made to the Kuumba School are tax deductible. 
So far we have shot two days of footage of the school as well as interviews with the founder, teachers and children. With your help we will complete the PSA, a short film documentary and provide clips for the Kuumba School Website. Any funds beyond our ask, will go directly to the school to help with scholarships, computers and much more.

We need to raise $7,500 in funds for:


Perks!

Anything donated is amazing and greatly appreciated, so we'd like to share some gifts as a thank you!


Our Grand Contributors!

                                            

                                    


About Founder Dr. Rickie BB!

The Founder of the School is Dr. Rickie Byars Beckwith. Dr. Byars Beckwith has dedicated her life to music and making a better world for everybody. Here's a Link to TEDx Talk she gave in Hawaii.  (https://youtu.be/HFUp9IH6xmU) 

Dr. Rickie Byars Beckwith is one of the 21st century’s most revered singer-songwriters whose transcendent music opens the heart, touches the soul, and uplifts the spirit.

Dr. Rickie’s extensive music catalog is heard on the radio and on soundtracks for movies and television.  Her songs of unconditional love and spiritual transformation are the highlight of consciousness raising events throughout the world.  She has performed in five sessions with His Holiness the Dalai Lama, at Green Festivals across North America, and at countless Peace Concerts that promote unity and the principles of non-violence.

“Spirit encourages me to be a voice of inspiration,” says Rickie.  In being an example of change and possibility, Rickie supports numerous organizations that work tirelessly to help improve the lives of others.  Several times each year, Rickie organizes benefit performances and music compilations that help gather ideas and resources that bring “Water to a Dry Land.”

In Culver City, California, Rickie is the Music and Arts Director of the Agape International Spiritual Center where she directs the 200-member Agape International Choir. Together with her husband, Rev. Dr. Michael Bernard Beckwith, founder of the Agape International Spiritual Center, their powerful partnership has resulted in a dynamic catalog of songs that enable transformational healing through the power of music.

                                                         


Kuumba School!

"At Kuumba School We celebrate all the time. We celebrate when a child/student discovers his/her unique voice and we build upon the belief that the real journey of education begins as we discover the gift that we each came to know, refine, and to share with the village.

We believe that what a child came to bring to the world will be divinely related to what he loves to do.

We believe that the more exposure anyone has to Nature, the Arts and Creative Sciences by means of fun-filled hands on interactive-activities, out of doors play and field trips to places that spark the imagination; the happier and more inspired the child will be.

We believe that inspiration activates potential and that a true education will reveal and hone the true potential in the child; and that the child will then be encouraged to bring his or her mighty gifts to the world!"

Visit http://www.kuumbainmotion.org/ for more information!

Please Help us reach our goal to help advertise this amazing school! Any funds raised beyond our goal will go directly to Kuumba School!

Thank You!
story_txt:
Our Vision:Dear Friends and Family,Dr. Rickie Byars Beckwith, founder of Kuumba School, asked me to create a Public Service Announcement (non-profit commercial) to raise money for children's scholarships. During the filming of the PSA, we discovered  an important message about education that was visionary and inspiring.We are seeking your help and support to shoot additional days, complete the post production and get these videos out to the public.Our goal is to use the PSA to raise funds for scholarships for children. We plan to use the Short Film to get the word out about the school, which includes submitting to film festivals in the Short Film Documentary category. We are grateful for any of your support.Yours,Rami Rivera FranklWriter/Director PS. We are 503 (c) non-profit. Any donations made to the Kuumba School are tax deductible.  :)Kuumba In Motion ♪♪♪
"Kuumba In Motion is an innovative learning academy that nurtures the creative genius within children, by inviting them to participate in an education that is centered around their own way of learning. Our priority is to serve the children of the inner city and beyond who also deserve access to alternative, experiential models.While academic excellence is a high priority, of equal importance is that a child will be a kind and respectful individual, in tune with their gifts, and inspired to bring their voice and talents to the world to make it a better place." - Dr. Rickie Byars Beckwith.Impact!We are 503 (c) non-profit. Any donations made to the Kuumba School are tax deductible. So far we have shot two days of footage of the school as well as interviews with the founder, teachers and children. With your help we will complete the PSA, a short film documentary and provide clips for the Kuumba School Website. Any funds beyond our ask, will go directly to the school to help with scholarships, computers and much more.
We need to raise $7,500 in funds for:Perks!Anything donated is amazing and greatly appreciated, so we'd like to share some gifts as a thank you!




Our Grand Contributors!












                                            

                                    


About Founder Dr. Rickie BB!

story:
Overview

TEDxPhiladelphia needs your help! At our last conference in June 2015, we shared tears, laughter, and a good handful of standing ovations thanks to our line-up of phenomenal and absolutely inspiring speakers. The conference theme, And Justice for All, sparked so much emotion and passion for change in the audience that now we want to share those exciting talks with the world! 

So what's the rub? TEDxPhiladelphia is a volunteer-driven labor of love but passion, dedication and good intentions aren't quite enough to get some things done. As we enter the final stretch of 2015 video production and begin planning for 2016, we  need your financial help to get us there! 

Please consider making a donation to help us launch our amazing 2015 speaker videos into the world and to help us start off strong with planning our 2016 event. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to raise $12,000. Your generous donations will go towards:

  • Post-production video editing, sound mixing, titling, sub-titling, from rough cuts to final cuts, plus lead-in trailers for all 14 TEDxPhiladelphia 2015 speakers and our 2 wonderful performing arts and music groups (see the full lineup below!)
  • Planning expenses and vendor deposits for TEDxPhiladelphia 2016.

At the 2015 conference, Charles H. Ramsey spoke about ways to help strengthen police community relations across the country, in this period of growing civil unrest.

The Impact

TEDx videos are viewed and shared by millions of people all over the world. The TEDxPhiladelphia 2015 theme, And Justice for All, carried an especially powerful universal message that transcends national boundaries. Our 14 speakers offered perspectives that will be of value to citizens everywhere – perspectives that particularly resonant because they come from Philadelphia, the Cradle of Liberty.

As a not-for-profit initiative, created in the spirit of the TED conference mission, (“ideas worth spreading”) TEDxPhiladelphia brings together engaging speakers and inquisitive participants to deconstruct, decipher and explore the greatest challenges and innovations that shape and are shaped by Philadelphia and the city's inhabitants.

TEDxPhiladelphia events, licensed by TED,  offer interactive, immersive experiences for all participants, from speakers to attendees. The annual TEDxPhiladelphia conference provides a platform for multiple points of view to interact within a common environment – building dialog amongst interested groups.

Philadelphia Daily News reporter Ronnie Polaneczky said listening is an act of justice – for those on society’s margins but also for anyone subject to another’s power. 

Risks & Challenges

TEDxPhiladelphia is a big undertaking that requires lots of hard work and passion from dozens of volunteers and creative partners each year. Through this year's growth in attendance and interest, we were able to deliver an enticing and provocative conference with an incredible line-up of speakers. Our intention now is to grow TEDxPhiladelphia as an organization that lives on more actively year round, through its website TEDxPhiladelphia.org (generously developed and donated by Happy Cog) and through other activities, so that TEDxPhiladelphia becomes a valuable civic resource for years to come.    

Although our fundraising efforts fell a little short this year, we hope that those of you who experienced the excitement and positive energy at the 2015 event will contribute a few more dollars now so that we can share that magic with the world and take the next steps to producing many more years of TEDxPhiladelphia with YOU as our proud partner!

David Norse, the first openly gay man to be ordained as a Presbyterian Pastor in Philadelphia, explored the intersection of Christian and LGBTQ identity.

Our 2015 Speakers

Speaker talk topics at TEDxPhiladelphia 2015: And Justice For All ran the gamut, from exposing the threat of modern surveillance systems, to new ideas for community policing, social-impact real estate, advancements in the fight to protect the legal rights and interests of children at risk, and the accessibility and affordability of rehabilitation robots. The inspiring speaker roster included: Brigitte Daniel, Gregory Heller, Stacy Holland, Jesse Krimes, Marsha Levick, David Norse, Ronnie Polaneczky, Michelle Johnson, Yasmine Mustafa, Charles H. Ramsey, Jeffrey Rosen, Fabricio Rodriguez, Rosa Sheng, and Antonio (Tony) Valdés. Performers included Chill Moody, one of the most dynamic lyricists & performers to hit Philadelphia in years, and Worldtown Street Music, a live house music band that fuses musical elements from around the world. The conference was hosted by Erica Atwood.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you can contribute monetarily at this time, you can still help spread our message in these four simple ways:

  • Forward our Indiegogo campaign to all of your friends
  • Follow us on twitter – @TEDxPhilly
  • Like us on facebook – /TEDxPhilly
  • Follow us on instagram – @tedxphilly

Performers included Chill Moody, one of the most dynamic lyricists & performers to hit Philadelphia in years, and Worldtown Street Music, a live house music band that fuses musical elements from around the world. The conference was hosted by Erica Atwood.





Other Ways You Can Help

Like us on facebook – /TEDxPhilly


Follow us on instagram – @tedxphilly

story:
What is happening at 'Peace is Free'?


This winter 30 children aged 14 and 15 from around Great Britain will come together for eight days to explore the theme of 'Peace is Free'. Through friendships, games and experiential activities led by the participants, the group will work together with another local organisation to discuss the cost of war and the benefits of peace.

'Peace is Free' is the latest 'Project GB', a national programme of CISV Great Britain, which aims to educate and inspire action for a more just and peaceful world. Now in its fifth year and eighth camp, 'Project GB' runs two camps a year for children age 12 and 13, and 14 and 15. 


What we need and how you can help

You can play an important role in this life-changing event. The total estimated cost of the camp is £5000. 

Whilst most of the cost will come from participation fees, we hope that with your support we can fund a number of participants to attend the camp that otherwise would not be able to afford to.


The Impact of your donation

Your donation will contribute to an experience that will bring many benefits to the youth from around Great Britain who will be participating. 

For these participants the ideas and friendships developed on the camp will impact them for the rest of their lives, transforming them into active global citizens.

Other Ways You Can Help

CISV Great Britain is a national organisation with many opportunities for people of all ages. Find out more at www.gb.cisv.org. 

Be sure to follow CISV Great Britain on Twitter and to like the Project and CISV Great Britain on Facebook.

And don't forget to spread the word about this Indiegogo campaign! Use the sharing tools or email to let your family and friends know that you support our campaign.

More About CISV

CISV educates and inspires action for a more just and peaceful world. Through its seven programmes and work in over 200 cities around the world CISV reaches over 10000 people a year. CISV is non-political, non-religious impartial organisation.

story:
Wesley Students Studying Abroad

In the summer of 2016, 18 Wesley International Academy students in 6th, 7th, and 8th grades will spend 4 weeks in China and Nanjing University. All of the students selected for this trip completed an application and interview process in English and Chinese. They have all taken Chinese at Wesley International Academy for at least 4 years. During this trip, the students will further their studies in Chinese by taking daily classes at Nanjing University. They will also be fully immersed in the Chinese language and culture by exploring the community through field trips and taking enrichment classes at a local school with Chinese middle school students. The students, their families and friends, and the Wesley International Academy community are all thrilled for this amazing opportunity for our students! 

What is Wesley International Academy?

INTERNATIONAL BACCALAUREATE.
SINGLE GENDER EDUCATION.
MANDARIN CHINESE.

OUR MISSION at Wesley International Academy is to develop in students the discipline of learning and a life-long desire for knowledge through a world class International Baccalaureate education.

OUR VISION is to develop students who are global citizens and are academically competitive by international standards of excellence.

Wesley International Academy is a K-8th grade public charter school in the city of Atlanta, GA.

Why Study Abroad?

Our world gets smaller everyday. Through advances in technology our ability to interact with the rest of the world has become something that our children take for granted. Bearing this in mind the ability to empower our children with the tools to be effective global citizens with not only the ability to compete but to connect with the world has never been more important. Wesley International Academy in South Atlanta is doing the work of preparing this generation of young people for global citizenship. At Wesley we believe that being multi-lingual is an essential part of being an effective global citizen. From the time our students enter Wesley in kindergarten until they graduate in the 8th grade they are taught to read write and speak Mandarin Chinese for 45 minutes a day. Through our International Baccalaureate curriculum we are educating children who will be academically competitive by international standards of excellence. At Wesley we realize the importance of developing well rounded citizens who are not only academically prepared but who possess strong character. We achieve this goal by infusing our student’s daily educational experience with the “Wesley Way”:
We act with integrity. We practice compassion. We reflect on our actions. We embrace the diversity of our global community.

What We Need & The Perks You Get

We are currently fundraising for the upcoming 2016 China Summer Program trip.  We are asking for your assistance in continuing our work of preparing our young people for the future and opening their minds to the possibilities and opportunities that hard work and determination can provide.    Your generous donation will allow our students to travel to China and experience an academically robust, socially challenging, and emotionally rewarding trip.

  • Funds raised will help offset the total cost of the program for 18 students to participate. It will help cover partial tuition, room and board, and possibly travel costs as well.
  • To show our appreciation for your support, we are offering personalized e-Thank You cards, a Chinese language video lesson, and even special hand selected gifts from China for different contribution levels.  

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us reach our goals in more ways than making a contribution.  Please help us get the word out and share our Indiegogo campaign with your network of friends, family, and co-workers.  No amount is too small!

  • Don't hesitate to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Xie Xie Peng You! Thank You Friend! 

(pronounced: sheh sheh pung yo)

story:
Short Summary

We are 5 engineering and communication students from Oporto University, in Portugal. We are very active individuals who have been involved in organizing several successful projects before, such as an awareness documentary, a fully-funded educational exchange and contributing for improvements for the University. Our next project is focused on something different, aiming to bring a positive change to the community.

We have created a filtered database which connects outstanding university students to different startups affiliated to us. By providing these organizations with the resources they need to grow, we are also allowing students to expand their CV whilst working and getting paid while studying there. Another focus point is organizing workshops and other educational events for our associates.

All of this would result in a greater expansion of new Startups and in increasing the number of opportunities available for students.


What We Need & What You Get



At this point, we have already 5 developed startups affiliated to us and several students interested in joining the network. The only thing missing are funds to pump the project up. These funds would be used in the following way:


  • Materials and events for advertising – expanding our network through paid social media advertising and events; design, printing and audiovisual production of materials for promotional purposes; organizing and sponsoring programs to improve our partner’s experience: workshops, lectures, seminars and other opportunities; (1700€ per year)


  • Legalizing, registering and assuring legal aspects of our organization (600€/once plus 3000€ per year);


  • Opening and maintaining a bank account for the organization (300€ per year);


  • Maintenance of U.Project’s website and database (server - 100€ per year, website - 300€ once) ;


  • Affording the intervention of lawyers in legal aspects of U.Project's organization and activities (1000€ per year);


  • Affording a co-working space for U.Project’s management team (1000€ per year);


For every 25€ donated by people you refer our project to, you will receive a free EcoBook and pen!  By supporting us, either if you are a start-up or a university student, you will not only be integrated on our network but also be contributing for its existence and success.

Even if we do not get the amount we proposed, all money will be used in promoting and improving our network, our database and the experiences we can provide to students.


The Impact



                                                  


In recent years, new companies, projects and start-ups have grown in number. Most of them fail to prosper, as they lack the resources to grow or to become sustainable. The long process of finding the right engineers, marketing staff, a financial or a graphic design team is one of the biggest current challenges new entrepreneurs face.

Our non-profit organization wants to fix this, by allowing startups to access our network of talented university students, who want to gain more professional experience and money while studying. This mechanism will considerably reduce all bureaucracy, time and expenses required to integrate the right students in the expanding startup, in each given context. U. Project gives these outstanding students the chance to work with startups through internships, part-times or microprojects. This allows them to improve their CV and to be paid for their work. We make sure all startups are capable of providing students with a proper income.

Our concept of joining new corporations with university students is a great step in helping the development and growth of both sides. Your contribution, no matter how small, will make a huge difference in increasing our impact.

The members of this team are prepared to bring success for this project. In the past, they have been involved in creating other Startups and very successful initiatives, such as organizing and fully-funding a 3 day Academic Orientation Program for highschool students, a 5 day international group trip of young scouts and effectively raising awareness towards a critical problem in the community, reaching out to more than 60 000 people.  


Risks & Challenges


 


The problems we may find are as follow: we may not have the sufficient funds to carry on with our project as we intend; the lack of funds may also prevent us from expanding our team and taking the concept beyond borders. These problems can be reduced with focused campaigns, intense advertising and presentations.

Nonetheless, we couldn’t have a better team to overcome these struggles. The members of our team are very engaged students, having received training in conflict resolution, entrepreneurship, project management, team managent and business planning and management . One of us is currently attending UPTEC’s Start-ups school and other member has participated in a training at a U.S. fully funded institute - the Benjamin Franklin Transatlantic Fellowship.


Other Ways You Can Help



If you cannot help us financially, please share our campaign with your university friends and startups who could be interested in joining our network! Your help is important in connecting talent to opportunity.
