What We Need & What You GetAt this point, we have already 5 developed startups affiliated to us and several students interested in joining the network. The only thing missing are funds to pump the project up. These funds would be used in the following way:Materials and events for advertising – expanding our network through paid social media advertising and events; design, printing and audiovisual production of materials for promotional purposes; organizing and sponsoring programs to improve our partner’s experience: workshops, lectures, seminars and other opportunities; (1700€ per year)Legalizing, registering and assuring legal aspects of our organization (600€/once plus 3000€ per year);Opening and maintaining a bank account for the organization (300€ per year);Maintenance of U.Project’s website and database (server - 100€ per year, website - 300€ once) ;Affording the intervention of lawyers in legal aspects of U.Project's organization and activities (1000€ per year);Affording a co-working space for U.Project’s management team (1000€ per year);For every 25€ donated by people you refer our project to, you will receive a free EcoBook and pen!  By supporting us, either if you are a start-up or a university student, you will not only be integrated on our network but also be contributing for its existence and success.Even if we do not get the amount we proposed, all money will be used in promoting and improving our network, our database and the experiences we can provide to students.The Impact                                                  In recent years, new companies, projects and start-ups have grown in number. Most of them fail to prosper, as they lack the resources to grow or to become sustainable. The long process of finding the right engineers, marketing staff, a financial or a graphic design team is one of the biggest current challenges new entrepreneurs face.Our non-profit organization wants to fix this, by allowing startups to access our network of talented university students, who want to gain more professional experience and money while studying. This mechanism will considerably reduce all bureaucracy, time and expenses required to integrate the right students in the expanding startup, in each given context. U. Project gives these outstanding students the chance to work with startups through internships, part-times or microprojects. This allows them to improve their CV and to be paid for their work. We make sure all startups are capable of providing students with a proper income. Our concept of joining new corporations with university students is a great step in helping the development and growth of both sides. Your contribution, no matter how small, will make a huge difference in increasing our impact.The members of this team are prepared to bring success for this project. In the past, they have been involved in creating other Startups and very successful initiatives, such as organizing and fully-funding a 3 day Academic Orientation Program for highschool students, a 5 day international group trip of young scouts and effectively raising awareness towards a critical problem in the community, reaching out to more than 60 000 people.  Risks & Challenges The problems we may find are as follow: we may not have the sufficient funds to carry on with our project as we intend; the lack of funds may also prevent us from expanding our team and taking the concept beyond borders. These problems can be reduced with focused campaigns, intense advertising and presentations.Nonetheless, we couldn’t have a better team to overcome these struggles. The members of our team are very engaged students, having received training in conflict resolution, entrepreneurship, project management, team managent and business planning and management . One of us is currently attending UPTEC’s Start-ups school and other member has participated in a training at a U.S. fully funded institute - the Benjamin Franklin Transatlantic Fellowship.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you cannot help us financially, please share our campaign with your university friends and startups who could be interested in joining our network! Your help is important in connecting talent to opportunity.

story:
Short Summary

A central hub for students to interact with each other about everyday student life.

Feedit is made up of three founders:

  •  Ryan Cornateanu, Founder, a computer science major at UCLA. The idea behind Feedit came when was he was just a freshman.
  •  Vlady Cornateanu, CEO/Co-Founder, helped grow the business to what it is today. 
  • Ethan Mezrahi came in as an investor and later on became the Vice President of Feedit, growing its social media market to thousands of users.
  • Our campaign to raise $100,000 will allow Feedit to grow nationally and enable to upgrade the app to its full potential in the user experience field.  The goal is to market to all 200 major universities in the country and eventually grow globally
  • By helping us raise the necessary funds you will be helping us target the entire US student population as well as helping the students effectively communicate in their classes & forums like never done before.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The goal is to raise $100,000
  • We are offering a variety of high-end apparel related items with our company logo. 
  • If we do not reach the entire goal, the funds raised will still be used very efficiently towards marketing.

The Impact

  • Feedit is the only exclusive social network for college students. In order to sign up, a student is required to have a legitimate .edu e-mail. Each school has its own private network to meet, communicate and share with their fellow students.
  • In only five months after launch, we had over 10,000 users log onto the app.
  • Our  student community needs to continue growing,  therefore engaging in heavily targeted marketing.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • As any social media app including the largest ones in the market today, the initial growth is slow and monetizing takes about one to two years.
  • With heavy targeted marketing in the largest US colleges we hope to maximize, in a shorter period of time, the critical student mass necessary to make it attractive for companies to advertise. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • There are more ways to help than just money. If you are interested in becoming a campus ambassador, feel free to email us.
  • Please help share this campaign to all your friends and family!

story:
I'm Barry Michaels and I'm running as a Democrat for Nevada's 3rd. Congressional District. My story is quite different than most, nearly 20 years ago I plead guilty to a securities and tax violation and spent the next 15 months in a federal prison camp. That was then, this is now. 

I've never held a public office and when elected, I will never hold another office. I'm not interested in furthering my career, I want to use my knowledge and experience to make our Country an even better one, by offering a new and different voice in congress. 

My career began as a Doctor of Chiropractic than quickly moved into the world of business. I spent the next 40 plus years starting and managing many different businesses from a pizza parlor to a national airline. 

When most people my age were planning their retirement, I returned to college and earned a Bachelor’s degree in Political Science along with a Master's in Public Administration from the University of Nevada, Las Vegas (See above). In addition, I've taken numerous classes in the U.S. Constitution, Civil/Criminal Law, International Relations, including Latin American and Middle East politics.

Unfortunately today's politics are all about the money, the more you have, the better your chances of winning. Although I've never held political office, I have run before without the benefit of campaign financing. I vowed this time would be different. 

At my age, I'm not afraid to take on the Washington political establishment. My goal is to win this election by providing solutions, rather than flaunt a wish list. I believe in telling it as it is, rather than telling you what you want to hear. I've often been called a visionary, one who can come up with the ideas and implement them. Not ideas of yesterday, but for today and the our future.

As a freshman congressman you can't get much done but what separates me from others is my ability to become the loose cannon among the other representatives. What I mean by that is, I'm knowledgeable enough to use outside sources including the media to pressure those I feel are about to make decisions which are not in the best interest of the general public, but instead self serving.

The average cost for running a campaign for the House has risen greatly over the past few years and is now over $1.8 million. Mounting a political campaign is like starting a business, you surround yourself with good people, plan your direction and  implement your strategy. All of which are my next steps.

To kick my campaign off we've designed a series of Smart Shirts related to the issues which are most important to all of us. As an incentive, we've decided to give them away as a gift for any contribution of $50 or more. As little as a dollar ($1.00) will show your support for my efforts.

It's time to set politics aside, deal with the issues and provide the solutions. Together we can build a better and stronger America. 

Like many of you, I'm fed up with the Washington political scene. It's time we set politics aside, deal with the issues and provide solutions.

"I believe in free market solutions with a heart. Where we encourage an environment that welcomes free market answers, looks to efficient government for solutions where the market doesn't provide answers."

 

 

Let's talk about creating jobs......

Our Country's economic problems is due in part to a lack of jobs which in turn is due to the lack of available capital for starting a business. It's small businesses that create the bulk of new jobs and many often become big businesses.

My plan to create jobs is simple. The government issues a new type of savings bond (possibly: USA BizBonds) used exclusively to finance small businesses and create jobs. The bonds would be available in different denominations at any FDIC bank or other financial institution. Each bond would yield a reasonable rate of return which would be preset for a period of 5 - 10 years.

Based on the plan, the business could borrow up to $50,000 (available as a line of credit) for each new job it would create. The interest rate paid by the business would be fixed at a rate somewhat higher than that paid by the bond holders. The loan approval process would not be based on one's personal credit history and would not be dischargeable in bankruptcy. It is a total commitment to succeed on behalf of the borrower.

Savings bonds in the U.S. have had a long history, starting with Series A-D bonds, offered during the depression to give people an incentive to save safely. President Roosevelt used Series E bonds as a way of funding World War II. During the war years between 1941 and 1945, more than $33 billion worth were sold to the public, in face amounts as low as $25, and as high as $10,000.

The program would be administered by FDIC banks (for a built in set fee). The bottom line is the business gets the needed funding, jobs are created, the government receives additional revenue through taxes paid by the business and its employees. "It's a win-win for the government, the business, the employees and society." ~ Barry Michaels

 

 

Let's talk about prison reform.......

There are about 20 million felons in the United States, of which more than 13 million have the right to vote. Instead of demonizing them, let's give them the opportunity to become productive members of society and thereby reduce the rate of recidivism which is currently over 67% according to the National Institute of Justice. The cost to the States is over 52 billion dollars a year, the second fastest growing budget item after Medicaid (New York Times 4/11).

The word "felon" or "have you ever been convicted" should be struck from all employment applications as it is prejudicial which often results in an automatic rejection for anyone answering "yes". If at all it should be replaced with: "are you currently on probation or parole." I believe this practice has a lot to do with the exorbitant rate of recidivism and needs to be changed.

Our country has more people in prison than any other in the world. Currently at about 2 million which are mostly held in state and local facilities, while another 200,000 are held in federal custody.

We need sentencing reform, especially for non-violent offenders. About 50% of all prisoners held in federal custody are there on drug related offenses. The average cost of incarceration for federal inmates is over $80 a day. Many mandatory sentences call for 20 years or more, which cause a huge financial burden on the taxpayers. We need to look at reducing long term sentences and use the savings for better education or just reducing the deficit, etc.

 

 

Let's talk about forgiving student loans....

My student loan forgiveness plan makes good economical sense for both the student and the government. It assures an economically better and more educated society, which in turn makes us a stronger nation.

According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics the average high school graduate earned $34,736 per year in 2014 while the average person with a Master's degree earned $68,952. If you multiply these numbers by a 35 years you'll find the high school graduate earned $1,215,760 and those with a Master's earned $2,413,320.

If you use the 15% tax bracket for the high school graduate and 25% bracket for those with a Master's degree, we find those with a Master's paid the government $420,999 more than those with a high school diploma.

The average cost of obtaining a Master's degree today runs about $80,000. After the government deducts the loan amount, they will receive an additional $340,999 more in taxes over a 35 year period than from the high school graduate.

There's no free lunch with my program! To qualify for the program you must complete the original degree and be employed in a related field for five years or more for forgiveness to kick in. While certain degrees and professions would carry additional incentives.

Statistics show the greater one's education, the greater their earnings and the more income tax they pay over a  lifetime. The end result is the student receives a free education, the government receives a return on its investment and society benefits.

 

 

Let's talk about immigration.......

It's estimated that there are over eleven million (so called) illegal residents in this country so rounding them up and sending them back to their home country is unrealistic.

The 4th., 5th., 6th. and 14th Amendments of the U.S. Constitution call for Due Process and Equal Protection. Which means every person in this country, citizen or not, are entitled to certain civil rights including their day in court. An impossible task given there are only 58 Immigration courts in the country. Add to this our inability to find and apprehend them and house them while they wait for a court appearance. From a logistics stand point, the economic cost (multi-billions) would be staggering, if it could be done at all.

Our borders need to be strengthened, not with fences (14th Century technology) but with an increase in border patrol and technology, more importantly we need to enforce our current laws regarding their employment.

What kind of people are we who would advocate rounding up 11,000,000 or more, men women and children and dropping off at the border (which border). Has anyone ever thought this through? Besides the billions of dollars it would cost to do this, what will happen if Mexico refused to take them? Many are not from Mexico but Instead are from South or Central America, what then? To begin with, how would we locate them? What if they refuse to go voluntarily? Do we hire thousands of new ICE agents, do we appoint hundreds of new judges, public defenders, etc? Do we build more Immigration courts and jails to accommodate them while they wait to be heard?

The only practical answer is to have them register, pay a fine, and begin a path towards citizenship. It is far better to have them become a productive members of society, pay taxes and know who they are rather than to ignore them. Let's face it, they are not going back, so let's fix the problem NOW!

 

 

Let's talk about legalizing drugs..........

The only way to eliminate illegal drugs is to take the money out, legalize, tax and regulate them. Stricter penalties drive the price up and add to the number who want to sell them. Let's begin slowly with marijuana. Many states have legalized it in one form or another, however it remains illegal under federal law. It's time to change that NOW!

 

 

Let's talk about eliminating nuclear weapons........

Having grown up during the Cold War there were many days that I thought a nuclear war was eminent either by accident or on purpose.

Since we are a civilized society and have no intentions of ever using a nuclear weapon, it's time we began negotiating the elimination of all these weapons. I believe, no one, including the United States should have the capability of eliminating the entire human race with the push of a button.

It appears from the above graph we are continuing to reduce the number of warheads. It's time to pursue the elimination of all nuclear warheads from all nations. As the country with the greatest number of warheads, lets take the lead?

 

 



By now, I hope you've decided to support my bid to be your next Congressman. For more information please go to my website.

 

 

Coming Soon...

 

 

If you liked what you've read, please share this site with your friends and relatives.

Paid for by the Committee - Michaels For Congress - 2016

story:
FACES is a committed Community of Volunteers unlocking the potential of the people of Oregon educating through training and support, low-income families, migrant families, and different minority groups, by connecting the community resources with the community needs.

FACES supports School Districts and organizations in establishing adult literacy programs called “Plazas Comunitarias”. FACES trains parents in early childhood literacy and supports and provides resources for students and community members pursuing a college education.  

FACES is committed to distribute books and literacy resources, provided by the Mexican Department of Education, among our Spanish speaking families.

FACES is now expanding to offer Bilingual English-Spanish Day Care and Preschool Program, with an advanced Literacy Program, at our new location in 1687 Summer St. NE Salem  OR  97301

During the first few years of life, children’s brains develop at a rapid pace, influenced by the experiences they have at home, in their early care and education settings, and in their communities. Their experiences include the quantity and quality of words they are exposed to through talking, reading, and singing. Research has found that providing infants, toddlers, and preschoolers with rich early language experiences can have important benefits on their brain development and school readiness.

“We know that right now during the first three years of life, a child born into a low-income family hears 30 million fewer words than a child born into a well-off family. By giving more of our kids access to high-quality pre-school and other early learning programs, and by helping parents get the tools they need to help their kids succeed, we can give those kids a better shot at the career they are capable of, and a life that will make us all better off.”

-President Obama

“The economic benefits of investing in high-quality early childhood education are clear and backed by an impressive amount of research, as laid out in Tim Bartik’s book. With businesses concerned about securing a future skilled workforce, with our military leaders concerned about the future supply of qualified recruits, and with our society concerned about the troubling increase in income inequality, we should be looking at proven investments in children and youth that strengthen our human capital and the future of our economy.”—Arthur J. Rolnick

This is very important for FACES, because there are more than 27,000 children 0-5 in Marion county. Only 15 out of 100 are being served with Early Childhood Education. 28.3% of these children live in poverty, compared to the 23% in all Oregon. There are 12,200 families receiving childcare subsidies and 16,893 participants in all Head Start Programs, but what about the rest?

We are expanding to offer Bilingual Day Care and Preschool with a very advanced Literacy Program and with your donation, you are helping FACES  prepare a scholarship fund to offer scholarships to very low income families.  These families either do not qualified for head start programs, or cannot pay for day care, due to their very low salaries. These are the families with very limited education and whose children are entering schools with no academic and social skills and with very limited vocabulary due to the lack of interaction with their parents.

FACES will continue training parents to meet their children's academic needs and offering K-12 students with extracurricular programs and math and literacy after school tutoring.

We cannot accomplish this task without your help, your contribution is very important! You can donate as little as $5, $10, $20 or more.


    What We Need & What You Get

    Help FACES provide scholarships for low-income students, each preschooler needs approximately $ 6000 a year for a full time, 5 days a week high quality bilingual preschool, breakfast and lunch, nurse services, motor skills specialist, a nutritionist  on site and much more.

    It is difficult to describe the emotions we teachers, teaching little ones, experience when we look at a learning face, a discovering face, those ahaa! moments when a concept is learned and the child feels at the top of the world. We teach our students to feel successful at an early age, students who believe in themselves and feel successful, will not learn differently and are set to a great start.

    The methods used, treat the child as a whole, covering all the child's needs, involving the whole family in his/her education. We have used this method in preschoolers and kindergartners during the past 9 years, the results are amazing, we have produced advanced readers, writers and math experts. We have track a big group of students whose parents are connected to FACES still, and they report very high achieving students that are now about to finish middle school. We have records in pictures and videos and you are invited to watch them upon request. Amazing videos of 4 and 5 year olds reading and writing as first and second grade students.

                                        WE NEED YOU IN ORDER TO ACCOMPLISH THIS!!!

    We are trying to fund, at least 17 full time students a year and we know that with your help, we will accomplish this task. If we were not to reach the entire goal, we will fund the number of students covered by the obtained amount.



    The Impact

    We know, according to the census, that we cannot cover all the 85 students out of 100 that are not receiving any Early Childhood Education services, but we can help serving at least 180 families and with your help offer at least  17 families the funds to pay for their tuition.
    Preparing our children at an early age will make sure that our generations to come, will be educated individuals who will contribute for a better America. We need more programs like this, dedicated to prepare our children for life. The Early Education is crucial for a successful life, we need an educated and successful AMERICA!

    Risks & Challenges

    Reaching our goal is not easy, we need education, experience, skills, patience, consistency and HEART to accomplish this and we are proud to say that we have it. Most of our staff are individuals who were first volunteers at FACES, while working full time at their own jobs. With years of experience, degrees and all the necessary education to perform their duties, but using their free time to volunteer at FACES.

    During the past nine years, FACES has offered its services free of charge to our community. All of its members worked hard writing grants, organizing fundraising events and paying from their own pockets, for materials, for rent and to pay their own gas for transportation to events and errands. Our Director has more than 36 years in education, between Mexico and USA, from preschool to college and holds the equivalent to a BA in Mexico and a BA in the USA and two Master Degrees in Education and School Leadership and Administration. The rest of the staff hold degrees in their own specialties.

    They volunteered their time for tutoring in after school programs, teaching adults and training parents to advocate for their children in school with an educational focus. We offered parallel education for the parents to stay abreast or shoulder to  shoulder with their children. Resulting in reducing illiteracy level for families,
    increased the parents’ reading skills so they can help their children, and
    increased the level of reading capacity toward closing the gap.

    Another of the challenges are the funds to keep our high quality programs; funds that will be coming from monthly tuition, partnerships, sponsors, grants and fundraisers. We need to work hard to keep the revenues that will cover the monthly expenses of the program, coming in.

                                 WE NEED YOU IN ORDER TO ACCOMPLISH THIS!!!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You always can help, it could be by contributing the minimal amount, or by volunteering your skills!!   There's always a lot to do at FACES, in fact that has been the only way, for the past nine years: VOLUNTEERING!!! If you live in Salem, or close by, you can always come to visit and volunteer. If you live far away, even out of the country, you can encourage your friends and family to donate. You can always contact us and check on how we are doing.

    Maybe you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • You may get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
    • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
FACES is a committed Community of Volunteers unlocking the potential of the people of Oregon educating through training and support, low-income families, migrant families, and different minority groups, by connecting the community resources with the community needs. FACES supports School Districts and organizations in establishing adult literacy programs called “Plazas Comunitarias”. FACES trains parents in early childhood literacy and supports and provides resources for students and community members pursuing a college education.  FACES is committed to distribute books and literacy resources, provided by the Mexican Department of Education, among our Spanish speaking families. 
FACES is now expanding to offer Bilingual English-Spanish Day Care and Preschool Program, with an advanced Literacy Program, at our new location in 1687 Summer St. NE Salem  OR  97301

During the first few years
of life, children’s brains develop at a rapid pace, influenced by the
experiences they have at home, in their early care and education settings, and
in their communities. Their experiences include the quantity and quality of
words they are exposed to through talking, reading, and singing. Research has
found that providing infants, toddlers, and preschoolers with rich early
language experiences can have important benefits on their brain development and
school readiness. 
“We know that right now during the first three years of
life, a child born into a low-income family hears 30 million fewer words than a
child born into a well-off family. By giving more of our kids access to
high-quality pre-school and other early learning programs, and by helping
parents get the tools they need to help their kids succeed, we can give those
kids a better shot at the career they are capable of, and a life that will make
us all better off.”

-President Obama
“The economic benefits of investing in high-quality
early childhood education are clear and backed by an impressive amount of
research, as laid out in Tim Bartik’s book. With businesses concerned about
securing a future skilled workforce, with our military leaders concerned about
the future supply of qualified recruits, and with our society concerned about
the troubling increase in income inequality, we should be looking at proven
investments in children and youth that strengthen our human capital and the
future of our economy.”—Arthur J. Rolnick This is very important for FACES, because there are more than 27,000 children 0-5 in Marion county. Only 15 out of 100 are being served with Early Childhood Education. 28.3% of these children live in poverty, compared to the 23% in all Oregon. There are 12,200 families receiving childcare subsidies and 16,893 participants in all Head Start Programs, but what about the rest?
We are expanding to offer Bilingual Day Care and Preschool with a very advanced Literacy Program and with your donation, you are helping FACES  prepare a scholarship fund to offer scholarships to very low income families.  These families either do not qualified for head start programs, or cannot pay for day care, due to their very low salaries. These are the families with very limited education and whose children are entering schools with no academic and social skills and with very limited vocabulary due to the lack of interaction with their parents. 
FACES will continue training parents to meet their children's academic needs and offering K-12 students with extracurricular programs and math and literacy after school tutoring.
We cannot accomplish this task without your help, your contribution is very important! You can donate as little as $5, $10, $20 or more.
   What We Need & What You Get Help FACES provide scholarships for low-income students, each preschooler needs approximately $ 6000 a year for a full time, 5 days a week high quality bilingual preschool, breakfast and lunch, nurse services, motor skills specialist, a 
nutritionist  
on site and much more.
It is difficult to describe the emotions we teachers, teaching little ones, experience when we look at a learning face, a discovering face, those ahaa! moments when a concept is learned and the child feels at the top of the world. We teach our students to feel successful at an early age, students who believe in themselves and feel successful, will not learn differently and are set to a great start. 
The methods used, treat the child as a whole, covering all the child's needs, involving the whole family in his/her education. We have used this method in preschoolers and kindergartners during the past 9 years, the results are amazing, we have produced 
 advanced readers, writers and math experts. We have track a big group of students whose parents are connected to FACES still, and they report very high achieving students that are now about to finish middle school. We have records in pictures and videos and you are invited to watch them upon request. Amazing videos of 4 and 5 year olds reading and writing as first and second grade students.

story:
Where can a small contribution do the most good? 

Where can a small amount of money create the most opportunity?

For the price of a family meal or reasonable a bottle of wine or a dinner out on the town, you can chip in to truly change the life of a child. Can you click and give $20-$30? A lot of people giving a little bit... It would mean the world to some wonderful kids!

We've started this - and it works!

Indonesia is the 4th largest country in our world. It is a democracy and a place where social mobility though education can happen. Jakarta, on the Island of Java, is one of the five largest urban centers on Earth. This city of more than 20 million is a place where Christian and Muslims coexist in peace within communities. It is also a place where pollution and poverty stand in the way of the dreams of too many children.

We invite you to join us. We are a small group of American, New Zealand and Indonesian friends who are on a mission to do something positive. The overall goal of our project is to give underprivileged children in urban Jakarta a chance at a true college preparatory experience.  In the Spring of 2015, we began to open our first school and our first two urban education centers. We hope to generate a student population that is academically empowered to pursue higher education in the United States, Europe or Australia. They will return home with the ability to create enormous projects of positive change in their communities as engineers, scientists, doctors, journalists, teachers and more!

For this particular fundraising project, we are attempting to raise $78,000 to fund our sisters schools just outside of Jakarta. This will give these students the chance to take advantage of all the web has to offer, along with FREE on-line classes and access to great teachers! These simple classrooms can change the direction of their lives! It is so inexpensive to give them the world!

How your funds will help:

  • Supply  English-speaking teachers (3 month visits, 4 per year)
  • Provide access for 60 children to a full year to the accredited USA curriculum 
  • Deliver the Google-supported ICT, stable internet access & PCs 

What have we achieved so far?

After working in Jakarta for the last two years we feel we have made a great start:

  1. Flood relief and community coordination for those most in need and most deserving
  2. Nutritional programme to halt the incidence of stunting in the trash dump community children under 4 years of age
  3. Back-to-School packs for 300 orphans with stationery, school bags and lunch boxes
  4. Launched the successful Urban Green School trial programme in West Jakarta with 5 students - we know it works!
  5. Operated a Big Brother Big Sister programme, linking 112 orphans with role models through camps, art, trips and educational experiences
  6. BBC reports that the number of displaced people is at an all-time high. The Roshan Learning Center is a community-driven and managed program serving refugees living in Jakarta, Indonesia. We offer learning experiences for children in English and Persian and cultivate a sense of community in which all members respect, value, and encourage each other. With the help of you, all students will now additionally gain access to an accredited USA education system

Every penny counts. Thank you for doing the right thing each day, regardless of what you consider that to be.

If you have any questions about this project, if you are interested in joining our team, or contributing your talents in any way, PLEASE contact us! info@greenschooljakarta.com

"Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has." - Margaret Meade

Terima kasih! 

Please tell your friends!

story:
Feeling tired about politics/finance ? Do it yourself !

TL;DR : For the price of half a pint, change the world to a croudfunded e-society.

Nearly no one I know is happy with the decisions made at higher levels but doesn't know what to do. All the political game uses that to switch from side to side but is then bounded by creepy financial institutions.  As said a previous indegogo campaign about Greece bailout fund which could not work but was a great idea : Why don't we the people just sort it instead ?

  • We propose to give ALL the money without ANY compensations to NGO acting locally with good fame (using http://www.givewell.org/).
  • We propose to launch this campaign every month following the main crisis
  • Just be the change you want to see

What We Need & What You Get

For 5 euros you will get :

  • Pictures and articles from local independent reporters (already have some ideas but contact me guys through fb )
  • If this campaign works we'll start creating pledges for stuff made by local craftsman (idem) to support job there.
All the pledges will include  :
  • 2/3 : Social/Health
  • 1/6 : Information
  • 1/6 : Financial (example : "CCFD terre Solidaire" fighting fiscal paradises)

Dinner !!!!


For 40 euros you come at my place near Montmartre in Paris and have dinner of french cuisine with good company (we usually are 14 people)

The Impact

In a world where everyone is connected, why can't we use our modern tools to create a society that old thinkers could not even dream of ? For the price of half a pint you help changing this state of austerity due to bad money fluxs. Let's bypass those unfair institutions and help the people like us.

  • You will change many people's life.
  • Reporters, craftsmen and artists will have job thanks to you
  • You will be informed in a direct way by all those people

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please be free to help me in whatever direction you think of (articles ? ad ?)
  • At least share it with friends, family, coworkers etc

And that's all there is to it. Come on guys.

story:
What's this campaign about exactly?

It's about supporting a craftsman in his burgeoning career as a maker and designer. Send me to shoemaking school! You can help by purchasing some of my handmade leather crafts. Act now! Buy some finely crafted products and send me on my way. 

Read onward my friends.


Why should you support this campaign?

This campaign is not just about trading money for great handmade products, it's about supporting the work of an aspiring entrepreneur in his life journey. Your contribution will help in prolonging an American Institution that is in much need of revitalization - traditional trade and craftsmanship. The USA is in a great shortage of fine craftsmen. Traditional shoemaking has become an honest rarity. We need more craftsmen and makers to practice and share this knowledge so the world can appreciate the difference between fine quality and bargain throw away stuff. Help me learn shoemaking. First a pair of shoes, then the world. This I promise you.

Perks:


Key fob - $30

features:

-made from hand dyed vegetable leather

-hand tooled

-hand stitched

-powder coated brass hardware



Pocket Protector - $45

features:

-made from undyed vegetable tanned leather

-machine stitched

-hand stitched details



Card Case - $65 

features:

-made from hand dyed vegetable leather

-hand stitched

-four credit card sized pockets

-snap closure to secure interior belongings



Saw Tooth Wallet - $80

features:

-made from hand dyed vegetable leather

-hand stitched

-hand tooled

-two large pockets for multiple credit cards

-one large pocket for cash



Dinner at my apartment in Seattle, WA - $100

features:

-good company

-delicious food

-vinyl LPs

-merriment



Leather working lesson at my shop in Seattle, WA - $150

features:

-full 8 hour day of leather craft fun. 

-lunch included!

-learn a wonderful craft

-make great stuff

-impress your friends

-give unique gifts



MackerelCrow Backpack - $200

features:

-Made in Seattle, WA

-powder coated brass and cast zinc hardware

-leather details

-built to last!

-designed to age gracefully

-sewn from highly durable 14oz Army Duck with Tex 90 thread (Super Strong!)


Who is Michael Barakat?

Frankly, I hate talking about my work and myself almost more than anything. Writing resumes, job interviews, making a presentation of myself is at the very least annoying and at the most turns out to be contrived inauthentic mess. But, I’m going to do it anyway just for you. So, I’m going to try and make this short and sweet:


What’s Michael’s background?

At my day job I’ve been a creative producer for about 10 years. My experience spans from web design, digital products, industrial design, film, animation, project managment, multi-disciplinary design, and product management.  What am I really?

  • A Craftsman

  • A lifetime maker

  • A tinkerer

  • A musician

  • An artist

  • Above all else - an Insatiable learner of new techniques and knowledge.


How did I get to where I am now?

At a very young age I was attracted to two things: 1) Figuring out how the world around me worked, and 2) after figuring out how it worked, then how can it be built? Then of course try to build it and refine. #myzen


Fast forward 30 sum years. After working at a deskjob for most of my career and losing my craft zen, I started playing around with leather in 2012. Not surprisingly, I found that I really enjoyed it. I started making some small leather goods and gradually got into making some bigger stuff, like bags, backpacks and ladies clutches. Check out many of the things I've made at my tumblr page - MackerelCrow Blog. Everything so far has been self taught or learned from a few really great books. In 2014-ish, I decided to start a side project, MackerelCrow, designing and making urban backpacks and accessories. I make the products myself or through a factory domestically in, Seattle, Washington and people love them. 


Why am I doing this campaign?

For me the next frontier in leather work is shoemaking. It’s a fascinating process that has evolved over thousands of years.  With so many steps and nuances, it’s something that's virtually impossible to perfect on your own without decades of experience. Shoes are fascinating to me. They're somewhat enigmatic too - a cheap pair can cost as little as $20 and last a couple months. While a fine pair of shoes can cost upwards of $500, but last the user a decade or more with proper maintenance and mending. It’s a beautiful thing when an object can be crafted to such a degree of quality that the user would want to treasure it, and to be willing to spend so much and keep the product so long. How many things are like that today?


My desire has always been to create products that bring great satisfaction to the user. I want to make things that people cherish and pass down to their children. Going to shoe school will help me up my game.


Lastly, as a contributor to my campaign, you will help an American craftsman move to the next level in his maker’s journey. Contribute to my campaign and purchase some of the things that I make, the proceeds will allow me to study shoe making from professional shoemakers in Washington State on the Olympic Peninsula.


Where is all that money going?

  • Tuition: $2300

  • Lab Fee: $180

  • Lodging: $500 (5 nights)

  • Fuel for my 1986 Toyota pickup :) $20

  • If I don’t make my goal you will still get your perks, the thing about this campaign is that I’m not doing anything I don’t normally do already - i.e. make things for people. All the products are things I make on a regular basis already. So, if the campaign doesn't reach the goal your money will still go to my shoemaking school fund, I will just have to find the rest of the money elsewhere. I'm already enrolled, it will be hard to back out now.


Risks & Challenges

  • The biggest risk is for me is to produce as much as this campaign demands in a short amount of time. If for some reason it gets over funded there is a possibility that there could be delays in fulfillment of merchandise. This is bad news for everyone. I’m the kind of guy that arrives 15 minutes early for everything, I never ever like being late for anything, not even the DMV. So I will do my best to address this problem if I feel it's creeping up. Fortunately, there are solutions! Read the next bullet point.

  • Probably the best way to address production delays is to bring in some of my talented craft partners who’ve helped me make my products in the past. I have a friend or two that work in the soft goods industry that would be happy to help me out with production in the event that I sell more than I can easily produce by myself. As my grandfather always said, “Two friends makes the work go three times as fast.” ~Joseph Barakat


What can you do if you can’t contribute yourself?

  • Spread the word to your craft loving friends! Let’s make this thing real people!

  • We need more support of small USA craftsmen like myself!

Above all else - an Insatiable learner of new techniques and knowledge. 
How did I get to where I am now?At a very young age I was attracted to two things: 1) Figuring out how the world around me worked, and 2) after figuring out how it worked, then how can it be built? Then of course try to build it and refine. #myzenFast forward 30 sum years. After working at a deskjob for most of my career and losing my craft zen, I started playing around with leather in 2012. Not surprisingly, I found that I really enjoyed it. I started making some small leather goods and gradually got into making some bigger stuff, like bags, backpacks and ladies clutches. Check out many of the things I've made at my tumblr page - MackerelCrow Blog. Everything so far has been self taught or learned from a few really great books. In 2014-ish, I decided to start a side project, MackerelCrow, designing and making urban backpacks and accessories. I make the products myself or through a factory domestically in, Seattle, Washington and people love them. Why am I doing this campaign?For me the next frontier in leather work is shoemaking. It’s a fascinating process that has evolved over thousands of years.  With so many steps and nuances, it’s something that's virtually impossible to perfect on your own without decades of experience. Shoes are fascinating to me. They're somewhat enigmatic too - a cheap pair can cost as little as $20 and last a couple months. While a fine pair of shoes can cost upwards of $500, but last the user a decade or more with proper maintenance and mending. It’s a beautiful thing when an object can be crafted to such a degree of quality that the user would want to treasure it, and to be willing to spend so much and keep the product so long. How many things are like that today? My desire has always been to create products that bring great satisfaction to the user. I want to make things that people cherish and pass down to their children. Going to shoe school will help me up my game. Lastly, as a contributor to my campaign, you will help an American craftsman move to the next level in his maker’s journey. Contribute to my campaign and purchase some of the things that I make, the proceeds will allow me to study shoe making from professional shoemakers in Washington State on the Olympic Peninsula.Where is all that money going?
Tuition: $2300
Lab Fee: $180 
Lodging: $500 (5 nights)
Fuel for my 1986 Toyota pickup :) $20 
If I don’t make my goal you will still get your perks, the thing about this campaign is that I’m not doing anything I don’t normally do already - i.e. make things for people. All the products are things I make on a regular basis already. So, if the campaign doesn't reach the goal your money will still go to my shoemaking school fund, I will just have to find the rest of the money elsewhere. I'm already enrolled, it will be hard to back out now.
Risks & Challenges
The biggest risk is for me is to produce as much as this campaign demands in a short amount of time. If for some reason it gets over funded there is a possibility that there could be delays in fulfillment of merchandise. This is bad news for everyone. I’m the kind of guy that arrives 15 minutes early for everything, I never ever like being late for anything, not even the DMV. So I will do my best to address this problem if I feel it's creeping up. Fortunately, there are solutions! Read the next bullet point.
Probably the best way to address production delays is to bring in some of my talented craft partners who’ve helped me make my products in the past. I have a friend or two that work in the soft goods industry that would be happy to help me out with production in the event that I sell more than I can easily produce by myself. As my grandfather always said, “Two friends makes the work go three times as fast.” ~Joseph Barakat
What can you do if you can’t contribute yourself?
Spread the word to your craft loving friends! Let’s make this thing real people!
We need more support of small USA craftsmen like myself!

story:
Imagine using an app to find a local tutor in any subject you or your child needs help with in a matter of minutes. Once you find that person, you schedule an exclusive study session and then hear back from the educator shortly thereafter to make arrangements for payment. 

Sounds simple right? 

Well that is goal for Tutor's bin, if we can get your help. 

Developed by CONSSOL LLC earlier this year, this project was meant to provide a place for students of all education levels to enhance their schooling by finding tutors from all across the country.

After a six month development period the project lost the majority of its funding. Despite this setback, we  still believe in this project's potential to help students reach their educational goals. We at CONSSOL LLC are also firm believers  in seeing a project through to the end. 

What drove us to create Tutor's bin?


Tutor's bin was an idea that emerged after we attempted to use our own school's tutoring finding system. We were frustrated with their current system, due to it being confusing, inaccurate and complicated to use. This system required the student to communicate with the tutor through a series of emails and pick out the place to meet which would take at least a week to do. 

With Tutor's bin, however,  the user sets up an appointment with a tutor they wish to see, and will immediately know when he/she is available. Once a date, location and time is selected, the student will know that their appointment is pending and no one else can claim that time frame. Once the appointment is confirmed, the student can choose to pay the tutor online via a secure payment system or indicate to wait to pay in-person.  

Pages and current features

Profile Page:

Allows for users to add classes, change their availability, change their avatar/profile picture

 Calendar Page:

On this page users can view their up coming appointments and directly pay tutors before each appointment

Search Page:

On this page users can find tutors that fits their needs



Make an appointment:

This pops up when you are making an appointment

  

WePay System:

This is our third party payment system that is secured and run by WePay

-Tutor request, approval and change email alerts.

With the funding by this campaign we would like to add the following functions to Tutor'sbin:
  • Direct Chat System 
  • Improve Calendar Appointment System
  • Tutor Rating System
  • Cellular Alert System
  • Mobile Version of Website

How will Tutor's bin benefit from these funds?

Server Costs: Your donation will help us keep up with server costs so that pages always load quickly and more users can sign up ($250 per month for up to approximately 25,000 users)

Development  and Design Team: Our development team consists of  4 very talented programmers and 2 exceptional graphic designers.  The contributions received from the campaign will finance the more than 1,000 hours  of work our team expects will be needed to put into the project.

Administrative Staff: These funds will also be used to hire administrative staff that will be in charge of interviewing all future tutors, answering questions that users have, and handling customer complaints.



Goals and Rewards:


Off to a good start($1000)

-Begin the design phase of the mobile version. 
-Add the tutor rating system.

We can see the light($5000)

-Server  maintenance and upkeep for one year
-Mobile version of website designs post
-Calendar system on it's way to perfection

Let there be Tutors($10000)

-Mobile version of website development begins
-Text  alert system development begins
-Direct chat system development begins


25000: We have done it!

-Wow  we have really done it! Thank you to everyone!


25000+: The Future home of Tutors

-Extra funds allocated to not having ads forever.

Other Ways You Can Help

-Share this link with friends, teachers, tutors, schools.

story:
Hi, I'm Stormey Barton, founder of Students Opposing Substances and an upcoming senior attending Hyde Park High School in Austin, Texas. I'm reaching out to you today to save lives and therefore change the world through SOS.       We are a  student founded & student lead, nonprofit 501(c)3 drug prevention organization. Our goal is to make sobriety "the norm"  by strategically influencing each school's unique culture through the students themselves. With the SOS program, you have the opportunity to give students the tools it takes to "make their own decisions" while staying socially accepted. 

PLEASE, Click here to see a news clip explaining what SOS is.
http://www.kvue.com/videos/features/five-who-ca...

How does SOS work?

  1.  Students join SOS by signing a contact with their parents.
  2. To keep them accountable, parents receive a drug test to keep at home.
  3. Students then receive rewards from their school for joining SOS.

The Impact 

I have seen the impact in my own school and heard great feedback from other schools but our survey results from the Westlake feeder schools are what prove that SOS is changing schools from the inside out. Please,  Click here to view.

Where does the money go?

Right now we are 100% volunteer run and lead, meaning all of the money you donate goes back to the cause. We have big plans for this year. We have been asked to launch SOS in 32 counties with our partners TeenSafe, Round Rock ISD, several Austin area churches & 2 schools in California. However, to meet the program’s expenses of $5 per student, we need to grow financially as well. 

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Please forward this campaign to friends!

2. Help us grow to new schools by connecting us with students, parents or faculty!

story:
Short Summary

RESTORE was founded by Mike and Shirley Pounds, a couple that has spent the last 45 years working with the addicted poor in the inner-city. At an age where most people would think of retiring, the Pounds started their own nonprofit, RESTORE.

RESTORE operates Recovery and Aftercare Recovery Homes for the addicted poor, people without the means to pay for pricey rehab centers, but who are trapped in addiction and want to change their lives and live clean and sober.

Currently, we have a Men's Recovery Home, and two Men's Aftercare Recovery Homes and we are getting ready to open a Women's Aftercare Recovery Home this summer. 


The Need 

We have the funding to open the Women's Aftercare Recovery Home and three quarters of the funding needed to complete the second Men's Aftercare Recovery Home, all that is left to raise is $3,450! Less than $4,000 to RESTORE Hope, Dignity and Life to a man learning to live out his sobriety in a safe and supportive environment. Please help and give a gift today.


The Impact

Addiction does not discriminate.  

At RESTORE we operate small family-style homes so residents don't get lost in the crowd. Many people, after they go through a recovery program, need some extra time and support to learn how to live out their sobriety. Our Aftercare Recovery Homes provide that time, support and accountability that is so crucial to lifelong freedom from addiction. This home will serve up to 6 men at a time.

We have seen great success with this Aftercare Recovery Home model, like men continuing to live clean and sober, getting jobs, moving on into their own homes, reconciling with their family and friends. 


Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE. PLEASE SHARE this campaign with your family, friends, and colleagues! We know you understand how difficult it can be to get the word out about something like this project RESTORE Hope and we need all the help we can get. 

  • You can share on your social media platforms.
  • Email the contacts that you think would like supporting this worthy cause.
  • Talk about it to random people or not so random people.  :)

For more information visit us online at www.restore1.org.
