Eventually, advanced "moonlight" apps will be developed which are intended for use either at night or in altered states. These apps will help students to train their minds in ways that have never been attempted before with a software interface. These apps will also be designed to help enter, exit, and navigate altered states, i.e., "digital drugs".
Global Hostel Travel Network—Eventually, I would like to try establishing a global network of teachers, students, and hostels in order to make global learning an affordable experience. Using flocking algorithms, we can route teachers and interested students to shared locales so that ad-hoc meetups can form between interested peers and teachers. Just a seed of an idea now, this network has the potential to compete with big universities by offering a global learning and travel experience for a fraction of the price.
Critical Psychiatry and Patients' Rights—The psychiatric patients locked up or drugged into normalcy are our generation's shamans, prophets, and poets—and rather than being welcomed into a world of artists/priests/poets/prophets, our weird friends are being locked up in a sort of Azkaban. By advocating for patients' rights and by publicly using a language of magic, I hope to build alternative powers that can help people during spiritual crisis without drugs or coercion and with a mythic ear.


Risks & Challenges

Starting something like "The Internet School of Magic" is an absurdly risky career move. It's easy to criticize me as a charlatan or an insane and deluded new-age crystal-waver. However, I think my education speaks for itself: I studied Psychology at University of Washington, and and I studied Educational Psychology & Educational Technology at the PhD level in Michigan (left early with a master's). I have studied critical theory and critical approaches to activism and pedagogy extensively.
The primary actual challenge for me in lauching this school is getting enough donating students to support myself with the School as my primary income. This will allow me to dedicate all of my time to the School—expanding the curriculum, networking with activists and other teachers, and starting the social and political projects I have in the pipeline—rather than having to spend my days worrying about how I will pay the bills. Right now I have 4 paying students, and if I were able to triple that number, I think I would be just fine and and would consider the school "launched".
Therefore, I encourage you to consider your donation a buying-in to the school as a new student (or a client requesting other services such as healing or technical exorcism). Ongoing students who are able to offer the suggested $20/class at four classes per month will be the lifeblood of the School in its early stages.
If I fail in this push to launch the school with this indiegogo campaign, I will have to take a day job in order to make ends meet. This will greatly slow down the launching of the school as a standalone business, since I will have less time to devote to advertising and may have limited time for existing clients, as well. Please help me to meet the fundraising goal so I can move ahead on my dream job at full speed!

Other Ways You Can Help
The best way you can help is to become a student at the $20/class level—and if you can make an $80 or more contribution to this campaign, that will start your first month of classes! However, there are other ways to help as well:


Share this campaign with your friends.
Ask your friends who might be interested in my classes or other services to check out my website. Follow up and let them know I need new students now :-). Maybe you have friends who are pagan, interested in the occult, or into conspiracy theories or "the illuminati"—all these topics fall within my research, as well as the neuroscience of self-awareness, for example.
Buy your friend a class as a gift—$20 is the suggested price per class for the first month of classes, and I would be happy to send them an additional free class, which I offer to all new students.
My website, internetschoolofmagic.com does not yet work well on small screens. I can fix this problem myself eventually, but if some kind web designer wants to donate their services to helping me fix this problem—or even helping me to spruce up the site with a nicer design in general—I would be very grateful, as it would save me 40+ hours learning how to make my website follow standards of "responsive web design".
Put up a sign or poster in your business or workplace with my website.
Even if you can't offer any money, please feel free to come to me with your questions or spiritual issues. Maybe I can help you get to a place where you are able to afford a donation :-). I love helping people so it's very exciting to have people to help.

Thank you very much for reading and if you haven't yet, please check out internetschoolofmagic.com and consider making a donation or becoming a student! Donations made through this campaign are best, because if the goal is met, the fees will be cut in half!

story:
Hi everyone! My name is Ivo Reis, i’m Portuguese and I’ve 26 years old! I’m currently enrolled in a Master Degree in History, International Relations and Cooperation at the Faculty of Arts of the University of Porto (after finishing a Degree in Biology), besides I’ve a part-time job in a Human Resources company, to help cover the costs of Education and other needs. I'm also doing a Summer Internship at the Youth Foundation and I'm associated with other roles and initiatives, all unpaid, such as, for example, the Senate of the University of Porto and the newly created Ibero-american Young Leaders Network (cf. my Linkedin page: https://pt.linkedin.com/in/reisivo). I was also recently selected to be the EU Careers Ambassador for Portugal, in the next school year.

On July 14th, I got an email confirmation of my selection as portuguese ‘representative’ for a leadership academy, Preparing Global Leaders Academy, taking place in Jordan, between the 24th and the 30th of August. The major goal of this Academy is to prepare young people with an excellent academic record, not only with regard to the average, but in all its magnitude, for a new global leadership paradigm.

The Organizing Foundation has granted me a scholarship of 400 dollars, and has encouraged me to carry out an action of fundraising to cover the remaining 600 dollars of the tuition fee, and the travel costs. That is why I’m launching this crowdfunding campaign to see if perhaps you’re open to the possibility of sponsor my participation on this program. As the Ministerial Bodies and the Deputies from my country which I tried to reach didn't even bothered to answer, nor even the Presidency answered the message sent, and most of the Foundations I contacted were unable to contribute, this seems to be the only way to be able to attend this learning program. 

You will find attached to this presentation text a letter addressed by the Executive Director of the Academy, Yara Nusair, to support my request.

Please contribute or at least help me out by sharing this campaign with your friends and family.
Thank you all!

story:
Let’s build a library for the children of Kenya.


For two years, I lived in a quaint but lively town in Kenya called Kabarnet. The people there quickly became my family. And, simply put, my family needs a library.

Children make up 47% of Kabarnet’s population—that’s about 12,000 kids. There are 20 schools in the town, but only one library. And it’s not a free library, either. We need to create a free, clean, safe place for the children of Kabarnet to get access to books. So we’re turning a shipping container into a new, well-stocked library space complete with shelves, tables, books, and computers, along with a community meeting space and a thriving garden.


To make this happen, we need to raise $60,000.

It’s a pretty big number. But it’s going to make an enormous difference in the lives of so many young children in Kenya.

Here’s where the money’s going:

  • DESIGNING: $3,000 - architectural design of the library and grounds
  • BUILDING: $34,000 - constructing the shipping container into a library
  • PLANTING: $2,500 - supplies to plant and grow the library’s sustainable garden
  • SHIPPING: $6,000 - shipping the library from Houston, TX to Mombasa
  • MARKETING: $3,000 - marketing and fundraising for the project
  • REWARDING: $3,000 - rewards: sending letters, inscribing polkadots, and more
  • TRAVELING: $5,000 - the team’s travel to and from Kenya
  • COORDINATING: $2,500 - local agent coordinating the project
  • LEGAL: $1,000 - legal planning, counseling, and certifications

If you donate, your kindness will not go unnoticed—or unrewarded. Check out the right rail for perks you could receive as a thank-you for your contribution.

We’re not giving up.

We are dedicated to the success of this project. Every dollar donated will go towards building, shipping, and installing this library, and we won’t stop until that happens.


Why we’re so passionate (and you should be too).

Education is a huge focus right now across the globe. You’ve probably heard of Michelle Obama’s Let Girls Learn campaign, the UN’s Global Education First, and a number of other new organizations and initiatives. This is clearly an exciting time. But, the fact of the matter is, we can’t prioritize education, until we prioritize access.

Throughout rural Africa, providing youth with quality learning materials and space is rarely a focus. In classrooms, a single book is often shared between a teacher and dozens of other children. And in libraries, older students are given first priority over what little time and resources are available.

Giving children books goes so much further than the stories and fairytales they’ll read. It’s about promoting literacy from the bottom up, instilling a love of learning from a young age, and providing real opportunities for success.

I know these kids. Their curiosity is inspiring. Their laughter is infectious. They deserve a chance to succeed.


Accounting for the risks and challenges.

Creating change like this isn’t an easy thing to do. After all, towns in Kenya are notorious for crime, bribery, and corruption. While in Kenya, however, I had a reputation for being headstrong and not tolerating bribes. That reputation stuck—and so did my connections in town.

It took a lot of planning, but I’ve done my due diligence. The library has the full support of the local government and I’ve secured the land and all of the necessary permits to make it happen—no bribes, no problems.


More ways you can help.

Money isn’t the only thing we need. There are other ways you, your friends, and your family can help bring the Polkadot Library to life.

First of all, building and stocking the Polkadot Library is going to depend on donations from people like you. We need tools and we need books. Maybe your shovel will be the first to break ground. Maybe your favorite children’s book will soon be the new favorite book of a child in Kabarnet.

What we’re asking for:

  • 10 shovels

  • 10 hoes

  • 10 rakes

  • TONS of books (new or gently used)


Please ship donations to the address below by January 31, 2016:

Polkadot Library

c/o CampCo Texas

1110 FM 1339

Kingsbury, TX 78638


Include the number of books/items on the outside of the shipping box. It will save time getting your items through Customs and transporting them to Africa.

If you’d like to include a personal note inside the box, we’ll post your letter in the library. The children would love to hear from you!

Second of all, sharing this campaign is going to make a world of difference. Email this page to your friends, post it on Facebook, or tweet it to your followers. We need your help getting the word out about this campaign so we can make a difference, together.

story:
Hey guys! :)

My name is Demetri Savas and I am currently a college sophomore studying International Business and Photography. With great excitement and humility, I have received the opportunity of a lifetime to travel abroad to Beijing, China this summer as an American Education and Chinese Cultural Ambassador. I have the privilege of interning for UNESCO and teaching English to young Chinese students through the United States Chinese Culture Center (USCCC), an A+ BBB accredited non-profit organization.

Working abroad this summer in Beijing through an international program is honestly going to be a dream come true for me, both personally and professionally: I have the incredible opportunity to immerse myself in an entirely new culture and have the privilege of assisting in Chinese children’s formative years of education. An interactive, immersive experience will also help me further develop my Mandarin skills, the language I am studying for my International Business degree.

During my time overseas, I will also be shooting a short documentary film that follows the daily lives of the children I will be working with as well as the cultural economy of the Beijing province in support of my vocational goals as a photojournalist. I am passionate about studying the small yet significant things we have universally in common with everyone, regardless of cultural background or location on the map. I plan on bringing home something beautiful and educational to share with my friends, family, fellow business students, and contributors who help make the trip possible for me!

While I am a program scholarship recipient, the financial package I received does not cover all of my expenses and I do not have the financial resources to pay for some aspects of my trip alone. Specifically, I am hoping to fundraise $2,000 to help cover some of the costs of my trip including airfare, program fees, books, food, and other small living expenses. I would greatly appreciate any contribution you could make to help me accomplish my goals and serve children in China who are eager to learn English.

Who Am I?

I'm a 19-year-old university student with a small budget but a big goal of traveling the world while making a decent living and most importantly, making a positive impact during my short time on this planet. Growing up in the Sacramento Valley of California. I was fortunate enough to recognize early on that I was living the American dream of having a supportive family financially well off enough to provide me a lot of great opportunities such as an education, athletics, clubs, and other activities.

Inspired by this ample opportunity, loving family and friends, and the natural beauty of the surrounding area, I soon discovered my passion for photography, appreciation for education, and desire to see the world and all that is has to offer. I believe that we only truly live our life when we step outside our comfort zone and embrace the unknown. We are not meant to live our lives in one place, and I think we have more in common with people around the world than we may previously assume--similarities which I would love to capture through photography and film. I also strongly believe in assisting other children’s education and passing on the opportunities that I once took for granted and have been lucky enough to receive growing up as an American.

Lastly, I believe in bridging cultural gaps: helping others who are less fortunate, making my travels purposeful, becoming wealthy through experiences, and ultimately making the world a smaller and more positive place. My goal is to be rich in the places I have seen, things I have experienced, and people I have met. What I have humbly learned this year is that if I want something bad enough, I can find a way to make it happen, and as a university student on a very tight budget, I need your help and support to make my dream a reality.

Thank you for taking the time to read this! :) If you are able to monetarily contribute to my campaign, thank you so much in advance! I am beyond grateful and don't know how to fully express how much it truly means to me over the internet. I am so thankful for all contributions, big and small. Honestly, the contribution you give me means so much more than the actual dollar amount. By donating even $1, you are telling me that you believe in me and my goals. Having a group of people (even if it’s just one person!) say, “Hey, Demetri, I believe in you and what you want to do with your life, and I’m willing to help in any way I can,” is something priceless. If you cannot make a contribution at this time, I still appreciate you taking the time out of your day to read what I will be experiencing to the fullest this summer in China! I know my journey overseas will be memorable, amazing, and an invaluable experience. I couldn’t be more excited for what the future holds and can’t thank you enough!

 

(Your contributions are tax-deductible - the United States Chinese Culture Center (USCCC) is a tax-exempt non-profit organization)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t monetarily contribute to my campaign right now, I completely understand. If you’re still interested in helping me, please spread the word! Tell your friends, family, colleagues, or even a random stranger about my goal and share my campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, Google+, or whatever other social media you may use :)

 

If you have read my campaign, shared it, contributed, or in some way helped it, thank you so much! Whomever you may be—family, friend, friend of a friend, classmate, professor, stranger, mentor, or acquaintance—I sincerely thank and appreciate you for helping me get that much closer to my goals and dreams. I will be consistently updating this campaign throughout my experience before, during, and after my travels in China, sharing my experiences and keeping you updated throughout my journey. I will also be frequently posting on Instagram (demetrisavas) and other social media networks so please follow and join me on my journey overseas!

Thanks and cheers :)

Demetri Savas

If you have any comments, questions, or advice about me, this campaign, or the short documentary I will be filming while overseas, please feel free to contact me at dtsavas@gmail.com

Instagram: demetrisavas

Facebook: Demetri Savas

Twitter: supreme916

LinkedIn: Demetri Savas

story:
Short Summary

SpellBound is a mobile app that turns paper books into virtual popup books.

We bring your favorite childhood book characters to life, allowing them to talk and materialize in 3D. How do we do this? With magic. And a little bit of augmented reality technology.

It’s simple: launch the SpellBound app and hold a smartphone to the pages of a paper book just like a camera and you’ll see the book come alive. 


With the SpellBound mobile app, children can interact with characters, listen as the story is read aloud, and touch words to hear definitions.

When the camera recognizes the page, the SpellBound app can read the story to the child. This is a sample from Sleep Sweet being read by the author, Julianne DiBlasi Black:


When the camera recognizes a word, the SpellBound app can read a definition and show an image to help improve comprehension:

What we want to do

We want to get kids using SpellBound as soon as possible. We want teachers to bring it into classrooms, parents to bring it into homes, and hospitals to use it with children who are patients.

Therapists like Child Life Specialists use technology to help kids understand and deal with emotional challenges that come with hospitalization. SpellBound can play a role in distracting during painful procedures, helping kids cope with stressful situations, and entertaining children in isolation. This is why, as part of our campaign, you can donate books and the SpellBound app to C.S. Mott Children's Hospital.

What we need

We need $8000 to:

  1. Create augmented reality experiences for two books
  2. Finish the iOS and Android app
  3. Purchase paper copies of the books to donate

Stretch Goals


About the Books

When you donate, you get to choose from these awesome books:

After you place your order, we will contact you by email and get your book selections, when appropriate.

Why it matters

We want kids to understand and remember what they read. SpellBound supports literacy skill development in fun ways. Our mission is to help kids develop a lifelong love of reading and books.

About SpellBound

We are a small team in Ann Arbor, Michigan and we are passionate about using the technology kids love to engage them with paper books.


As seen in...

Xconomy, January 12, 2016
Crowdfunding Cast, January 5, 2016

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Try SpellBound and give us feedback
  • Talk about us on social media. Preferrably something nice!
  • Sign up for our newsletter: getspellboundbooks.com

THANK YOU!

We will keep you posted about the campaign progress and the difference your contribution has made. Look for an email from Christina!

And a little bit of augmented reality technology.It’s simple: launch the SpellBound app and hold a smartphone to the pages of a paper book just like a camera and you’ll see the book come alive. 



With the SpellBound mobile app, children can interact with characters, listen as the story is read aloud, and touch words to hear definitions.
When the camera recognizes the page, the SpellBound app can read the story to the child. This is a sample from Sleep Sweet being read by the author, Julianne DiBlasi Black:

When the camera recognizes a word, the SpellBound app can read a definition and show an image to help improve comprehension:

What we want to do

We want to get kids using SpellBound as soon as possible. We want teachers to bring it into classrooms, parents to bring it into homes, and hospitals to use it with children who are patients.

Therapists like Child Life Specialists use technology to help kids understand and deal with emotional challenges that come with hospitalization. SpellBound can play a role in distracting during painful procedures, helping kids cope with stressful situations, and entertaining children in isolation. This is why, as part of our campaign, you can donate books and the SpellBound app to C.S. Mott Children's Hospital.

What we need



We need $8000 to:



Create augmented reality experiences for two books


Finish the iOS and Android app


Purchase paper copies of the books to donate






Stretch Goals


About the Books

When you donate, you get to choose from these awesome books:

After you place your order, we will contact you by email and get your book selections, when appropriate.
Why it matters

We want kids to understand and remember what they read. SpellBound supports literacy skill development in fun ways. Our mission is to help kids develop a lifelong love of reading and books.


About SpellBound
We are a small team in Ann Arbor, Michigan and we are passionate about using the technology kids love to engage them with paper books.








As seen in...

Xconomy, January 12, 2016

Crowdfunding Cast, January 5, 2016


Other Ways You Can Help


 




Try SpellBound and give us feedback

Talk about us on social media. Preferrably something nice!
Sign up for our newsletter: getspellboundbooks.com


THANK YOU!We will keep you posted about the campaign progress and the difference your contribution has made. Look for an email from Christina!

story:
Who are we?

Claude Gagnon is a teacher in special education and Anne-Marie Belley is an occupational therapist. We have traveled to Guatemala several times in the past, living directly with local families, and saw how young adults struggle to meet their daily needs. We saw firsthand that many of them did not have the opportunity to access education or workforce. We could see that the lack of this basic right perpetuated the vicious cycle of poverty and social exclusion.

What are we aiming for?

It touched us so much, that we decided to reflect on how we could better help them with our respective professions. Since many youth lack technical skills usually acquired in school, such as operating a computer, accounting, communicating with others, they often face the barrier of not having the pre-requisites needed when comes the time to look for an employment with stable conditions. Therefore, we created the project to develop an intensive, free practical training that would allow them to learn the skills that are needed to become autonomous and enter the labor market by the end of their training.

To fund this free education, we will be offering people to travel within the school’s site; as such, they are going to see how the school operates, how the money is being used and provide an opportunity to the students to put into practice the knowledge and skills acquired during their training.

In this perspective, travelers will visit the country being guided by the students themselves, who will be learning to value and use the resources of their country. During their training, the students will learn practical skills such as fishing, cooking, gardening and communicating in English and French, amongst many others. All these learnings aim to enable them to welcome the visitors, but also to prepare their transition towards autonomy at the end of their training.

Indeed, they will get to choose by the end of their training one of the skills they had been taught and develop a plan to use this skill to make a living out of it. Within the school, we will have a budget that will allocate small loans to the students who would need to purchase equipment, tool, to enable them to start their entrepreneurship project, and the loans will be given back when their incomes will allow them to do so, and will be redistributed to the future students.

 

In summary, our goal is to help students learn practical skills, open to others, gain confidence in themselves and others, in order to take control of their living situations and become active citizens of their community.

 

What’s the next step?

We are currently doing a promotional trip from Canada to Guatemala to meet people, spread the word about our project and create connections and partnerships to build a strong team to support the development of our project.

Once we get to Guatemala, our goal is to buy a land in the South-Western of Guatemala in order to begin the construction of the school and receive the first cohort of students and travelers planned for of 2017. The estimated cost for a land of a 100 000 feet square is US $50,000$ in Guatemala. We need this space to build a central building for the school, administration office and cafeteria, another one to lodge the students, the travelers and a garden to grow vegetables and fruits. We are also planning on adding more buildings (eg. accommodation for volunteers, workshop for mechanic tasks, outside common spaces) in further steps of the project.

The second step for which we also need financial support is to build a central building for the classroom, a pavilion to lodge the students and a second one to lodge the travelers. Considering the costs of construction in Guatemala, we estimate that the costs will be US $50,000$. Once we earn this money, we will be able to operate the school and touristic activities, and get another source of income to be as independent as possible financially.

If we do not reach our complete objective, we will use the funds to make a deposit, or purchase, the land, and build a basic classroom to achieve our objective of having our first cohort of students at the end of 2017. In this case, travelers could still visit us, but they would be lodge in hotels nearby the school’s site and accommodations for them would be built later on.

How can you help us get there?

We offer you a wide range of options in how you can support us, including direct communications with us, gifts for culture lovers that will make you discoure bits and pièces of Guatemala, camping gear for the more adventurous ones and other forms of direct contributions to the school. 

We want to make sure that this counterparts can somehow show you how much your donations and support are appreciated and helpful to us. 

Everything helps!

If you aren’t able to help financially, we would truly appreciate your help in passing this campaign on to people you know. Use the awesome Indiegogo share tools or just forward the link to your friends https://igg.me/at/i23

 

Together we can make a difference in these young adult’s lives!

 

Make sure to follow us

  • directly on our website at www.i23.ca
  • or on social media Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/i23org
  • and Twitter: https://twitter.com/i23org

-------------------

Qui sommes-nous?

Claude Gagnon est enseignant en éducation spécialisée et Anne-Marie Belley est ergothérapeute. Nous avons séjourné à de multiples reprises au Guatemala, directement dans des familles dans diverses communautés, et avons pu voir comment les jeunes adultes peinent à combler leurs besoins quotidiens. Nous avons constaté que plusieurs d'entre eux n'avaient pas l'opportunité d'aller à l'école ou d'avoir un emploi stable. Nous avons pu voir que ce manquement à ce droit de base perpétuait le cycle vicieux de la pauvreté et de l'exclusion sociale.

Quel est notre objectif?

Nous avons tellement été touchés que nous avons décidé de réfléchir sur la meilleure manière de leur venir en aide, considérant nos professions respectives. Étant donné que plusieurs jeunes n'ont pas les compétences techniques normalement aquises à l'école, par exemple comment utiliser un ordinateur, parler en anglais, faire de la comptabilité, ils se retrouvent souvent face à l'obstacle de na pas avoir les pré-requis nécessaires quand vient le temps de trouver un emploi décent, aux conditions stables. C'est dans ce contexte qu'est né notre projet projet de développer une formation gratuite, pratique et intensive leur permettant d'acquérir les compétences nécessaires à devenir autonomes et à accéder au marché du travail dès la fin de leur formation.

Pour financer cette éducation gratuite, nous offrirons aux gens de voyager avec nous sur le site même de l'école; ils verront ainsi la manière dont l'école fonctionne et leur argent, utilisé, et fourniront aux étudiants l'opportunité de mettre en pratique les connaissances et compétences enseignées au cours de leur formation.

Dans cette perspective, les voyageurs visiteront le pays en étant guidés par les étudiants eux-mêmes, qui apprendront ainsi à valoriser et à utiliser les ressources de leur pays. Au cours de leur fomation, les étudiants apprendront des compétences pratiques telles que communiquer en anglais et en français, à pêcher, à cuisiner, à jardiner, etc. Tous ces apprentissages ont pour objectif de les habiliter à recevoir les visiteurs, mais également à préparer leur transition vers le marché du travail à la fin de leur formation.

En effet, les étudiants choisiront avant la fin de leur formation l'une des compétences qui leur aura été enseignée et développeront un plan pour utiliser cette compétence pour en faire une profession. À l'intérieur même de l'école, nous avons un budget pour attribuer des prêts aux étudiants pour leur permettre de se procurer les outils, l'équipement requis pour entreprendre leur projet d'entrepreunariat. Une entente signée par l'administration de l'école et les étudiants déterminera que le prêt sera remboursé lorsque leurs revenus leur permettont de le faire, et les remboursements seront redistribués parmi les futurs étudiants.

En résumé, notre objectif est d'aider les étudiants à apprendre des compétences pratiques, à s'ouvrir aux autres, à gagner de la confiance en eux-mêmes et en les autres, ainsi qu'à prendre le contrôle de leur situation et à devenir des citoyens actifs de leur communauté.

Quelle est l'étape suivante?

Nous effectuons en ce moment un voyage promotionnel, du Canada au Guatemala, pour rencontrer des gens, passer le mot sur notre projet et créer des connections et des partenariats pour bâtir une équipe solide pour soutenir le développement du projet.

Une fois arrivés au Guatemala, notre objectif est d'acheter un terrain dans le Sud-Ouest du Guatemala afin de commencer la construction de l'école et recevoir notre première cohorte d'étudiants et de voyageurs prévue pour la fin de 2017. Le coût estimé pour un terrain d'environ 100 000 pieds carré est de US $50,000 au Guatemala. Nous avons besoin d'un terrain de cette taille pour construire un bâtiment central pour l'école, les bureaux de l'administration et une cafétéria, un second pour loger les étudiants et un autre pour les voyageurs, ainsi qu'un jardin pour cultiver des légumes et des fruits. Nous prévoyons également ajouter d'autres bâtiments (ex.: pavillon pour accueillir les volontaires, atelier dédié aux tâches mécaniques, espaces extérieurs communs), dans les prochaines ultérieures du projet.

La deuxième étape du projet, pour laquelle nous nécessitons également un support financier, est de construire le bâtiment central pour l'école, et deux pavillons, soit un pour loger les étudiants et le second pour loger les voyageurs. Considérant les coûts de construction au Guatemala, nous estimons que les coûts pour cette étape seront de US$50,000.

Lorsque nous aurons atteint notre objectif, nous serons en mesure de mettre en oeuvre nos activités académiques et touristiques, et ainsi avoir une source de revenus afin d'être aussi autonome financièrement que possible.

Si nous n'atteignons pas notre objectif, nous utiliserons les fonds récoltés pour faire un dépôt pour le terrain, ou en faire l'achat dépendamment du montant collecté, et pour construire une salle de classe de base pour atteindre nos objectif d'avoir notre première cohorte d'éducation à la fin de l'année 2017. Dans ce cas, nous serons toujours en mesure d'accueillir des visiteurs, mais ces derniers seront logés dans des hôtels près du site de l'école, et les bâtiments pour eux seront construits plus tard.

Comment pouvez-nous aider à y arriver?

Nous offrons une diversité d'options sur la façon dont vous pouvez nous offrir votre support, incluant des communications directes avec nous, des cadeaux pour les amoureux de culture qui vous feront découvrir le Guatemala, de l'équipement de camping pour les plus aventureux et d'autres formes de contributions directes pour l'école.

Nous voulons être certains que nos contreparties peuvent d'une manière ou d'une autre vous démontrer combien vos contributions et votre support sont appréciés, et aidants pour nous!

Tout aide!

Si vous n'êtes pas en mesure de nous aider financièrement, nous apprécierions grandement si vous pouviez passer le mot sur notre campagne aux gens que vous connaissez. Utilisez les superbes outils de partage d'Indiegogo ou transférez simplement le lien suivant à vos amis: https://igg.me/at/i23

Ensemble nous pouvons faire une différence dans la vie de ces jeunes adultes!

Assurez-vous de nous suivre:

directement sur notre site web au: www.i23.ca

via les réseaux sociaux:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/i23org

Twitter: https://twitter.com/i23org

Thank you for everything you do.

Anne-Marie Belley & Claude Gagnon

story:
Why

WiredNomads is an unconventional web documentary aiming to understand the new generation’s way of living; a location independent generation of Millennials who exploit technology, and diffused internet access to perform their job. A generation escaping the 9 to 5, Monday to Friday framework to create new employment rules. This is a generation on the verge of a new world. A world where all products become services, where experiences are worth more than money and where personal relationships are nurtured through the web. WiredNomads tells the life of this new generation in an innovative and interactive way through the power of live video and social media to spread the messages of this new way of living.

Investing in us means taking part in an incredible project and a life-changing adventure. We want to take you across Asia's hottest innovation hubs. You'll have the chance to shape our trip, ask live questions and talk directly to us. We packed our bags for you, you'll visit South East Asia's entrepreneurial scene together with us from the comfort of your own home. 

We have the network and the skills to access places that no-one else can. Join our trip and help us spread our message! 

Who

Marcello: 
Current life as: freelance tech journalist (TechCrunch, Wired at al), runs one of the biggest tech meetups in London, and a co-living space for entrepreneurs. 

Previous life as: TEDx Speaker, Entrepreneur, market developer, marketing manager, traveler.
more on marcellomari.com

Message: Anyone can and should travel. Travel is a form of education. There are now many ways of making money whilst traveling to sustain yourself. By lowering your own cost of living you can invest more in your own education also through online courses, whilst making unforgettable experiences, meeting incredible people, generating news ideas and connecting with world-changing entrepreneurs and creatives. 

Nadine:
Current life as: traveling entrepreneur, business consultant, digital storyteller, trend explorer.

Past life: Market developer, business strategist, world traveler and marathon runner.

Message: The digital era has changed our lives and given us unlimited freedom of mobility. It enables us to explore different places on the planet whilst working in and learning from other cultures and connecting with people around the world. This beauty of education has become an integral part of our professional lives - working in international teams, creating work for a business abroad or internationalising your business. 

Notes: 
We are not a couple :) We are friends that met in London sharing the same passions and interests, with the mission of inspiring people to take on this new lifestyle.
We speak English, German and Italian! 

How

We are going to interview locals as well as traveling entrepreneurs, making live videos to broadcast their experiences.  We will collect all this information with the help of our extensive network that we have established over a number of years.  Our backers and our community will get the chance to deep dive into this new world in a completely different way, through our own eyes and also be able to repeat the same travel experiences.


Where

We chose to travel to South East Asia for our project because startup hubs such as Jakarta, Bangkok, and Ho-Chi-Minh City are prospering and growing fast; being a lucrative alternative for relocation to London, NYC or Israel. Costs of living are super low, a good infrastructure is present, and local investors are eyeing up Western entrepreneurs for opportunities. Not to mention the beaches and adventures that come with this! All of these elements together make South East Asia the ideal location for Wired Nomads Entrepreneurs! 

Channels

Our ‘homes’ will be our blogs: www.wirednomads.com (We are currently building it). We'll publish research content and live interviews. We'll harness the power of social media, live videos and blogging to spread our message.

Sponsors/ Funding

This is a super exciting project and we can already count on sponsors like GoPro and SquareSpace.

But we need YOUR HELP in order to do our project on a daily basis: transportation between meetings and cities, research material and accommodation. We have the contacts, the interpersonal skills to connect with people and an eagle eye on cool startups and entrepreneurs!

We just need your help to put our project into reality. Help us to fund our project by donating to our campaign and by sharing our story through your social channels.

Every little helps. Thanks so much!

Join our trip and help us spread our message! WhoMarcello: Current life as: freelance tech journalist (TechCrunch, Wired at al), runs one of the biggest tech meetups in London, and a co-living space for entrepreneurs. Previous life as: TEDx Speaker, Entrepreneur, market developer, marketing manager, traveler.more on marcellomari.comMessage: Anyone can and should travel. Travel is a form of education. There are now many ways of making money whilst traveling to sustain yourself. By lowering your own cost of living you can invest more in your own education also through online courses, whilst making unforgettable experiences, meeting incredible people, generating news ideas and connecting with world-changing entrepreneurs and creatives. Nadine:Current life as: traveling entrepreneur, business consultant, digital storyteller, trend explorer.Past life: Market developer, business strategist, world traveler and marathon runner.Message: The digital era has changed our lives and given us unlimited freedom of mobility. It enables us to explore different places on the planet whilst working in and learning from other cultures and connecting with people around the world. This beauty of education has become an integral part of our professional lives - working in international teams, creating work for a business abroad or internationalising your business. Notes: We are not a couple :) We are friends that met in London sharing the same passions and interests, with the mission of inspiring people to take on this new lifestyle.We speak English, German and Italian! HowWe are going to interview locals as well as traveling entrepreneurs, making live videos to broadcast their experiences.  We will collect all this information with the help of our extensive network that we have established over a number of years.  Our backers and our community will get the chance to deep dive into this new world in a completely different way, through our own eyes and also be able to repeat the same travel experiences.
Where
We chose to travel to South East Asia for our project because startup hubs such as Jakarta, Bangkok, and Ho-Chi-Minh City are prospering and growing fast; being a lucrative alternative for relocation to London, NYC or Israel. Costs of living are super low, a good infrastructure is present, and local investors are eyeing up Western entrepreneurs for opportunities. Not to mention the beaches and adventures that come with this! All of these elements together make South East Asia the ideal location for Wired Nomads Entrepreneurs! ChannelsOur ‘homes’ will be our blogs: www.wirednomads.com (We are currently building it). We'll publish research content and live interviews. We'll harness the power of social media, live videos and blogging to spread our message.Sponsors/ FundingThis is a super exciting project and we can already count on sponsors like GoPro and SquareSpace.But we need YOUR HELP in order to do our project on a daily basis: transportation between meetings and cities, research material and accommodation. We have the contacts, the interpersonal skills to connect with people and an eagle eye on cool startups and entrepreneurs!We just need your help to put our project into reality. Help us to fund our project by donating to our campaign and by sharing our story through your social channels.Every little helps. Thanks so much!

story:
Short Summary

I have been a volunteer at animal shelters for 9 years as well as a professional dog trainer. I have seen so many dogs not make the trip out the front door of the shelter to their new home. As a dog trainer, many times I have been in a situation where the child is close to getting bit by the family dog. 

For years, I knew that I wanted to educate the children, to learn responsibility with dogs, in caring for them and learning how to be safe around them. Creating a higher percentage of pet retention, less abandonment and owner surrender of dogs. 

Your contributions will support creating a safer world for dogs and children to live together and dogs living with knowledgeable owners. 

The monies will be used for social media, marketing and supplies.

Please consider sharing this campaign, the more children we impact, the more dogs lives we impact.

story:
Short Summary

Two years ago when David and I got married, we raised many eyebrows.

The two worlds we come from couldn’t be farther apart—geographically and culturally—yet in love we found a way to bring them together. Today, we look around and see anger, fear, and division between good people everywhere. We stand divided, not united.

It doesn’t have to be this way. We have found the secret to inspiring people through our successful social enterprise, The Chai Spot. We engage people with the bright colors, flavors, and hospitality of Pakistan. We empower people's imaginations through diversity.

We are taking this powerful tool and launching a national Peace, Love, and Chai tour!

So for the next 11 months we are traveling this great country and helping to bind the wounds we suffered this past year. By sharing all of our stories with each other over an enchanting cup of tea, we hope to remind people how our differences strengthen each other not diminish the other. 

How will it work?

- We map out states and cities to visit, share them along with a calendar

- Buy a truck that tows a little food trailer for the chai and products made with love by women in Pakistan 

- We begin work with women in small villages of Sindh and Balochistan in Pakistan to bring their handmade treasures to sell along with the chai

- We buy a second hand food trailer 

- We host a community event in Sedona to paint the trailer in traditional Pakistani truck art! (More about it here: http://www.mangobaaz.com/pakistan-truck-art-aro...)

- We take off. Going to towns in selected states and cities and meet people at social, religious and educational gathering, have productive discussions and find common ground 

- We report back about true humans, their true stories and their experiences of America present day 

- We change mindsets, support women in Pakistan, send children to school and more than anything, start a discussion of love and co-existence that needs a little nudge 

We can't do this without you 

If division is not what you want to see in this country, in this world, help us to give voice to your frustration. You can do something about this sad state of affairs by giving us the tools to help bring about the positive change we all want to see!

In the past year and a half, The Chai Spot has already opened two brick-and-mortar locations in Arizona. So many lives have been touched, imaginations stimulated, hearts and minds opened over a hot cup of aromatic, traditional South Asian chai. We now plan to take this magic on the road to communities that have too little exposure to the authentic reality of the other side of the world, to the joy, the songs, the flavors, the dance, the warmth and the kindness that awaits them. We need your help!

Your financial contribution will make it happen. Among other things, we need equipment and help covering our expenses.

The equipment we need:

  • A Second Hand Concession trailer ~$4,000
  • Appliances (including generator, refrigerators, and stoves) ~$2,000

Our estimated monthly expenses include:

  • Fuel ~$750 
  • Food ~$600
  • Motels (4 nights per month as per requirement) ~$280
  • Incidentals ~$100

Our estimated monthly expenses come to $1,730, for a total of $19,030, plus $6,000 for equipment for a grand total of $25,030.

Any funds we raise that don’t go directly into this campaign we will use to send underprivileged children in Pakistan to good schools, and to women entrepreneurs who want to change their families' lives for the better.

The Impact

When our guests enjoy a cup of chai at The Chai Spot, they are awakening the beauty of cultural co-existence while at the same time making a difference in the lives of women and children in Pakistan.

Your contribution is supporting:

  • Cultural co-existence in the United States and Globally 
  • Women’s economic empowerment in small villages in Pakistan 

In the past year and a half we have raised enough funds to provide about 5 women entrepreneurs with start-up grants, sent 3 children to school, and open a school for 160 children in Balochistan. And that's just the beginning!

Risks & Challenges

We understand that initiatives like these come with their own risks, we will meet people who are afraid of the newness of what we are doing, people who do not like our point of view or people who simply do not want to discuss their beliefs. We also know that living out of the back of a pickup truck is not easy, showering at rest stops, being on the road for long stretches, these all take their toll. But the joy we get from seeing someone’s worldview expand before our eyes makes it all worthwhile.

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your help to make this happen. If you are unable to support us financially, then host us at your home. Or even better, join us on the road! Or volunteer with us! We could use help from lawyers, graphic designers, bloggers, activists, to happy people who just want to make this world a better place.

Please spread the word about this campaign. The success of this mission relies on your support!

With our deepest gratitude, 

Khalida and David Brohi Barron 

*credit to Humans of New York for the picture of men on a boat in Pakistan

story:
Who are we?

Blacksheep.rs is a group of young enthusiastic people who created their own corner in virtual space where the most important thing is what one feels and thinks. From the small blog in the beginning we developed into a sanctuary where we found something that we are all missing today – a feeling of closeness and meaning. We've been enabling young poets, writers, and bloggers for three years now,as well as the other more or less affirmed artists, to make their first steps, present their creativity on our platform, and make themselves known to the world.

 

The things we aspire to:

Stepping out into the world for a young artist can be quite disturbing and one is faced with many difficulties such as: a lack of recognition, seeking for self-confirmation, not enough information about what to do and whom to talk to in order to develop and grow, accepting the critics, and facing the public. And that's why we would like to provide them with physical space – a place where they could gather, meet, exchange information, recognize each other's talents, actualize their ideas, and share their dreams. The place is primarily intended for our longtime coworkers, but all young artists who wish to begin, promote, and perfect their creative work are more than welcome to join us. The idea is to use every inch of the space in order to make it a place where exchanging goes on both individual and group level, which basically means using it up for special exhibitions, workshops, multifunctional co-working space where public discussions and meetings would be held, as well as the site redaction headquarters.

 

Why?

Because we think it's important to draw our community's attention to people who write extraordinary texts, and poetry, and haven't been acknowledged by the public yet. We want to incite the public, and draw their attention to verbal and cyber bullying.

Why us?                                              

Because of our three years' work experience on blacksheep.rs site, which is edited by a journalist, professors and students of literature; more than 3500 texts in the area of culture, literature, and blogs; cooperation with about 300 authors from Serbia and its surrounding countries; 22 000 followers; companionship with artists from different fields; two charity activities; four literary contests; participation in festivals; cooperation with highschools, and similar portals, organizations, and media. And we've accomplished all this due to our own effort and enthusiasm solely on a voluntary basis. Now we would like to take it a step further and enter the offline world as well in order to create a physical space for further work and develompent.

What have we done so far?

Well, we've partially managed to collect means for our goal achievement. Superste program of Erste Bank in cooperation with Dukukino Foundation recognized this project as an important and necessary one, and thus gave us a donation for renting the place and holding some of the activities for the next six months.

Now we need your help to renovate and furnish the place. We need:

  • 2 heating devices

  • Lighting

  • Furniture

  • Sound system (4 speakers, a mixing console, 2 microphones)

  • Projector

  • Whiteboard

  • Transport and handyman services

  • Material for creative, and educational workshops (paper, crayons, felt-tip pens, markers...)

  • Promotional material

 

If you can't contribute?

If you can't join our campaign with a contribution you can still help us by sharing our campaign with your friends in your your social media!

THANK YOU!

HVALA!

 

 

Some Black Sheep perks :

story:
SMART MAGICAL GLOWING TOY PILLOW FOR COLORING

 

Designed and manufactured in the EU

Campaign overview:

SMART MAGICAL GLOWING TOY PILLOW FOR COLORING is probably the coolest multi-functional skill developing toy on this planet! Upon receiving it, your children will be delighted by this purchase!

This color shifting, glowing toy pillow can be colored in with a set of water removable felt-tip markers and is linked to an online portal containing stories, fairy tales, contests and drawing video lessons for each toy.

Everything is straightforward and accessible, so that any person in the world of any age and skill set will be able to participate in this project on their own.  

We are excited to present it to you first, see your shining eyes and the cheerful smiles of children who are waiting to embark on this magical adventure with us.

SMART MAGICAL GLOWING TOY PILLOW FOR COLORING is a coloring “book” which seamlessly combines light shows and a great learning platform with entertaining content into one of the best skill-developing gift on the market. Every product (t-shirt, cup etc.) is an exclusive invitation to this entertainingly learning platform designed to expand the initial creative skills of your children. Our toy pillows and other products are made in such a ways, so that they can be colored over and over again thanks to special water removable markers, which can be washed off even with cold water.

We've spent a lot of time trying to solve a complex task. Our goal was to combine elementary and middle school alumni fun and learning experience in one product. We wanted to inspire them to expand on their own imagination from an early age and motivate them in developing their creative skills. We've succeeded in this monumental challenge, found a unique solution and presenting it to you right now. Our fantastic invention will help your child to acquire initial creative skills straight from the hands of professionals.

Children love new toys, so more often than not, our toys become that one thing that always accompanies them throughout the day. It can start during early breakfast and end on prolonged evening journeys, mesmerizing them with its' bright lights.

Our toy pillows are designed as a system of drawing lessons, sending children and their parents into the world of fantasies and fairy tales, where we are providing all the essentials for creative activities and training complemented with vivid emotional content. We've also included a long series of animated video guides on where to start and how to proceed using a variety of drawing supplies. These series of lessons are already being made and tested on our platform.

Currently, a variety of coloring t-shirts and ceramic cups are available as a set only. However, they will be available separately in the near future. Every single piece was made with love and for the sole purpose of helping your beloved children to obtain or expand their creative skills. They will have the independent ability to engage in art activities at any time during the day. Your children will be able to create fairy tales, short stories or write poems whilst coloring their favorite characters. The platform will be accessible via special QR codes attached to all of our products or printed directly on a picture. In addition, we are providing black and white A4 sheet sized paper versions of drawings for training purposes. You will be able to print them out and enjoy artistic work anytime, anywhere, completely for free.

 

”Butterfly” Painting Lesson - Felt-trip pen  DEMO 10min - full version 40min.

 Press Play for preview.

”Butterfly” DEMO Painting Lesson - Water paints 10min - full version 40min. 

Press Play for preview.

 

 

Author of the project and the story of its creation:

These pillows and our other products are based on 12 unique Upside Down illustrations and 24 magic fairy tales created by Valerij Shatunov: designer, animator, master painter and author who is famous in more than 15 countries for his breathtaking illustrations in books for children. Valerij Shatunov created unique shapeshifting illustrations exclusively for this project.

He spent a total of 27 years creating these pieces and there isn't anything like it in this world to this day. The illustrations are so unique, they were registered as a record in the official Lithuania Records Database for having four different illustrations in one painting at once.

All of the paintings glow in the dark and can be turned Upside Down by revealing several hidden characters inside.

A long time ago the author has undergone a journey from a simple apprentice to who he is now, learning art under the guidance of his father Victor Shatunov: world famous illustrator of books for children. As of today, he is using his skills and talent, joined with his accumulated invaluable experience in various fields, for the benefit of your children. Thanks to his experience and drawing lessons, Valerij himself became widely recognized in various countries of the world as a professional in the field of art and creativity.

 

“Funny Bear Smile"  Upside down “Cat"  

Black light & full dark – "Upside down glowing Flying Fish” & "Upside down glowing Flying Fish Kiss”

​

To make it even more interesting for your children, he created a fairy tale for each of the toys, which you will be able to listen to with your mobile devices in both audio and video formats, or read it to your child to sleep directly from the platform’s page. Additionally, you'll have a unique opportunity to create your very own fairy tales or poems for characters on your toy pillows and publish it on our platform so that it is visible to everyone.  You and your kids can also become participants in our competitions and contests.

Additional surprises in the project

It is expected that in the later stages, our stories and fairy tales will be written and voiced by famous celebrities from all over the world in different languages. We are happy to announce that we have already received verbal consent from various artists who are willing to take part in the project. 

We have studied the behavior and interests of children for a very long time in order to create and perfect our educational system.

The implementation of this project can become the start of a series of incredible, revolutionary educational projects, the first of its kind.

The implementation of this project can commence new beginnings with these revolutionary educational projects.

Our aim:

We hope to spread our project worldwide and win your hearts and the hearts of your children by teaching them how to expand their imagination and improving their creativity, regardless of age, gender or language. This way, we are attempting to unite kids from all over the world to engage in fun and artistic projects.

We separated all of our packages into themes. Once this project is launched, we plan to create new themes regularly. Variety of products and video lessons will be included for each specific theme. We estimate that these series will have over 200 different themes.

Furthermore, we will implement a feature allowing you to create your very own toy pillow using a combination of various drawings and images in our system as a bonus in later stages of the project.

There are 3 different options of toy pillows to choose from:

Classic shapeRound, ellipse shape

Shaped as a drawing

Water removable felt-tip markers and other art supplies

Our kits come with a set of special markers, which can be easily washed off using your washing machine. Our toy pillows and other products are designed to be colored multiple times, over and over again. Even a light rinse of cold water will be enough to wash the pillow clean and get it ready for more coloring action!

It’s expected that once our project commences its' development we will expand our offers with different art supplies and detailed guides on how to use them properly. We have pending art supplies on our list, too. This includes: watercolor pencils, clay, crayons, colored pencils, regular and watercolor paints, gouache, modeling clay, paints and crayons for body art, variety of decors and many other tools for you kids.

All of our packages will have a special QR code located at the back, providing access to our platform, where you will be directed to new lessons and master classes on how these tools can expand your creative potential. We have also started the development sets of absolutely new tools that have never been seen before. They will be available soon.

Today, we are happy to reveal our first 3 themes for our Toy Pillows. The reasons for selecting these particular three themes are the following:

1. 27 years ago, these were the very first themes created that served as the starting point of our glowing journey.

2. Specifically these themes were registered as a record in the official Lithuania Records Database for having four different illustrations in one painting at once.

3. These themes are perfect for your child's initial creative development.


Our Team

The value of our team is long and productive years of professional experience in various fields. We explore the world around us and are in constant hunt for opportunities to give you the pleasure to behold latest products and contemporary directions. To achieve this, we use our utmost experience combining advanced technologies in conjunction with spectacular effects. We always try to create products that bring people pleasure, satisfaction and fascination. We prefer to express and implement our values ​​using art, inviting our children to this wonderful and mesmerizing world of never-ending imagination. Our primarily aim is to teach and to spot the creative potential of every individual. To do this, our team is constantly generating new projects, and we can proudly declare that soon we will show the world our new creations that are already in the process of being created. Creativity never glows out, let's glow together.

Prices and versions of packages:

GLOWING TOY PILLOW FOR COLORING:

(Square, Ellipse, Shape)

€59 EUR discount from €79 ( 25% OFF) (Square, Ellipse)

€69 EUR discount from €89 ( 22% OFF) (Shape)

Contents of the kit for drawing:

  • 1 pc. Glowing toy pillow (9 options to choose from)
  • 1 pc. A set of water removable felt-tip markers.
  • 1 pc. QR code for access to the platform

QR code includes (available online):

  • 1 pc. Black and white picture for training purposes (A4 size sheet for printing)
  • 1 pc. Sample colored picture
  • 1 pc. Video lesson
  • 1 pc. Fairy tale (text format)
  • 1 pc. Fairy tale (audio format)

Theme ”Butterfly” with 3 different shapes to choose from 

Square 11.8'x11.8'in/30х30cm  Ellipse 11.8'x11.8'in/30х30cm  Shape 13.7'x 17.7'in/35х45cm

Theme ”Fish artist” with 3 different shapes to choose from

 

Square 11.8'x11.8'in/30х30cm  Ellipse 11.8'x11.8'in/30х30cm  Shape 13.7'x 17.7'in/35х45cm

Theme ”Cheshire cat - Dreamcatcher” with 3 different shapes to choose from

 

Square 11.8'x11.8'in/30х30cm  Ellipse 11.8'x11.8'in/30х30cm  Shape 13.7'x 17.7'in/35х45cm

THEME Set:

(all items from the same chosen theme)

€109 EUR discount from €149 ( 27% OFF)

Contents of the kit for drawing:

  • 1 pc. Glowing toy pillow (9 options to choose from)
  • 1 pc. Kids' T-shirt (2YO - 12YO sizes to choose from. See sizes table)
  • 1 pc. Ceramic cup
  • 2 pc. A set of water removable felt-tip markers.
  • 1 pc. QR codes for access to the platform

QR code includes (available online):

  • 1 pc. Black and white picture for training purposes (A4 size sheet for printing)
  • 1 pc. Sample colored picture
  • 1 pc. Video lesson
  • 1 pc. Fairy tale (text format)
  • 1 pc. Fairy tale (audio format)

  • Material: 100% Polyester
  • Kids' T-shirt sizes: 2-12 y.o.
  • Sizes table:

x3 MIX Set:

(available to choose 3 different themes)

€149 EUR discount from €199 ( 25% OFF)

Contents of the kit for drawing:

  • 1 pc. Glowing toy pillow (9 options to choose from)
  • 1 pc. Kids' T-shirt (with 3 options, 2YO - 12YO sizes to choose from. See sizes table)
  • 1 pc. Ceramic cup (with 3 options to choose from)
  • 2 pc. A set of water removable felt-tip markers.
  • 3 pc. QR codes for access to the platform

each QR code includes (available online):

  • 1 pc. Black and white picture for training purposes (A4 size sheet for printing)
  • 1 pc. Sample colored picture
  • 1 pc. Video lesson
  • 1 pc. Fairy tale (text format)
  • 1 pc. Fairy tale (audio format)

  • Material: 100% Polyester
  • Kids' T-shirt sizes: 2-12 y.o.
  • Sizes table:

QR codes Set:

(x5 Themes QR codes)

€199 EUR discount from €269 ( 25% OFF)

This can be perfect for ogranizations such: schools, kindergartens, social kids' clubs, etc.. The license of this virtual package will provide access to five different themes where you will receive:

  • 5 pc. QR code to access the platform
  • 5 pc. Black and white picture for training purposes (A4 sized sheet for printing)
  • 5 pc. Sample colored picture
  • 5 pc. Video lesson
  • 5 pc. Fairy tale (text format)
  • 5 pc. Fairy tale (audio format)

Forms of gratitude:

Financial and promotional support of the project

This perk is for those who don't want a toy pillow, but just want to invest in Glowing Fantasy. You will get a big "thank you" in return.

To all those who want to financially support our team and our initiatives in the project at the time of the launch, we will be more than happy to accept financial and promotional aid and support in any amount.

  • Tier   €1   -  €10 Our written gratitude.
  • Tier   €11   -  €100 Receive 1 cup.
  • Tier €101  -  €200 Receive 3 different cups.
  • Tier €201  -  €400 Receive 3 different cups and 3 t-shirts.
  • Tier €401  -  €....... Receive 5 differently themed cups, 5 t-shirts and 5 pillows.

ALL PRODUCTS

 

TIMELINE:

  • 2020.02.28  Launch of the PROJECT on INDIEGOGO.
  • (Launch of advertising campaign and collaborations with bloggers).
  • (Lesson creation and platform development). 
  • 2020.03.31 Test the product.
  • (Packaging and components).
  • 2020.04.30  Campaign finilization.
  • (Initial production and set-up the production lines).
  • (Preparation of all production parts).
  • 2020.05.15   Mass production.
  • (Launch of test batch deliveries).
  • 2020.05.31  Start delivering.
  • 2020.06.30  Product is delivered to your home.

Packaging for toy pillows

Setting up the product:

Once a Toy Pillow is received:

1. Remove packaging.

2. Carefully read the manual of the product.

3. Must have AAA batteries for glowing and shimmering purposes.

4. Insert batteries in the battery sector of the pillow.

5. Turn the switch on and glow.

Before washing you MUST know:

  • Only the pillowcase can be washed.
  • Do NOT attempt to wash the entire pillow.
  • The inner parts of the pillow are not water resistant and will fail if exposed to moisture.
  • Pillowcasing can be washed via washing machine or hand washing under cold water.
  • Make sure the pillowcase is completely dry before reassembling.
  • In case of water exposure to the whole toy, immediately remove batteries and dry the whole product.

BE AWARE, that markers are NOT permanent. Contact between moist surfaces and colored sides, MAY result in stains on: body, textiles, furniture, etc.. However, all of stains CAN be removed with water.

QR code: how to use it and why?

Using you smart device (phone or tablet) and a special app to scan (QR code scanner) you will be able to scan our QR codes and gain access to our platform.

If you're a PC user, you will find a direct link under our QR codes, which you must enter manually into your PC's browser search engine.

You will also have the option to read, view, and print all materials prepared by us in regards to the theme you purchased at no charge.

Registering in the system

You must register as a participant in order to participate in different contests on our platform. You can give feedback, too. Your feedback is very important to us because it will improve and optimize our toys and content. All actions in the system will be carried out only upon confirmation of our administrative group that will personally ensure safety and propriety of all uploaded content for maximized protection of the portal.

STRETCH GOAL

www.shatunov.lt

story_txt:
SMART MAGICAL GLOWING TOY PILLOW FOR COLORING
 Designed and manufactured in the EUCampaign overview:SMART MAGICAL GLOWING TOY PILLOW FOR COLORING is probably the coolest multi-functional skill developing toy on this planet! Upon receiving it, your children will be delighted by this purchase!This color shifting, glowing toy pillow can be colored in with a set of water removable felt-tip markers and is linked to an online portal containing stories, fairy tales, contests and drawing video lessons for each toy.Everything is straightforward and accessible, so that any person in the world of any age and skill set will be able to participate in this project on their own.  We are excited to present it to you first, see your shining eyes and the cheerful smiles of children who are waiting to embark on this magical adventure with us.SMART MAGICAL GLOWING TOY PILLOW FOR COLORING is a coloring “book” which seamlessly combines light shows and a great learning platform with entertaining content into one of the best skill-developing gift on the market. Every product (t-shirt, cup etc.) is an exclusive invitation to this entertainingly learning platform designed to expand the initial creative skills of your children. Our toy pillows and other products are made in such a ways, so that they can be colored over and over again thanks to special water removable markers, which can be washed off even with cold water.We've spent a lot of time trying to solve a complex task. Our goal was to combine elementary and middle school alumni fun and learning experience in one product. We wanted to inspire them to expand on their own imagination from an early age and motivate them in developing their creative skills. We've succeeded in this monumental challenge, found a unique solution and presenting it to you right now. Our fantastic invention will help your child to acquire initial creative skills straight from the hands of professionals.Children love new toys, so more often than not, our toys become that one thing that always accompanies them throughout the day. It can start during early breakfast and end on prolonged evening journeys, mesmerizing them with its' bright lights.Our toy pillows are designed as a system of drawing lessons, sending children and their parents into the world of fantasies and fairy tales, where we are providing all the essentials for creative activities and training complemented with vivid emotional content. We've also included a long series of animated video guides on where to start and how to proceed using a variety of drawing supplies. These series of lessons are already being made and tested on our platform.Currently, a variety of coloring t-shirts and ceramic cups are available as a set only. However, they will be available separately in the near future. Every single piece was made with love and for the sole purpose of helping your beloved children to obtain or expand their creative skills. They will have the independent ability to engage in art activities at any time during the day. Your children will be able to create fairy tales, short stories or write poems whilst coloring their favorite characters. The platform will be accessible via special QR codes attached to all of our products or printed directly on a picture. In addition, we are providing black and white A4 sheet sized paper versions of drawings for training purposes. You will be able to print them out and enjoy artistic work anytime, anywhere, completely for free. ”Butterfly” Painting Lesson - Felt-trip pen  DEMO 10min - full version 40min. Press Play for preview.”Butterfly” DEMO Painting Lesson - Water paints 10min - full version 40min. Press Play for preview.  Author of the project and the story of its creation:These pillows and our other products are based on 12 unique Upside Down illustrations and 24 magic fairy tales created by Valerij Shatunov: designer, animator, master painter and author who is famous in more than 15 countries for his breathtaking illustrations in books for children. Valerij Shatunov created unique shapeshifting illustrations exclusively for this project.He spent a total of 27 years creating these pieces and there isn't anything like it in this world to this day. The illustrations are so unique, they were registered as a record in the official Lithuania Records Database for having four different illustrations in one painting at once.All of the paintings glow in the dark and can be turned Upside Down by revealing several hidden characters inside.A long time ago the author has undergone a journey from a simple apprentice to who he is now, learning art under the guidance of his father Victor Shatunov: world famous illustrator of books for children. As of today, he is using his skills and talent, joined with his accumulated invaluable experience in various fields, for the benefit of your children. Thanks to his experience and drawing lessons, Valerij himself became widely recognized in various countries of the world as a professional in the field of art and creativity. “Funny Bear Smile"  Upside down “Cat"  Black light & full dark – "Upside down glowing Flying Fish” & "Upside down glowing Flying Fish Kiss”​To make it even more interesting for your children, he created a fairy tale for each of the toys, which you will be able to listen to with your mobile devices in both audio and video formats, or read it to your child to sleep directly from the platform’s page. Additionally, you'll have a unique opportunity to create your very own fairy tales or poems for characters on your toy pillows and publish it on our platform so that it is visible to everyone.  You and your kids can also become participants in our competitions and contests.Additional surprises in the projectIt is expected that in the later stages, our stories and fairy tales will be written and voiced by famous celebrities from all over the world in different languages. We are happy to announce that we have already received verbal consent from various artists who are willing to take part in the project. We have studied the behavior and interests of children for a very long time in order to create and perfect our educational system.The implementation of this project can become the start of a series of incredible, revolutionary educational projects, the first of its kind.The implementation of this project can commence new beginnings with these revolutionary educational projects.Our aim:We hope to spread our project worldwide and win your hearts and the hearts of your children by teaching them how to expand their imagination and improving their creativity, regardless of age, gender or language. This way, we are attempting to unite kids from all over the world to engage in fun and artistic projects.We separated all of our packages into themes. Once this project is launched, we plan to create new themes regularly. Variety of products and video lessons will be included for each specific theme. We estimate that these series will have over 200 different themes.Furthermore, we will implement a feature allowing you to create your very own toy pillow using a combination of various drawings and images in our system as a bonus in later stages of the project.There are 3 different options of toy pillows to choose from:Classic shapeRound, ellipse shapeShaped as a drawingWater removable felt-tip markers and other art suppliesOur kits come with a set of special markers, which can be easily washed off using your washing machine. Our toy pillows and other products are designed to be colored multiple times, over and over again. Even a light rinse of cold water will be enough to wash the pillow clean and get it ready for more coloring action!It’s expected that once our project commences its' development we will expand our offers with different art supplies and detailed guides on how to use them properly. We have pending art supplies on our list, too. This includes: watercolor pencils, clay, crayons, colored pencils, regular and watercolor paints, gouache, modeling clay, paints and crayons for body art, variety of decors and many other tools for you kids.All of our packages will have a special QR code located at the back, providing access to our platform, where you will be directed to new lessons and master classes on how these tools can expand your creative potential. We have also started the development sets of absolutely new tools that have never been seen before. They will be available soon.Today, we are happy to reveal our first 3 themes for our Toy Pillows. The reasons for selecting these particular three themes are the following:1. 27 years ago, these were the very first themes created that served as the starting point of our glowing journey.2. Specifically these themes were registered as a record in the official Lithuania Records Database for having four different illustrations in one painting at once.3. These themes are perfect for your child's initial creative development.
Our Team
The value of our team is long and productive years of professional experience in various fields. We explore the world around us and are in constant hunt for opportunities to give you the pleasure to behold latest products and contemporary directions. To achieve this, we use our utmost experience combining advanced technologies in conjunction with spectacular effects. We always try to create products that bring people pleasure, satisfaction and fascination. We prefer to express and implement our values ​​using art, inviting our children to this wonderful and mesmerizing world of never-ending imagination. Our primarily aim is to teach and to spot the creative potential of every individual. To do this, our team is constantly generating new projects, and we can proudly declare that soon we will show the world our new creations that are already in the process of being created. Creativity never glows out, let's glow together.
